instructions: Bring water and sugar to a boil on small saucepan. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add lavender and ginger. Let steep 1 hour. Strain lavender and ginger from syrup and set aside until ready to use. Can be made ahead and stored in airtight container up to 2 weeks.

Place ice in blender. Pulse on setting 2 (chop) 6-8 times. Add vodka, lemon juice, 1/3 cup lavender-ginger syrup and mint. Blend on setting 5 (liquify) 1 minute. Serve immediately with fresh lavender sprigs, if desired.

name: Cajun Chicken, Sausage & Pasta Skillet

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 pound boneless skinless chicken breast halves

ingredients.name: sweet italian sausag links, cut into
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 pound sweet italian sausag links, cut into

ingredients.prep: frozen cut, or sliced okra, thawed
ingredients.name: green beans
ingredients.fullName: 10 ounces green beans (frozen cut, or sliced okra, thawed)

instructions: Season chicken with cayenne pepper and, if desired, salt.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken and sausage, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until chicken and sausage are thoroughly cooked. Remove and set aside.

Heat additional 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet over medium heat and cook red peppers, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes or until tender. Add green beans and water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in Knorr® Pasta Sides™ - Butter and return to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium and cook covered, stirring occasionally, 6 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in chicken and sausage and serve immediately.

name: Black Bean Chili
instructions: Defrost Stouffers Stuffed Peppers.

In a large saucepot over a medium heat, heat the olive oil and sauté the garlic, onions and spices until the onions are soft and translucent (about 5 minutes). Add the meat and sauce from the Stouffer’s Peppers.
Chop the green peppers from the Stouffers Stuffed Peppers into smaller bite sized pieces and add them to the saucepot.
Add black beans into pot and stir to combine well.
Add the salt and pepper and reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
To serve, ladle the chili into 4 bowls, and top each with ¼ of the cheese, green onions and jalapeño.

name: Goat Cheese Choux Buns
instructions: Preheat oven to 410F
In the food processor, mix puff pastry with cold water and beat with the flexible mixer for 4 minutes.
Place the dough in a piping bag, and squeeze out the desired shape on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake on the bottom shelf of the oven for 10 to 15 minutes depending on the size of the buns.
Remove from oven and let cool.
Chop apricots and mix with 60 grams of goat cheese in a bowl.
In another bowl, mix the rest of the goat cheese with a few drops of hot sauce.
Cut off the top of the buns, and add mixture of choice.
Refrigerate.

name: Steamed Tout With Pepper Mousse
instructions: 1. Mix 1 table spoon of olive oil with paprika, cumin, salt and pepper.
2. Marinate fish in the olive & spice mixture.
3. Steam trout and pepper about 16 minutes.
4. Chop cherry tomatoes, mix with olive oil, thyme and oregano.
5. Blend pepper and cream.
6. Serve steamed trout over orange pepper mousse and top with cherry tomatoes salsa.

name: Balsamic and Peach Chicken Skillet

ingredients.name: Tyson® Frozen Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh Strips
ingredients.fullName: 8 Tyson® Frozen Boneless Skinless Chicken Thigh Strips

instructions: In skillet add 1 tbsp. olive oil and 2 tbsp. chicken stock, place chicken in pan and season with salt and pepper. Turn on heat to medium and place lid over skillet. Turning occasionally, cook for 10 to 15 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 170.
While chicken cooks prepare salsa by slicing tomatoes, juicing lemon and dicing peach and cilantro. Combine well and lightly season with salt to taste.
When chicken is cooked, remove from pan and cover. Reduce heat to low and add onions, sauté 2-3 minutes or until translucent.
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add rest of ingredients and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Serve sauce over chicken and top with peach and tomato salsa and fresh herbs.

name: Clemetine-Orange Curd
instructions: Squeeze the citrus fruits and put the juice in a saucepan.
On low heat, dissolve the cornstarch in the juice and add the sugar.
Add the beaten eggs and simmer until the curd has thickened. Stir continuously.
Pour in a jar and cool.
Refrigerate.

name: Raspberry Yogurt Bread
instructions: Beat the eggs, add the sugar little by little and then the flour, salt, baking powder and oil.  Add the yogurt little by little while continuing to mix the batter.
Gently fold in the raspberries.
Grease and flour two baking pans, divide the batter evenly between them and bake at 180 for 1 hour.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

name: Bacon & Cheese Stuffed Chicken Alfredo

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 1 lb., pounded 1/4-inch-thick)

ingredients.name: jar ragu cheesi classic alfredo sauc
ingredients.fullName: 1 jar ragu cheesi classic alfredo sauc

instructions: Evenly top each chicken breast with cheese and bacon. Roll up and secure with wooden toothpicks. Dip chicken in egg, then bread crumbs.

Heat olive oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken, turning occasionally. Stir in Sauce and broth. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 10 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.

name: Broccoli, Ricotta Cheese, and Sausage Quiche
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Saute the broccoli, previously boiled, in a saucepan with the oil and garlic. Season with pinch of salt and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove the broccoli from the pan and set aside. Add the sausage and saute for 5 minutes.
Cool completely, and then place the broccoli and sausage in a food processor. Chop coarsely.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with Parmesan cheese and pinch each of the salt and black pepper. Add the ricotta cheese and continue mixing. Add the broccoli and sausage and combine well.
Place the sheet of puff pastry dough in a pie plate, pour the mixture and level it.
Fold the borders to form a rim.
Bake the quiche for approximately 25 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve warm.

name: Poutine
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Cut the small potatoes in halves, then in quarters, and then in eighths.
Mix the coconut oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
In a bowl, mix the potatoes chunks with the seasoned coconut oil.
On a baking sheet, spread the potatoes, sprinkle with nutritional yeast.
Bake for 30 minutes until golden brown and crispy.
In a small frying pan, saute chopped onion with chipotle and paprika over high heat until golden.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine beef broth, tomato sauce, and sugar. Add the onion. Set aside.
In another saucepan, melt the butter. Add flour, and continue cooking for about 5 minutes, stirring until the mixture turns golden brown.
Add the garlic and continue cooking.
Gradually add the broth to the flour mixture and boil, stirring with a whisk. Lower the heat and let the sauce thicken for about ten minutes.
Adjust seasoning.
To serve, place potatoes chunks on a plate, add a generous amount of cheese curds, pour on the sauce, and sprinkle with parsley.

name: Green Onion Risotto with Bream

ingredients.name: dry white wine
ingredients.fullName: dry white wine (A generous splash of)

instructions: For the risotto, heat broth. Slice green onions.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan and sauté green onion.
Add rice and sauté for about 2 minutes.
Add a little bit of dry white wine and begin adding the broth, while constantly stirring the rice.
Once all the stock is incorporated, simmer for about 16 minutes over low heat, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper.
Add a little grated cheese to taste, stir and cover.
For the fish, grill bream on oiled, preheated grill.
For the green onion tempura, dissolve rice flour in cold water to form a paste that bonds to green onions.
Then fry in very hot sunflower oil for about 3 minutes.
Arrange risotto, bream and green onion tempura on a plate.
Sprinkle with chopped chives and chile pepper and serve immediately.

name: Hamburger Buns
instructions: Dissolve the yeast in some warm milk and then add it to the mixer bowl with the two types of flour, the remaining milk, egg, butter, sugar, and salt.
Knead the ingredients together, adding the water slowly until it becomes smooth, elastic, and uniform in consistency.
Let the dough rise until it has doubled in size.
Place the dough on the work surface and punch it down. Cut it into pieces weighing approximately 110 grams each and then shape each piece into round rolls.
Place the rolls on a baking sheet lined with wax paper.
Brush each roll with some lightly beaten egg yolk or milk, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and let the rolls rise until they have doubled in size.
Preheat the oven to 200C.
Bake for 20 to 23 minutes until golden.
Remove them from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack. It is also possible to freeze the hamburger buns for a later time.

name: Potatoes with Sausages
instructions: Put a pan of salted water to boil. Add the eggs while the water is still cold.
When the water starts to boil, add the potatoes and the carrots cut into cubes. Let them cook.
When the potatoes and carrots are cooked, drain into a sieve, and let cool cool slightly. Peel the eggs and break them into pieces. Set aside.
In the serving bowl, add the olive oil, mayonnaise, and mustard. Mix well. Add the olives, and the sliced sausages, and mix.
Add the potatoes and carrots, and mix well until the sauce is evenly distributed.
Place the eggs on top, and serve.

name: Lentil Carrot Avocado Salad

ingredients.prep: peeled and cut into 4 inch pieces
ingredients.name: edium carrots
ingredients.fullName: 3 medium carrots (peeled and cut into 4 inch pieces)

instructions: In medium saucepan, bring lentils and 3 cups water or vegetable stock to a boil. Simmer until
tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and cool.
Bring brown rice and 1 cup water or vegetable stock to a boil over high heat. Cover and reduce
heat and cook 20-25 minutes, until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and toss with a fork, Allow to cool.
Attach Fresh Prep Slicer/Shredder Attachment to KitchenAid® Stand Mixer, and attach
slicing blade. Position large bowl under attachment to catch sliced ingredients. Stack radishes end to end in feed tube. Turn stand mixer to speed 5 and process until radishes are sliced.
Remove slicing blade and attach medium shredding blade. Fill feed tube with carrots. Turn stand mixer to speed 8 and process until carrots are shredded.
In large bowl, toss lentils, brown rice, radishes, carrots, arugula and parsley. Drizzle with olive
oil, lemon juice, salt and pepper. Top with avocado slices. Sprinkle with sunflower and flax
seeds and serve immediately.

name: Savory Ham and Cheese Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
In a large bowl mix together the flour, baking powder, and a pinch of baking soda and salt.
Add the diced ham and grated cheese. Toss together with the flour mixture.
Separately, in a bowl whisk together the egg, yogurt, and oil. Set aside.
Add the liquids to the solids and combine until all the flour has been absorbed.
Fill muffin tins to the top. Bake for 20 minutes.

name: 3-color Bean Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 185 degrees Celsius.
Grease a square baking pan.
In the blender, puree the ingredients in Mixture 1 until smooth. Pour into the baking pan and even out the surface.
Puree the ingredients in Mixture 2 until smooth. Pour over Mixture 1 in the baking pan, being careful not to mix them.
Puree the ingredients in Mixture 3 until smooth. Pour over Mixture 2 in the baking pan. Even out the surface and cover with aluminum foil.
Bake over a bain-marie for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
Let it cool and unmold.
In a blender, add the cream, tomato puree, chipotle chilies, and bouillon powder. Puree until smooth.
In a saucepan, heat the sauce while stirring. Season with salt and pepper.
To serve, cut the cake and plate. Pour the sauce on top and garnish to taste.

name: Almond Brittle
instructions: Blanch the almonds in boiling water for 2 to 3 minutes, then peel them, dry them with paper towels, place them on a baking sheet and bake them at 180C for 5 minutes to toast them, without browning them.

In the meantime, place the sugar in a medium saucepan with the water and the lemon juice and cook on low heat, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon. The sugar should be completely dissolved and should turn a golden color, it should not become too dark.
Chop some of the almonds coarsely and leave the remainder whole.
Turn off the heat as soon as the sugar is done. Add the almonds to the saucepan and stir to combine well.
Immediately pour the mixture on a marble surface greased with oil or on a wax paper-lined baking sheet.
Use a greased spatula or knife blade (or even a lemon) to level the brittle to the desired thickness.
Let the almond brittle cool for a few minutes and before it hardens, cut it into pieces with a large knife and then allow the brittle to harden completely.
The brittle can be stored, wrapped in aluminum foil and inside a tin canister or glass jar.

name: One-Bowl Gingerbread Whoopie Pies

ingredients.name: cream cheese
ingredients.fullName: 1 package cream cheese (softened, 8 oz. per package)

instructions: Put oil, brown sugar, vanilla and molasses in a stand mixer bowl or mixing bowl and whisk to combine. (Pro Tip: You'll be making the whoopie pie batter and frosting in the same bowl, so even though you're not using a mixer just yet, start with a stand mixer bowl -- you'll be using the mixer later.)
Add eggs and yolk 1 at a time, whisking after each addition. Add buttermilk and whisk again.

Put a sheet of parchment paper or a plate on a work surface and sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices onto it, using a fine strainer. Add dry ingredients to wet in 3 additions, folding them together until well-blended. (Pro Tip: If you have it, parchment paper is a handy tool for one-bowl baking; you can use it not only for lining a pan, but also to use as a landing pad when sifting dry ingredients.)
Cover bowl and freeze until batter is scoopable (it will hold a soft shape on a spoon), about 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Line a sheet pan with parchment paper or grease with butter.

Scoop or measure 15 (1 1/2-Tbsp.) portions of whoopie pies onto a prepared sheet pan, spacing them evenly apart. Return remaining batter to freezer. (Pro Tip: Scrape bowl well, as you will be reusing it to make the frosting. Wipe with a paper towel, if necessary.)
Bake whoopie pies on middle rack of preheated oven for 5 minutes. Rotate pan and bake until whoopie pies are dry and center comes back when gently pressed, 8-10 more minutes.
Transfer whoopie pies to cooling racks. Repeat to bake remaining batter.
Check to see that whoopie pies are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed. Let whoopie pies cool.
Put butter, cream cheese, and vanilla in stand mixer bowl or mixing bowl. Beat with a stand mixer or hand mixer on medium speed until smooth, scraping bowl as needed.

Put a sheet of parchment or a plate on a work surface and sift confectioners sugar, salt, and cinnamon onto it. Add dry ingredients to cream cheese mixture a little at a time, mixing on low speed to incorporate between each addition.
Increase speed to medium to medium-high, and beat mixture until smooth.

Flip half of the cooled whoopie pies flat-side up. Scoop about 2 Tbsp. filling onto each flat whoopie pie, then press a rounded-side-up whoopie pie on top until filling comes out to edges. Or, generously spread flat filling on whoopie pies to edges, using a small offset spatula or butter knife and smoothing edges if you like; then top each with a rounded-side-up whoopie pie. (Pro Tip: If you want the edges of the filling that pokes out between the cookies to be smooth, use a cookie scoop to measure the filling and place it in the center of the pie. Then press down lightly with the other pie. If you don't have a cookie scoop, try smoothing the edges of the filling with a small offset spatula or butter knife.)
Serve whoopie pies immediately, or refrigerate for 1 hour and serve cold. Wrap leftover whoopies in waxed paper or plastic wrap and refrigerate in a container up to 3 days, or freeze up to 1 month.

name: Copycat Disney’s French Toast with Caramel Sauce

ingredients.name: unsalted butter
ingredients.fullName: 7 tablespoons unsalted butter (divided, plus more if needed)

ingredients.name: kosher salt
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt (plus a pinch more)

instructions: For caramel sauce, in a medium-sized saucepan, melt 4 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Whisk in brown sugar and 1/4 teaspoon salt until well combined.
Whisk in heavy cream and let come to a lively simmer, then reduce heat to low to keep warm, stirring occasionally. Stir in 1 teaspoon vanilla.

For French toast, in a shallow dish or pie plate, beat eggs, milk, cinnamon, the remaining 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, and a pinch of salt together until the eggs are well beaten and no clumps of egg white are visible.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and melt the remaining 3 tablespoons butter.
Dip 3 slices brioche into egg mixture, 10 to 20 seconds per side, then transfer to the hot skillet, arranging them somewhat apart (don't overcrowd the skillet).
Fry until deep golden brown, then flip to brown the other side, 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer to a plate.
Repeat to cook remaining slices of brioche, adding more butter to the pan as needed.
Serve French toast immediately with caramel sauce, powdered sugar, and bananas on top.

name: Chutney Turkey Pasta Salad

ingredients.name: small shell pasta
ingredients.fullName: 8 ounces small shell pasta (or spiral pasta)

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise

instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water until completely cool.

In large bowl, combine Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise, chutney, lime juice and salt. Gently stir in cooled pasta and remaining ingredients except walnuts; toss to coat. Garnish with walnuts.

name: Chicken and Mango Hamburgers
instructions: Marinate the chicken in the teriyaki sauce for 30 minutes.
Peel the mango and cut into thick wedges. Set aside.
Grill the chicken for 4 minutes on each side. When it is almost done, add cheese slices on top. Remove from the grill and allow the cheese to melt.
Heat the bread in the grill. Also, cook the mango, 1 minute on each side.
Assemble the hamburger and add onion, jalapeno chilies, and avocado. Serve immediately.

name: SunButter Maple Fudge
instructions: Line a 8×8-inch baking pan with parchment paper.
In a small saucepan, mix together maple syrup, SunButter and coconut oil. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture blends together and is smooth.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for about 2 minutes, it should thicken just a bit. Stir in vanilla until well blended. Stir in sunflower seeds.
Pour into prepared pan and place pan in freezer until firm. Using edges of parchment paper, lift fudge from pan and cut into 12 pieces.
Keep fudge in freezer until ready to eat.

name: Frozen Peppermint Cheesecake

ingredients.name: chocolate wafer cookie
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups chocolate wafer cookie (or sandwich cookie crumbs)

ingredients.name: Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
ingredients.fullName: 14 ounces Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk

instructions: LINE 9-inch round cake or springform pan with foil.
COMBINE cookie crumbs and sugar in medium bowl. Add butter; mix well. Press 2 cups crumbs firmly onto bottom and partway up sides of prepared pan. Chill.

BEAT cream cheese until fluffy in large bowl. Gradually add sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Stir in peppermint extract and food coloring, if desired; mix well. Fold in whipped cream. Pour filling into pan.
COVER; freeze 6 hours or until firm. Garnish with fudge topping, if desired.

name: Smokey Chipotle Chili Pasta
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.

Cook ground beef, chili powder and onion in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and beans and cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is done and tomatoes are tender, about 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare Knorr® Menu Flavors Pasta Sides™ - Chipotle Rosa according to package directions.
Pour chili into 2-quart baking dish, then arrange hot Pasta around inside edge. Bake 5 minutes or until bubbling.
Top with you favorite chili toppings such as sour cream, cheddar cheese and/or tortilla chips.

name: Chipotle Mac & Cheese

ingredients.name: i can't believe it's not butter! spread
ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons i can't believe it's not butter! spread (melted)

ingredients.name: Knorr Menu Flavors Pasta Sides Cheddar Chipotle
ingredients.fullName: 1 package Knorr Menu Flavors Pasta Sides Cheddar Chipotle

ingredients.name: pinto beans
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup pinto beans (canned, rinsed and drained)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°. Combine crumbs with melted I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread in small bowl; set aside.

Prepare Knorr® Menu Flavors Pasta Sides™ - Cheddar Chipotle according to package directions, cooking partially covered and reducing cooking time to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in ham and beans.
Pour pasta mixture into shallow baking dish; sprinkle evenly with crumbs. Bake 5 to 10 minutes until bubbling and crumbs are lightly browned.

name: Chilies en Nogada
instructions: Roast the poblano chilies. Once the skins burn, place in a plastic bag and set aside for 15 minutes. Peel the chilies.
In a saucepan, add vegetable oil. Saute the onion and garlic.
Add the tomato, cinnamon, a pinch of cloves, and salt and pepper to taste. Continue to cook for 3 minutes.
Add the peach, apple, plantain, raisins, pine nuts, and almonds. Bring to a boil and cook for 3 minutes.
Add the meat and sherry. Bring to a boil and season with salt as needed. Add sugar if desired.
Continue to boil until the sauce reduces.
In a blender, add the nuts, cream, cream cheese, and salt and pepper to taste. Puree until smooth.
Add milk if needed.
To serve, stuff the chilies. Pour the sauce on top. Garnish with pomegranate and parsley.

name: Loaded Chili Baked Potatoes

ingredients.name: chili with beans
ingredients.fullName: 2 cans chili with beans (14 oz. per can)

instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Pierce each potato 2-3 times with a fork and wrap each individually in a sheet of aluminum foil. Place the potatoes directly on the middle oven rack. Bake the potatoes for 60-75 minutes, until fork-tender. Remove the potatoes from the oven and allow them to rest until they're cool enough to handle.

Remove the potatoes from the aluminum foil. With a sharp knife, make a lengthwise slit in the top of each potato, slicing only halfway down. Carefully pinch the potatoes to open slightly. Scoop out a few tablespoons of the potato flesh from each potato. Reserve for an alternative use, or discard.
Place the potatoes onto the baking sheet. Season the insides of the potatoes with salt and black pepper, to taste.
Spoon an equal amount of chili into each potato, doming it slightly over the tops. Sprinkle the shredded cheese evenly. over the potatoes.
Bake the potatoes for 8-10 minutes on the middle rack of oven, until the cheese is melted and the chili and potatoes are heated through.
Check to see that potatoes are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Finely mince the scallion.
Top each potato with a generous spoonful of sour cream and the minced scallion. Serve immediately.

name: Creamy Potato Soup
instructions: In a skillet on medium heat, add the oil and saute the shallot for a few minutes.
Add the potatoes and speck or ham and cook until golden brown.
Set aside a spoonful of potatoes, and then add the milk, stock, and a pinch of salt.
Cook on a low heat for about 1 1/2 hours and then place in a blender together with the crème fraiche and chives. Puree until smooth.
Serve hot in soup bowls with the remaining potatoes as garnish.

name: Cream of Shrimp Soup

ingredients.prep: substitute with vermouth or white wine
ingredients.name: cognac
ingredients.fullName: 1 dash cognac (substitute with vermouth or white wine)

instructions: Add the vegetable oil in a pot on low heat. Add the leek, onion, carrot, celery, and garlic and saute for 5 minutes.
Add the cognac and cook until the alcohol evaporates.
Add the tomato puree and half of the shrimp, including the shells. Add the stock and simmer 25 to 30 minutes.
Strain the liquid into a bowl Season with a pinch of salt and add a dollop of sour cream, if a creamy texture is desired. Add back to the pot and keep warm on low heat..
Crush the mixed nuts until powdery.
Coat the remaining shrimp with the beaten egg white and the mixed nuts. Fry in plenty of hot oil and serve with the soup.

name: Stracchino Cheese and Zucchini Quiche
instructions: Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius.
Thinly slice three zucchini lengthwise and grill them, seasoning them lightly with salt.
Coarsely chop the remaining zucchini with the spring onion.
Line a 22-centimeter pie plate with wax paper, place the puff pastry dough inside, fitting onto the edge of the pie plate.
Combine the soft cheese with the chopped zucchini and spring onion, egg, Parmesan cheese, and milk.
Season to taste with salt.
Add the filling to the pie crust, and cover with the grilled zucchini slices.
Turn over the excess puff pastry dough and pinch it at intervals to form the border.
Brush the surface with the beaten egg yolk and milk mixture.
Bake for approximately 25 to 30 minutes or until the pie crust border is golden brown.
Serve warm.

name: Easy And Delicious Double Chocolate Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Line a 12-cavity muffin pan with muffin liners.
In large mixing bowl, use a mixer to cream together the butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth and combined.
Add the eggs and beat with the mixer for a minute longer, until the mixture is pale and fluffy.
Add the sour cream and milk. Beat with the mixer until fully incorporated.
Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda,  cocoa powder, and salt to the bowl. Beat on medium-low speed until just combined. Be careful not to over-mix.
Add the chocolate chips to the batter. Fold into the batter with a rubber spatula to evenly distribute.
Spoon an even amount of batter into each muffin liner.
Insert the muffin pan into oven, and bake for 15-25 minutes.
Remove the muffin pan from the oven when a toothpick inserted into a muffin comes out clean.
Allow muffins to cool in pan for 5 minutes, then serve. Store leftovers at room temperature for 2 days or in the refrigerator for 3 days.

name: Seed Bread Loaf
instructions: Preheat oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
Grease a loaf pan.
In a bowl, mix the flour, yeast, sugar, flax seeds, and sesame seeds, ensuring everything is well distributed.
Add the carbonated water and mix well again.
Place the dough in the pan, sprinkle with more seeds and bake for 45 minutes.
Insert a toothpick in the middle of the bread to check doneness. The toothpick will come out clean when the bread is ready.

name: Bellevue Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit
Break the eggs, separating the whites from the yolks.
Melt the chocolate with milk and cream in a double boiler. Stir in the egg yolks one by one, then add the flour and the almond meal.
Whisk the egg whites with the sugar until peaks form. Gently fold the egg whites into the chocolate mix.
Grease and flour a cake pan 24 centimeters in diameter.
Add batter to pan, fill to 3/4 full.
Bake for 30 minutes.
Cool slightly on rack, serve warm.
Optional before serving, sprinkle with powdered sugar.

name: Pork Knuckle Tomato Date Curry in Pita
instructions: 1. Season cubed pork with salt and pepper
2. Brown pork in tall-sided skillet until brown on all sides, remove and save
3. Add onion and cook over medium/low until onion is soft and lightly browned
4. Add tomatoes, spices, dates, raisins, and garlic
5. Bring to a boil and simmer for 15 minutes, adjust flavor with salt
6. Add pork with reserved juices and orange juice
7. Cook for 10 minutes until meat is just cooked through
8. Finish with yogurt and mint
1. Serve over rice with vegetables or inside a pita

name: Rustic Root Vegetable Mash

ingredients.prep: medium, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
ingredients.name: arsnips
ingredients.fullName: 2 parsnips (medium, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces)

ingredients.name: edium carrots
ingredients.fullName: 3 medium carrots (peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces)

ingredients.prep: medium, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
ingredients.name: urnips
ingredients.fullName: 2 turnips (medium, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces)

instructions: Place parsnips and carrots in a large pot and cover with water.  Add salt and bring mixture to a boil over high heat.  Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add turnips and continue to cook until vegetables are tender, about 20-25 minutes.  Drain well.

Attach KitchenAid® Heated Chef Bowl and beater to stand mixer. Set heat to 220°F. Once preheated, add butter, cream and sherry and allow mixture to heat for 3 to 4 minutes or until butter is melted. Turn mixer to Stir speed and blend well, about 10 to 15 seconds.

Reduce bowl heat to 165°F. Add hot cooked vegetables. Turn mixer to speed 2 and mix for 1 to 2 minutes, or until all vegetables are broken up.  Exchange beater for wire whip. Add garam masala, salt and pepper. Turn to medium and whip for 2 to 3 minutes, some larger chunks will remain.  Serve immediately or keep warm in bowl.

name: Summer Chicken & Basil Pasta

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast halves

ingredients.name: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread
ingredients.fullName: 4 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread

ingredients.name: reduced sodium chicken broth
ingredients.fullName: 14.5 ounces reduced sodium chicken broth (fat free)

ingredients.name: loosely packed fresh basil leaves
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup loosely packed fresh basil leaves (thinly sliced)

instructions: Season chicken, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper.

Melt 2 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Melt remaining 2 tablespoons Spread in same skillet over medium heat and cook garlic 30 seconds. Stir in tomatoes and cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes.
Add broth and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes. Stir in chicken, basil and spaghetti; heat through.
Turn into serving bowl, then sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

name: Cabbage Salad with Dijon Dressing

ingredients.name: red bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 red bell pepper (seeded and cut into strips)

instructions: Place the  carrot, bell pepper, onion, and cabbage to a large salad bowl and toss.
In a small bowl, mix the mustard, honey, vinegar, and a pinch of salt and black pepper and mix well. Slowly drizzle the oil into the bowl and whisk everything together.
Pour the dressing onto the salad and toss well.
Place the salad on a plate and top with almonds. The salad can be served alone or with grilled chicken.

name: Easy Holiday Sausage "Cookie" Recipe

ingredients.name: Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Regular Sausage
ingredients.fullName: 1 Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Regular Sausage

instructions: Remove sausage from roll and flatten onto a large sheet of parchment or plastic wrap. Top sausage with second piece of parchment paper. Roll sausage evenly to about 1/4-inch thickness. Place on a large baking pan and cover. Freeze for about 1 hour until firm but not a hard freeze.
Remove sausage from freezer and cut sausage with cookie cutters into fun holiday shapes.
Cook sausage shapes in a large skillet over medium heat for 8-10 minutes or until a minimum temperature of 160 degrees fahrenheit is reached. Decorate with garnishes to serve, if desired.

name: Green Rice

ingredients.prep: poblano, grilled, peeled, and cut into strips
ingredients.name: chile pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 chile pepper (poblano, grilled, peeled, and cut into strips)

instructions: Boil 1 cup of water. Remove from heat and add the rice. Set aside for 3 minutes, drain, and wash until the water comes off clear.

Spritz a pan with cooking spray and saute the rice until it changes in color. Add 1 1/2 cups water and the bouillon and stir. Lower the heat, cover the pan, and cook for 15 minutes, until the rice is cooked. Remove the rice from the heat and let cool.
Defrost the peas. Mix with the rice, bell pepper, poblano, and scallions. Add salt and pepper and serve.

name: Teriyaki Pork Kabobs

ingredients.name: boneless pork loin
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless pork loin (cut into stir-fry strips)

ingredients.name: green bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 green bell pepper (small, cut into squares)

instructions: On skewers, thread pork strips accordion-style with the mandarin oranges. Add a green pepper piece to the ends of each skewer.

For sauce, in a small bowl combine the teriyaki sauce, honey, vinegar and garlic powder; mix well. Brush sauce over kabobs. Broil 6 inches from heat 5-6 minutes, turning and brushing with sauce occasionally. Serve hot.

name: Buffalo Chicken & Rice

ingredients.name: ckage knorr rice sides - buffalo chicken
ingredients.fullName: 1 package knorr rice sides - buffalo chicken

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breasts
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts (cut into thin strips)

ingredients.name: i can't believe it's not butter! spread
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon i can't believe it's not butter! spread

ingredients.name: wish-bone chunky blue cheese dressing
ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons wish-bone chunky blue cheese dressing

instructions: Melt Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken, stirring occasionally, 4 minutes until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
Stir water and Knorr® Rice Sides - Buffalo Chicken into same skillet and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 7 minutes.
Stir in chicken and simmer an additional 2 minutes or until rice is tender and chicken is heated through. Stir in celery and Dressing. Remove from heat and let stand covered 2 minutes.

name: Lentil Soup with Sausage
instructions: Saute the sausage in a skillet spritzed with cooking spray until golden. Place into a saucepan with the lentils, epazote, cumin, and thyme.
Spritz the skillet with cooking spray and saute the onion until golden. Add to the saucepan. Add a little water to the skillet and scrape the sides. Add to the saucepan.
Add the rest of the water to the saucepan with the chicken bouillon and let simmer on medium-low heat for 40 minutes. Remove the epazote.
Add the pimento and cook for 40 minutes more. Serve.

name: Breaded Bologna with Simple Salad
instructions: Beat the eggs and mustard together in a deep dish.
Mix the bread crumbs, pepper, and parmesan cheese together.
Dip the slices of bologna into the egg mixture and then into the breadcrumb mixture. Dip into the egg mixture once more and then into the breadcrumb mixture again.
Fry in a skillet spritzed with cooking spray until golden brown on both sides.
Prepare the salad dressing by mixing the vinegar with the salt and pepper. Whisk in the olive oil.
Place the spinach, tomato, and cheese into a bowl. Drizzle with the dressing and serve along with the sliced bologna.

name: Nopal Soup
instructions: Cut the nopals into small cubes and place them in a pot of boiling water. Remove after two minutes.
Drain the nopal and clean them. Place them in the pot again with new water and cook them with salt.
In a separate pot, add olive oil, butter, and add the onion, garlic, and chipotle pepper.
Once the nopal pieces are cooked, drain them, and add to the second pot with the other ingredients.
Add the chicken stock into the pot along with the coriander. Allow the water boil for up to 10 minutes.
Serve the soup with tortilla strips and sour cream on top.

name: Apple Cinnamon Muffins from the Daily Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F.
Grease and flour a muffin pan with 12 cups.
In a small bowl, mix the butter, hazelnuts, flour, and sugar to a crumble with your fingertips. Set aside
In a large bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Set aside.
In another bowl, whisk the apple juice, agave syrup, egg, and oil together. The syrup must be fully dissolved .
Combine the liquid with the flour mixture, mix quickly with a wooden spoon to get a smooth batter.
Wash and cut the apples into strips, and add them to the mixture.
Divide the batter into the 12 muffin pans. Place a little bit of crumble on top of each muffin.
Cook for about 15 minutes.

name: Beet Ravioli with Meyer Lemon Goat Cheese and Brown Butter Sage Sauce

ingredients.name: beets
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 pound beets (about 2 medium to large beets)

ingredients.name: flour
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups flour (“00”, * plus more for dusting)

instructions: In a large bowl, combine goat cheese, ricotta, egg, lemon zest, and lemon juice; whisk until smooth. Cover and place in the refrigerator until needed.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Wrap beets in foil, place on a baking sheet, and roast for 45 minutes or until tender. Once the beets have cooled, remove the skins with your hands and discard peel. This can be done up to two days in advance. Place peeled and cooled beets in a food processor and process until extremely smooth, about 1 minute. Add eggs and egg yolk and pulse until combined.

In a KitchenAid® Stand Mixer fitted with the flat beater attachment, combine flour and salt; mix on low until combined. Add beet puree, turn the speed to 2 and mix until combined; about 1 minute. Exchange the paddle for the dough hook and knead until for 8 to 10 minutes or until the dough is smooth. Humidity in the air can affect the moisture in the dough. If the dough seems too “wet” add additional flour a tablespoon at a time until the dough becomes firm. If the dough is too “dry” add cold water a tablespoon at a time until the dough is balanced. Remove the dough to a lightly floured work surface and cut into 6 equal pieces; cover.

Attach the KitchenAid® Pasta Roller attachment to the stand mixer and set the adjustment knob to 1. Turn the mixer speed to a speed you are comfortable with between 2 and 4. Feed one pasta dough piece through the pasta roller. Sprinkle the dough with a little flour, fold in half, and roll again. Repeat this process several times until the dough is smooth and pliable.

Move the adjustment knob to setting 2 and feed the dough through to flatten. Move the adjustment knob to 3, sprinkle the dough with flour, and roll it through to flatten further. Move the adjustment knob to 4, sprinkle with flour, and roll the dough through again for the final time. Do not fold the dough during the flattening process. Set pasta sheet on a floured surface and cover. Repeat with remaining dough.
With a 2 1/2 -inch round pastry cutter, cut rounds out of the pasta sheets. If the leftover pasta dough is still pliable, gather, run it through the pasta roller and repeat the pasta sheet process.

Place the filling in a pastry bag and pipe a dollop of the goat cheese filling onto the center of a pasta round. You can also do this using a spoon, if desired. With your finger or a pastry brush, brush the edge of the pasta round with water. Top with another pasta round and press the sides to adhere the rounds together. Repeat with the remaining pasta. Cover finished ravioli with a towel until use.

In a large saucepan, melt 6 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Simmer the butter until it turns golden brown; about 8 minutes. Once the butter has browned, immediately remove from heat and add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter; stir until melted. This will stop the cooking process. Add sage and salt; stir until combined. Taste and add additional salt if needed.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to a rapid simmer over medium-high. Carefully add the ravioli to the water. Gently stir to keep the ravioli separated for even cooking. Cook for 5 minutes. Strain water from the ravioli.
Serve by plating ravioli, drizzle with brown butter sauce, and garnish with grated Parmigiano-Reggiano and Meyer lemon zest.

name: Breakfast Casserole Ham and Potato Breakfast Bake

ingredients.prep: small chopped, approximately one medium/small pepper
ingredients.name: bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup bell pepper (small chopped, approximately one medium/small pepper)

ingredients.name: shredded cheese
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups shredded cheese (finely, divided in half)

instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine sweet peppers, onion, garlic, mushrooms, and ham. Mix well.
2. In a smaller bowl, whisk together eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.
3. Add whisked eggs to vegetable bowl and stir. Incorporate potatoes, then 1 cup of shredded cheese.
4. Pour casserole mixture into an 8x8 or 9x9 lightly oiled baking dish. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top.
5. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 - 45 minutes, until cooked through and egg is set. If using a broiler safe dish, turn on broiler for 2 - 3 minutes to crisp and brown cheese.
6. Enjoy!

name: Cake with Lime and Passion Fruit Syrup

ingredients.name: grams agave
ingredients.fullName: 100 grams agave (or honey, or to taste)

instructions: Grease a round cake pan approximately 20-25 cm (approximately 8-10 inches) diameter.
Line bottom of pan with parchment paper. For the syrup, heat passion fruit pulp, water, lime juice, and agave or honey in a saucepan and bring almost to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer on low heat for 5 minutes.
Set aside and let cool. Melt butter and let it cool.
For the cake, whisk eggs, light brown sugar, lime zest and agave or honey in a bowl with an electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Add butter, yogurt and vanilla paste.
Mix well.
Add spelt flour and baking powder.
Gently fold into cake batter.
Transfer batter into cake pan.
Bake in preheated oven.
Remove cake from pan while it is still warm.
Pierce the surface with a toothpick or fork and slowly pour syrup over cake.
Let cool.
Serve cold with Greek yogurt and lime zest.

name: Pork Tenderloin with Cilantro-Lime Pesto
instructions: Cut tenderloin lengthwise almost in half. Lay out flat. Chill. Combine next seven ingredients in food processor, puree. Add olive oil slowly until mixture thickens. Spread half of mixture over tenderloin. Spread grated cheese over pesto. Reform tenderloin and tie to secure. Spread remaining pesto over tenderloin. Chill for several hours.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place tenderloin on a rack in a shallow baking pan and roast 20 minutes until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees F. Remove from oven, cover and keep warm. Let rest for 10 minutes; reserving all juices.
Remove string from tenderloin, cut into eight slices. Arrange on plates. Pour any warm juices over slice. Sprinkle with toasted pine nuts to serve.

name: Queso Burgers

ingredients.name: Ro-Tel Diced Tomatoes & Green Chilies
ingredients.fullName: 10 ounces Ro-Tel Diced Tomatoes & Green Chilies (undrained)

instructions: Heat grill to medium heat.
Shape meat into 6 (1/2-inch-thick) patties. Grill 4 to 5 min. on each side or until done (160ºF).
Meanwhile, microwave VELVEETA and RO*TEL in microwaveable bowl on HIGH 5 min. or until VELVEETA is completely melted, stirring after 3 min.
Place burgers on bottom halves of buns; top each with 2 Tbsp. VELVEETA sauce. Cover with lettuce, tomatoes and tops of buns.

name: Game Day Pork and Chile Wraps

ingredients.name: boneless pork loin chops
ingredients.fullName: 12 ounces boneless pork loin chops (3/4-inch thick, lean)

instructions: In medium skillet over medium-high heat, warm oil. Sprinkle pork chops with salt and pepper and cook about 3-4 mins. per side until browned and internal temp. reaches 145 degree F, Place chops on a plate and let rest 5 mins.
Cut chops into 1/4-inch slices.

Microwave tortillas on high until slightly warm and softened, about 30 sec. Place tortillas on workspace and top with pork, avocado, onion, chiles and salad greens stopping 2 inches short of one edge.

Working one tortilla at a time, fold one side of tortilla up and over fillings. Tuck fillings in tightly, then fold in the 2-in. edge. Continue rolling tortilla toward the other side, securing with toothpick if necessary. Repeat with remaining tortillas and serve.

name: Pepperoni Pizza with Peppers

ingredients.prep: seeded and thinly sliced, or 1/2each red and green bell peppers
ingredients.name: green bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 green bell pepper (seeded and thinly sliced, or 1/2each red and green bell peppers)

ingredients.prep: shredded, 4 oz.,, blend of mozzarella, provolone, Parmesan and Romano
ingredients.name: cheese
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup cheese (shredded, 4 oz.,, blend of mozzarella, provolone, Parmesan and Romano)

instructions: Heat oven to 450 degrees F. Grease a pizza pan, sprinkle lightly with cornmeal and press crust into pan. Bake 6-8 minutes until lightly browned. Meanwhile, heat oil in large nonstick skillet and sauté onion and pepper until soft. Spread sauce over pizza crust; top with vegetables, pepperoni and cheese, spreading evenly. Bake for 10-12 minutes more or until edge of crust is golden brown and cheese is lightly browned.
Serves 4.

name: Pulled Pork Baked Potato

ingredients.name: canola oil
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon canola oil (or other neutral-flavored oil)

ingredients.prep: OR Monterey Jack, or mozzarella, shredded
ingredients.name: cheddar cheese
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup cheddar cheese (OR Monterey Jack, or mozzarella, shredded)

ingredients.name: sour cream
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup sour cream (or more to taste)

instructions: Preheat an oven to 400 degrees F.
Rub the potatoes with the oil. Arrange them on a baking sheet and pierce each a few times with a knife or fork. Bake until cooked through, 1 to 1 1/4 hours.
Cut a lengthwise split in each potato and fluff the insides with a fork. Arrange the warmed pork, cheese, and sour cream on top. Sprinkle with chives, if using, and serve.

name: Spiral-Cut Ham with Slow-Roasted Asparagus and Lemon-Thyme Sauce
instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Place ham on rack in a shallow baking pan. Cover pan tightly with foil. Roast until an instant-read thermometer inserted in the thickest portion (not touching bone) registers 135 degrees F. (about 15 minutes per pound).

Meanwhile, remove and discard woody stems from asparagus spears. Arrange asparagus in a 15 x 10 x 2-inch baking pan. Drizzle with cooking oil. Sprinkle with lemon pepper seasoning. When ham reaches 135 degrees F., add asparagus to oven. Roast about 30 minutes more or until asparagus is tender and ham registers 140 degrees F.

For lemon sauce, in a 1 1/2-quart saucepan combine cornstarch, sugar, bouillon granules and pepper. Stir in water, lemon juice and lemon peel. Bring to boil; reduce heat. Cook and stir until mixture is bubbly. Cook for 2 minutes more. Stir in butter and snipped thyme or parsley.
To serve, slice ham. Serve with asparagus and lemon sauce. (Use remaining ham for sandwiches or another recipe.)

name: Chocolate and Hazelnut Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 150 degrees Celsius.
Whip the eggs until creamy. Slowly add the sugar and vanilla and mix well.
Add the crushed nuts, flour, cocoa powder, and yeast. Beat until smooth. At the end, add the oil and wáter and mix well.
Pour the batter in a greased baking pan.
Bake for 75 to 90 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let it cool.
Melt the chocolate and Nutella in a double boiler.
Pour the icing the cake and sprinkle with nuts on top and serve.

name: Roasted Leg of Lamb in the Connemara Green Coat
instructions: In a pot with salted boiling water blanch the kale leaves for 3 minutes.
Drain and dry with a paper towel. Set aside.
Combine pistachios, chopped mint leaves and a little salt and pepper.
Slice the leg of lamb in 2 pieces of 150 gr.
Saute over high heat for 4-5 minutes on each side.
Make a cut at the center of each slice with a knife.
Inside the cut, place a teaspoon of the pistachio/mint mixture.
Roll the meat in a kale leaf and secure with a wooden pin.
In a skillet, heat a teaspoon of oil and saute the the rolls for 15 minutes, turn them over halfway through the cooking.
Salt and pepper.
Serve with potato and parsnip purée.

name: Cardoon with Codfish
instructions: Carefully peel tough outer leaves and chop cardoon.
Cook cardoon in plenty of boiling water for about 30 minutes.
Drain well.
Peel and chop garlic.
Heat plenty of oil in a skillet and sauté garlic.
Add cardoon to pan with garlic and sauté briefly.
Sprinkle flour and mix.
Whisk in milk and continue to stir and cook until sauce thickens.
Shred cod and add to the cardoon mixture.
Chop almonds and add to mixture.
Simmer for about 2-3 minutes.
Season with salt.
To serve, arrange with quail eggs and dust with ground chili powder, if desired.

name: Quick Apple and Yogurt Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Grease a bundt cake with butter and sprinkle with flour. Set aside.
Cut the apple into quarters, and remove the core.
Place in the cup and chop for 5 seconds at speed 6.
Add coconut, yogurt, eggs, cinnamon, olive oil and sugar.
Set for 4 min, speed 4.
Finally add the flour, the baking powder and salt and involve for 5 sec at speed 3.
Place the dough in the form and bake for about 35 minutes.
Check the cooking, unmold and let it cool.

name: Christmas Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Thoroughly mix the softened butter with the sugar until it's creamy.
Add the egg yolks one at a time, stirring constantly, as well as the lemon zest.
Add the flour gradually until you get a smooth and soft dough, knead lightly.
Let rest for 10 to 15 minutes.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface, and cut out cookies.
Bake for 10 to 15 minutes, until lightly browned.
When cool, decorate with powdered sugar.
Fill with strawberry jam (optional).

name: Avocado Tartare with Crab and Yellow Peach on Crepes
instructions: Crepe Batter Preparation:
Pour the flour and a pinch of salt in a bowl, mix, and make a well in the middle of the flour.
Add oil and egg. Mix.
Gradually pour in the milk, and mix.
Cover and let rest for 20 minutes at room temperature.
Use a small cookie cutter to act as a mold for the batter to make uniform circles. Cook in a lightly oiled frying pan. They must be thick enough to support the toppings.
Let cool.
Tartare Preparation:
Finely dice avocado and yellow peach.
Roughly chop the crab meat.
Mayonnaise Preparation:
In a bowl, mix egg yolk, salt, pepper, mustard, and a dash of wine vinegar.
Gradually, add oil while whisking to thicken to mayonnaise.
Mix some mayonnaise with crab meat.
Separately, mix avocado and yellow peach with some mayonnaise.
To serve, place crepe circles on a plate.
On each circle, spread a layer of avocado/peach mixture, then a layer of crab/mayonnaise mixture, and finally another layer of avocado/peach.
Repeat for as many circles as you have.

name: Pasta Carbonara

ingredients.name: grams lard
ingredients.fullName: 150 grams lard (cheek, may substitute pancetta bacon)

ingredients.name: grams pecorino cheese
ingredients.fullName: 100 grams pecorino cheese (grated, may substitute parmesan cheese)

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper
ingredients.fullName: salt and ground black pepper (as needed)

instructions: Cut the cheek lard into cubes. Brown lightly in a pan with 1 tablespoon of oil until it has been sauteed well without overcooking it.
Cook the pasta in a stockpot of boiling salted water.
Beat the eggs with salt, some grated cheese, and pepper in a bowl.
Drain the pasta while still ‘al dente.’
Turn on the stove again, add the drained pasta to the pan with the cheek lard, and saute to flavor the pasta.
Turn off the heat.
Place the pasta and cheek lard in the stockpot where the pasta was previously cooked, add the beaten egg mixture, more pepper, and grated cheese, according to taste.
Stir quickly to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Sugar Pie
instructions: Combine flour, sugar, yeast.
Melt the butter and milk in the microwave for 3 minutes.
Combine the butter mixture with the flour mixture.
Add the eggs, one by one, to get a fairly soft dough ball.
Spread the dough on a piece of parchment paper and form a circle 30 centimeters in diameter with your hands.
Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let rise for 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 210 degrees Celsius.
Mix the egg yolk with milk and brush on the dough.
Sprinkle with the sugar.
Distribute the butter evenly on top.
Bake for 25 minutes.

name: Fish Tacos

ingredients.name: tartar sauce
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup tartar sauce (McCormick® Original, for Seafood)

instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Mix tartar sauce and salsa. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix Seasoning Mix and bread crumbs in shallow dish. Moisten fish with water. Shake off excess. Coat fish evenly on both sides with bread crumb mixture. Place fish in single layer on shallow baking pan sprayed with no stick cooking spray.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Cut fish into 8 portions. Serve in warmed tortillas. Top with tartar sauce and desired toppings.

name: Spanish Ham Sandwich with Caramelized Onions and Parmesan Cheese
instructions: Add the butter to a skillet on medium-low heat. Add the onions and season with salt. Saute for 5 minutes.
Add the sugar and lower the heat to low. Cook without stirring for 15 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Sear the ham in the skillet for 2 minutes on each side.
Toast thinly sliced bread, add the ham, onions, tomatoes, escarole, and a couple of slices of cheese.

name: Spicy Lemonade Coleslaw

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1/3 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise

instructions: Bring Lemonade to a boil over medium-high heat in large nonstick skillet, stirring occasionally, until reduced to 1/4 cup and until slightly syrupy and leaves a trail when the bottom of the pan is scraped with a spatula, about 20 minutes. Pour into large bowl; set aside to cool completely, about 10 minutes.
Stir in Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise and chili sauce, then coleslaw mix, onion and cilantro. Just before serving, sprinkle with sesame seeds.

name: Easy Broccoli and Cauliflower Gratin
instructions: 1) Boil the florets in slightly salted water until cooked. Drain and set aside.
2) Mix the cream cheese, parsley and ground almonds. Gently stir in the florets. Pour the mixture into a pie dish.
3) In another bowl, mix the crumbs, grated cheese and mixed herbs. Scatter evenly over the pie mixture.
4) Grill for 5-10 minutes until the topping goes nice and crispy.

name: Chocolate Ice Cream Cake with Meringues
instructions: Melt the chocolate in the microwave.
With a brush, coat the inside of a springform pan with the melted chocolate. The coating must be thick enough because it will make the chocolate shell.
Let harden in the refrigerator.
Remove the ice cream from the freezer so that it becomes softer.
Spread half of the ice cream in the pan.
Top the ice cream layer with meringue pieces.
Spread the remaining ice cream on top.
Finish with a layer of meringue and chocolate if there is any left.
Put in the freezer for at least 2 hours. Serve with meringues.

name: Asian Coleslaw with Ginger Soy Dressing

ingredients.name: sliced green onions
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup sliced green onions (thinly, cut on the diagonal)

ingredients.name: red bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 red bell pepper (sliced in matchstick size strips)

instructions: Combine Asian Coleslaw ingredients in a large mixing bowl.

For the dressing, whisk rice vinegar with soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic and sesame oil in a medium size bowl. Continue to whisk and gradually drizzle in oil. Pour dressing over coleslaw and toss to coat. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and serve immediately.
Serving Suggestions:
Garnish with additional minced green onion, fresh minced cilantro and chopped honey roasted peanuts,if desired.
For a special presentation, top this beautiful salad with quick-fried rice noodles:

Break 2 ounces of thin rice noodles into 2 batches. Place a double layer of paper towels on a plate. Heat 1-inch of  canola oil in a large saucepan to 350°F. Add one batch of the noodles to the hot oil and cook until they puff up and whiten, about 5 seconds. Use a slotted spoon to transfer to the paper towels to drain. Repeat for the remaining noodles.

name: Cod with Lemon-Herb Crust

ingredients.name: salt and ground black pepper
ingredients.fullName: salt and ground black pepper (to taste)

ingredients.name: i can't believe it's not butter! spread
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon i can't believe it's not butter! spread (melted)

ingredients.name: Best Foods Canola Cholesterol Free Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: Best Foods Canola Cholesterol Free Mayonnaise

instructions: PREHEAT oven to 425°.
MIX bread crumbs, cheese, lemon peel, salt and pepper in small bowl. Stir in Spread; set aside.
BLEND Hellmann’s® or Best Foods® Canola Cholesterol Free Mayonnaise with tarragon in another bowl; set aside.
ARRANGE cod or halibut on baking sheet. Spread with mayonnaise mixture; press on bread crumb mixture. Bake 10 minutes or until cod flakes with a fork. Drizzle with lemon juice.

name: Pistachio and Almond Cake
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 Celsius, and grease a cake pan.
Beat the butter and sugar together until creamy. Add the lime zest and vanilla.
Add the eggs, one by one, until well mixed.
Grind the almonds and shelled pistachios in the blender. Mix into the batter along with the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Pour the batter into the pan and bake 45 minutes, or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.

name: Bloody Mary Smoothie

ingredients.prep: shakes of, plus more to taste
ingredients.name: Tabasco Sauce
ingredients.fullName: 10 Tabasco Sauce (shakes of, plus more to taste)

ingredients.name: sea salt
ingredients.fullName: 1 teaspoon sea salt (plus more to taste)

instructions: Place all the ingredients in the blender jar of the KitchenAid® Pro Line® Series Blender. Secure the lid and set the Blender to the Adapti-Blend™ Smoothie program. Blend until machine turns itself off. Alternatively, blend for 40-60 seconds, starting on speed 1 and gradually increasing to speed 10 or 11, until smooth and creamy.
Serve immediately.

name: Zucchini Breakfast Pancakes
instructions: In a blender, mix the eggs, oil, flour, salt, cheese, and herbs. The batter will be thick.
Add the zucchini and mix.
Heat a nonstick pan and melt some butter over medium heat.
Pour the batter onto the pan to make 8-centimeter pancakes.
Brown on both sides and serve.

name: Apple & Spice Pork Roast
instructions: Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Stir together applesauce, brown sugar, vinegar, mustard and cloves in small bowl; refrigerate half of the applesauce mixture and set aside remaining applesauce mixture. Combine flour, salt, sugar, garlic powder and pepper in another small bowl.

Rub flour mixture evenly over entire surface of pork. Place pork on rack in shallow roasting pan. Roast, uncovered, until internal temperature is 140 degrees F. Spoon reserved applesauce mixture over roast. Roast 1 to 1 1/2 hours total cooking time (about 20 minutes per pound) until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees F. Remove roast from oven to serving platter; cover with foil and let rest about 10 minutes before slicing.
Heat chilled applesauce mixture in small saucepan until boiling; boil for 1 minute. Spoon heated applesauce mixture over pork slices.

name: Coffee, Rum, and Lemon Drink
instructions: Cut the lemon into thin slices. In a pitcher, add the sugar, the lemon, and the crushed ice cubes.
Add the coffee and water.
Add rum to taste. Serve over ice.

name: Cinnamon Toast Twisties
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Cut off the crusts of each slice of toast and use a rolling pin to make them very thin.
Brush a generous amount of melted butter on both sides of each slice of bread and sprinkle with a generous amount of sugar and cinnamon.
Fold the sides towards the center and roll up the slices carefully, then place them in buttered muffin pans.
Sprinkle again with some more sugar and cinnamon and bake for approximately 15 minutes until golden brown. Turn the oven's broiler on and broil for a few minutes.

name: BUTTERNUT SQUASH, APPLE AND NUT MUFFINS

ingredients.name: butternut squash
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup butternut squash (seeded, peeled and diced)

instructions: Preheat oven to 180C.
Cook the squash for about 10 minutes until it is tender.
Puree the squash in a bowl.
Measure 1/2 cup and reserve the rest.
Mix with a whisk the eggs and squash, the sugar, the coconut milk, the oil and vanilla.
In another bowl, mix the brown rice flour, white flour, crushed nuts, tapioca starch, and baking soda.
Mix the two preparations and add apples and hazelnut flour.
Pour into molds and bake for about 20 to 30 minutes.
It may be kept for 3 days in the refrigerator and 1 month in the freezer.

name: Pork Chop and Waffle Sandwiches with Maple Gravy

ingredients.name: boneless pork loin chops
ingredients.fullName: 4 boneless pork loin chops (about 1/4-inch thick, thin-cut)

instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp , 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate and set aside (leave the bacon fat in the skillet).
While the bacon is cooking, in a small bowl, combine the sour cream and maple syrup. Set aside.

In a shallow bowl or pie pan, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. Place the egg in another shallow bowl or pie pan. Return the skillet to medium-high heat. One chop at a time, dredge the pork in the flour mixture, shaking off the excess, then the egg, then the flour mixture again, adding the coated chops to the skillet. Cook the chops until browned and cooked through, about 2 1/2 minutes per side.
Arrange 4 waffles on plates or a platter. Top with the bacon, pork chops, sour cream mixture, and remaining waffles and serve.

name: Fresh Pasta with Mushroom Cream Sauce
instructions: Combine the semolina and all purpose flour together in the bowl of a KitchenAid® 5-Quart Stand Mixer. Make a well in the center.
Lightly beat the 4 eggs together. Pour into the well. Beat on speed “2” for 1 – 2 minutes or until the dough starts to come together.
Transfer to a lightly floured surface and then kneed for 3 – 4 minutes or until the dough becomes slightly elastic. Form into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap and allow to rest for 20 – 30 minutes.
After the dough has rested, cut dough into 4 equal pieces.

Fit the pasta roller attachment on to your KitchenAid® stand mixer. Working with one piece of dough at a time, roll the dough through the pasta roller attachment on the “1” setting 4 times, folding the dough in half after each pass through. Turn the pasta roller attachment to the “2” setting and roll pasta 2 times, folding the dough in half after each pass through. Turn the pasta roller attachment to “3” and pass the dough through 2 more times. Do not fold the dough in half after the last pass through. Lay pasta sheet on a lightly floured surface while you repeat with remaining pieces of dough.

Fit the pasta cutter attachment on to your KitchenAid® stand mixer. Pass the pasta sheets, one at a time, through the pasta cutter attachment and cut into fettucini. If the noodles are too long you can cut them with kitchen shears halfway through. Toss pasta with all purpose flour to keep from sticking.
Bring a large pot of water to boil. Cook pasta 2 – 3 minutes or until al dente. Reserve 1/4 cup of pasta water. Drain.

While you are waiting for the pasta water to boil, heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook just until the mushrooms start to brown, about 3 minutes. Add in garlic and shallots. Continue cooking until mushrooms have browned and garlic and shallots have softened. Add in butter. Cook until butter melts.

Whisk together heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Slowly stir cream and cheese mixture into the mushroom mixture. Cook just until thickened slightly, about 3 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Stir in cooked noodles. Toss to coat in the sauce. If the sauce appears too thick, pour in some of the reserved pasta water. Toss with fresh parsley. Serve.

name: Waffles

ingredients.name: grams melted butter
ingredients.fullName: 180 grams melted butter (cooled to room temperature)

instructions: Mix the yeast with the cup of lukewarm milk and let rest 5 minutes.
Mix the egg yolks with the remaining lukewarm milk and the butter. Add to the yeast mixture.
Add the sugar and salt and then the flour alternating with the milk, flour last.
Beat the egg whites until peaks are formed and fold into the batter.
Cover with plastic wrap and let rest in a warm place until doubled in volume, up to 1 or 2 hours.
Lightly mix to deflate the batter. Make waffles with the batter, following the directions on the waffle iron.

name: Hake Medallions with Spinach and Cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).
Remove hake and spinach from freezer.
Place hake medallions in a greased baking dish.
Spread spinach evenly on top of hake, so that baking sheet is covered.
For the sauce, mix the double cream with mustard and curry.
Pour over spinach and sprinkle with grated cheese, to taste.
Bake in preheated oven for about 30 minutes.
Serve with boiled potatoes, if desired.

name: Cream of Tomato Soup
instructions: Heat the cooking oil in a large pot and cook the onion until it becomes a light golden color.
Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Add the tomatoes, herbs, and water, cover and cook for 5 minutes.
Turn off the stove and pour the cooked vegetables into a blender along with the milk.
Liquefy the vegetables, and pour everything back into the pot. Heat until the soup begins to bubble.
Taste-test the soup before serving and add salt or sugar (if it’s too acidic) if necessary.

name: Savory Steaks With Mushroom & Port Sauce

ingredients.name: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread
ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread

ingredients.name: dry red wine
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup dry red wine (or balsamic vinegar)

ingredients.prep: knorr, classics au jus gravy mix
ingredients.name: gravy
ingredients.fullName: 1 package gravy (knorr, classics au jus gravy mix)

instructions: In 10-inch nonstick skillet, melt Spread over medium-high heat and cook mushrooms and shallots, stirring occasionally, 6 minutes or until mushrooms start to brown. Stir in wine and Knorr ® Gravy Classics Au Jus Gravy Mix blended with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally. 6 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Serve sauce over steaks.

name: Drop Biscuits

ingredients.name: White Lily® Enriched Bleached Self-Rising Flour
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups White Lily® Enriched Bleached Self-Rising Flour

ingredients.prep: or buttermilk, plus additional as needed
ingredients.name: milk
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup milk (or buttermilk, plus additional as needed)

instructions: HEAT oven to 500°F. Coat baking sheet with no-stick cooking spray.
MEASURE flour into large bowl. Cut in shortening with pastry blender or 2 knives until crumbs are the size of peas.
BLEND in just enough milk with fork until dough leaves sides of bowl. If needed, add more milk to form soft dough. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto prepared baking sheet.
BAKE 8 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.

TIP - 
Cooled biscuits can be frozen up to one month in plastic food storage bags. Reheat by placing in oven 5 to 10 minutes at 350°F or microwave about 1 minute.

name: Bertolli Spaghetti & Meatballs
instructions: Combine ground beef, Parmesan cheese, bread crumbs, water, egg, garlic and salt in medium bowl; shape into 12 meatballs.
Bring Sauce to a boil over medium-high heat in 3-quart saucepan. Gently stir in uncooked meatballs.
Reduce heat to low and simmer covered, stirring occasionally, 20 minutes or until meatballs are done. Serve over hot spaghetti and sprinkle, if desired, with Parmesan cheese.

name: Shrimp Boil

ingredients.name: ears corn on the cob
ingredients.fullName: 4 ears corn on the cob (cut in half)

instructions: Set the Smart Oven+ Attachment base pan with heating element and Steamer Water Basin Pan on the oven rack. Add 4 cups of water to the Water Basin Pan and place Perforated Steamer Tray in it.

Place potatoes, onion and lemon in 9" x 13" pan. Season with Old Bay Seasoning, salt and black pepper. Pour 3 cups boiling water over potatoes and place on Perforated Steamer Tray. Cover Steamer with Lid.

On STEAM mode, steam the potatoes for 30-35 minutes until tender. Add corn and sausage; continue to steam another 10 minutes. Toss shrimp over top and steam an additional 5-6 minutes until shrimp is cooked through.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with parsley and Old BaySeasoning if you like. Serve with lemon wedges and crusty bread.

name: Apple Spiral Coffee Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350° F

Butter 9-inch cake pan. Combine flour, salt and baking soda in a large bowl. Place 1/2 cup softened butter and both sugars in bowl of KitchenAid® Stand Mixer with Flat Beater attached. Mix on Speed 4 until combined, 3-4 minutes. Add eggs and vanilla and mix until just combined, about 1 minute. Add flour mixture 1 cup at a time, alternately with sour cream, ending with sour cream. Do not over mix. Spread batter into prepared pan.

Attach Vegetable Sheet Cutter Attachment to KitchenAid® Stand Mixer. Insert food holder into center of one end of apple and secure onto attachment. Insert food skewer through apple, up to first mark. Attach Thin Blade to attachment. Position bowl under blade to catch apple. Turn Stand Mixer to Speed 2 and position blade against apple to process. Drizzle apple sheet with lemon juice to prevent browning. Transfer to cutting board and cut horizontally then into 4-5-inch lengths.
Push apple sheets vertically into batter making swirling patterns. Sprinkle with crunch topping and bake until pick comes out clean, 35-40 minutes.
Remove from oven and cool completely before serving.

name: Arugula Salad with Iberian Ham and Parmesan
instructions: Rinse green beans and cut in half lengthwise, then cut into small pieces.
Blanch in boiling water for 5 minutes, drain and plunge into ice water and drain again when cool.
In a serving dish, arrange arugula and green beans and season lightly with salt.
Sprinkle with finely chopped Iberian ham and Parmesan cheese.
Drizzle with olive oil and serve immediately.

name: Beef and Broccoli Bowl

ingredients.name: sirloin steak
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound sirloin steak (thinly sliced 1/4-inch across the grain)

ingredients.name: carrot
ingredients.fullName: 1 large carrot (2”diameter or small carrots, peeled)

instructions: Combine 1 tablespoon soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, 1 teaspoon ginger, 1/2 teaspoon garlic, red pepper flakes in a medium bowl. Toss steak with mixture and refrigerate until ready to use.

Mix together hoisin, orange juice and remaining soy sauce, ginger and garlic in a small bowl; set aside. Prepare broccoli by cutting florets into bite-sized pieces (about 5 cups). Trim any stalks off stem and cut the bottom 1/2-inch or toughest part of stem off. Peel stem if desired.

Attach Spiralizer Attachment to the KitchenAid® Stand Mixer. Trim ends off carrot. Cut broccoli stem and carrot to fit Spiralizer Attachment. Center carrot on fruit and vegetable skewer; attach to Spiralizer. Attach fine spiralizing blade and position at end of carrot. Turn stand mixer to speed 4 and process until blade reaches end of carrot. Remove fine spiralizing blade and replace with spiral slice small core blade. Spiral slice broccoli stems. Cut spiralized vegetables to desired length.

Heat 12-inch non-stick skillet over medium-high heat and add 1 tablespoon oil. Cook half the steak for 3 to 4 minutes or until browned but not cooked all the way through. Remove to platter and repeat with the rest of the steak. Add florets, spiralized broccoli and carrot to the hot pan and cook, stirring constantly for 3 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water to pan and immediately cover with lid, allow vegetables to steam for 3 to 4 minutes or until most of the water has evaporated and vegetables are almost tender. Add beef and sauce to pan and cook, uncovered, until sauce is simmering and beef is cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in green onions.
Divide rice into 4 bowls, top with beef and broccoli. Garnish with additional green onion, if desired.

name: Roast Pork Loin Southwest Style
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add tomatoes, onion, cilantro, tomatillos, garlic, jalapeno pepper and chilies; cook about 2 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring frequently. Add oregano, cumin, red pepper and coriander; mix well. Refrigerate mixture until thoroughly chilled.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Spray shallow baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Using sharp knife, cut 8-10 slits about 1 inch long and 1 inch deep in top and sides of pork roast. Press heaping teaspoonful of cold vegetable mixture into each slit; spread remaining mixture over top and sides of roast. Place in prepared pan. Roast for about 1 1/4 hours (about 20 minutes per pound), or until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees F. Remove roast from oven; let rest about 10 minutes before slicing.

name: Chocolate Affogato

ingredients.prep: freshly brewed shot N, espresso, 1.5 ounce espresso size
ingredients.name: espresso
ingredients.fullName: 1 espresso (freshly brewed shot N, espresso, 1.5 ounce espresso size)

ingredients.prep: chocolate, or premium chocolate ice cream
ingredients.name: scoops gelato
ingredients.fullName: 2 scoops gelato (chocolate, or premium chocolate ice cream)

instructions: Brew a shot of espresso using the Nespresso® by KitchenAid® machine. To brew, start by turning on the machine by touching the brew button. Lift the handle and insert your desired espresso capsule into the capsule door, and lower the handle to shut the capsule compartment. Place a cup on the cup holder. Turn the selection dial to the second setting (40 ml) for an espresso-sized brew. Press the brew button to brew your espresso.
To assemble the affogato, place the gelato in the bottom of a small coffee cup or bowl. Pour the hot espresso over the top of the gelato. Sprinkle with any desired toppings and enjoy immediately.

name: Gingered Pork with Peanut Sauce
instructions: Cut tenderloin into 1/4-inch slices, cut each slice in half. Cook noodles as directed on package; drain, reserving cooking water, and keep warm. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over high heat; add pork, red pepper flakes and ginger. Cook and stir until pork is done, about 4-5 minutes. Remove pork and keep warm. Blend peanut butter, 1/2 cup reserved cooking water and soy sauce; heat and stir until hot, adding more cooking water, if needed. Toss cooked pork, noodles, spinach and green onions with peanut sauce.

name: Meatball Casserole

ingredients.name: jar Old World Style® Pasta Sauce (1 jar (1 lb.))
ingredients.fullName: 1 jar (1 lb. 8 oz.) Ragu® Old World Style® Pasta Sauce (1 jar (1 lb.))

ingredients.name: part-skim mozzarella cheese
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups part-skim mozzarella cheese (shredded, about 8 oz.)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.

Process onion and garlic in food processor until finely chopped. Heat olive oil over in 8-inch skillet over medium heat and cook onion mixture, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until onion is translucent. Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Combine onion mixture with remaining ingredients except mozzarella cheese and Pasta Sauce in large bowl; shape into 20 (2-in.) meatballs.

Arrange meatballs in 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake 25 minutes; pour Pasta Sauce over meatballs, then sprinkle with cheese. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until meatballs are thoroughly cooked. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.

name: Harvest Empanadas

ingredients.name: Jimmy Dean® Original Sausage Crumbles
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup Jimmy Dean® Original Sausage Crumbles

ingredients.name: refrigerated pie crusts
ingredients.fullName: 2 packages refrigerated pie crusts (softened as directed on pkg.)

ingredients.name: sweet potato
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup sweet potato (finely chopped and peeled)

instructions: Preheat oven of 400⁰F.
Cook and stir olive oil and sweet potatoes over MEDIUM heat 3-5 minutes or until sweet potatoes start to brown.
Stir in sausage crumbles and apples, cook and stir for 3-4 minutes or until hot and sweet potato is tender. Stir in cheese, cinnamon and salt.

Remove pie crust from pouch. Unroll pie crust onto lightly floured surface. Roll pie crust to 18-inches in diameter. Cut out circles using a 2-½inch round cookie cutter. Place 1 heaping teaspoon sausage mixture in the center of each circle. Moisten edges of dough with water; fold dough over and press edges to seal. Use fork to seal edges.
Place on cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining pie crusts and filling. Brush tops lightly with egg.
Bake 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and hot in center.

name: Yogurt Cheesecake with Orange
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Grease a pie pan with margarine. Set aside.
Mix sugar, eggs, and margarine in the food processor.
Add the flour and knead.
Finally add the yogurt, orange juice and zest, and knead again.
If necessary, finish mixing with the spatula.
Spread the dough in the pie pan.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, until cooked and golden brown.
Open the oven door, and let cool in the oven for about 10 minutes.

name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F).
Cook pasta in plenty of boiling, salted water and a drizzle of olive oil.
Melt butter in a saucepan and heat until lightly browned.
Add flour and stir until golden.
Slowly stir in milk, stirring constantly with a wire whisk.
Bring to boil and continue to stir constantly.
Cook until mixture thickens slightly and mix in cream.
Remove from heat and add egg yolks.
Season with salt, pepper and a pinch of nutmeg.
Add tuna and mix well.
Drain the pasta and rinse in cold water.
Drain again and pasta to pan with tuna and sauce.
Blend well.
Spread a layer of pasta mixture in the bottom of a baking dish and sprinkle with grated cheese.
Cover with another layer of pasta and repeat steps until there are no ingredients left, ending with grated cheese.
Arrange small pieces of butter over the surface.
