ingredients.name: ed bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 red bell pepper (large, cut into 8 pieces)

ingredients.name: reen bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 green bell pepper (large, cut into 8 pieces)

instructions: Squeeze juice from limes, reserving peel. In small bowl, combine lime juice, soy sauce, oregano leaves, thyme leaves, cayenne, garlic, parsley and bay leaf; blend well. Place pork cubes in plastic bag or nonmetal bowl. Pour marinade mixture over pork, turning to coat. Seal bag or cover dish; marinate at least 2 hours or overnight in refrigerator, turning pork several times.

Remove lime peel, parsley sprigs and bay leaf from marinade; discard. Remove pork from marinade, reserve marinade. Drain pork well. Heat oil in large skillet over high heat. Add brown sugar; stir until sugar is brown and bubbly. Add pork cubes; cook and stir about 5 minutes or until pork is browned. Reduce heat to low. Add onions, tomatoes, peppers and reserved marinade; simmer 10-15 minutes or until pork is tender.

name: Banana Ice Cream – 3 Ways

ingredients.name: vanilla beans
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 teaspoon vanilla beans (or vanilla bean powder)

ingredients.name: maple syrup
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon maple syrup (or liquid sweetener of choice)

instructions: Combine the bananas and vanilla (for the vanilla bean flavor), the bananas and strawberries (for the strawberry flavor), or just the bananas (for the dark chocolate flavor) into the 3-cup work bowl of your KitchenAid® Food Processor.

Process the mixture on high until smooth and creamy, scraping down the sides as needed. At this step, you can also add in the sweetener (for the strawberry flavor) or the cocoa powder and syrup (for the dark chocolate flavor) and process until incoporated.
Serve immediately for a softer ice cream, or transfer to a freezer-safe container and freeze for at least 1 hour for a harder ice cream.

name: Oven-fried Cornmeal Crusted Potato Wedges

ingredients.name: aking potatoes
ingredients.fullName: 3 baking potatoes (large, cut into 6 wedges each)

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise

instructions: Combine corn meal with sugar in medium bowl; set aside.
Combine remaining ingredients except potatoes in large resealable plastic bag. Add potatoes; turn to coat, then coat with cornmeal mixture, shaking off excess.
Preheat oven to 375°. Spray baking sheet with no-stick cooking spray; set aside.
Arrange potatoes in single layer on prepared baking sheet. Bake, turning once, 40 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Southwestern Sausage Ravioli and Avocado Salsa Vinaigrette

ingredients.name: Jimmy Dean® Turkey Sausage Crumbles
ingredients.fullName: 1 package Jimmy Dean® Turkey Sausage Crumbles

ingredients.prep: large, roasted, peeled, seeded and chopped
ingredients.name: poblano chile peppers
ingredients.fullName: 2 poblano chile peppers (large, roasted, peeled, seeded and chopped)

instructions: Combine sausage, cheese, shallot, garlic and pepper in a large bowl. Beat egg with water. Place one wonton wrapper on clean working surface; brush edges with egg wash. Place 1 tablespoon sausage mixture onto center of each wrapper. Top with second wrapper. Press edges together to seal. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to cook.
Place peppers, garlic, lime juice, vinegar and sugar in a blender container; process until smooth, adding water, if necessary to puree. Add olive oil; process until smooth.
Combine avocado, tomato, onion and cilantro in a large bowl. Add the vinaigrette; toss lightly.
Cook ravioli, in batches, in boiling water 2 to 3 min. or until ravioli floats to top.
Serve warm ravioli in bowls with salsa vinaigrette.

name: Thai-hitian Chicken Sliders with Spicy Peanut Slaw

ingredients.name: Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter

ingredients.name: Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter

instructions: For Peanut Slaw: WHISK together peanut butter, pineapple topping, lime juice, soy sauce, gingerroot and red pepper flakes in large bowl until smooth. Stir in cole slaw mix, green onion and cilantro. Cover and chill until ready to serve.

For Sliders: COMBINE peanut butter, pineapple preserves, gingerroot, soy sauce and garlic in large bowl. Add chicken and bread crumbs. Mix gently. Roll chicken mixture into 12 equal sized balls. Press each ball down slightly to form patties.

HEAT 1 tablesoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. Place 6 patties in skillet. Cook 3 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Remove; keep warm. Repeat with remaining oil and 6 patties. Place each patty over roll bottoms. Place pineapple slice, if desired, on top of patty. Spoon equal portions of slaw over each patty. Cover with roll tops.
*Ground turkey can be substituted for ground chicken.

name: Speculaas (Belgian cookies)
instructions: 1. Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and pinch of salt.

2. Add spices. You can add a teaspoon of cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg, ginger, aniseeds and clove. Adjust to taste. Some people add white ground pepper, others add red pepper too. Anything goes but don't overdo it.
3. Add the butter, first use a fork to flatten and soften it, then use your hands to mix it in the flour and sugar. The result should be more like greasy sugar than like dough.
4. Make a hole in the middle and add the yolk. Collapse the hole, and continue mixing with your hands.
5. Make another hole in the middle and add the milk. Collapse again, and continue mixing. The dough is good when it sticks on your hands, but not on the surface.
6. Roll the dough into a piece of baking paper, tin foil or a kitchen towel, and leave in a cold place (eg. a fridge) overnight.
7. preheat oven to 175° C

8. Take the roll of dough and cut into round cookies of about 3-4 mm thick. Alternatively, roll out the dough and use cookie forms. Traditionally, speculaas dough is rolled over wooden speculaas baking forms and turned over to produce an image and shape.

9. Allow to bake at 175° for about 25 minutes. The cookies should rise gently. Check if they're ready by tapping a spoon onto a cookie. If there is dough sticking on the cookie, it's not ready yet. At this stage the cookies are still soft and should slightly budge under the spoon. If they're getting black around the edges, they're overcooked.
10. Allow to cool for about 25 minutes. This gives the cookies time to harden and become real speculaas cookies.
11. Best kept (for weeks if necessary) in a firmly closed tin box.

name: Cheesy Baked Cauliflower Tots

ingredients.name: cauliflower
ingredients.fullName: 4 ounces cauliflower (finely chopped, about 2 heaping cups)

instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper.
Place the chopped cauliflower in the bowl of a food processor or blender. Pulse multiple times, until the florets have the same texture as couscous. Transfer the cauliflower to a mixing bowl.

Add the bread crumbs, cheese, egg, egg white, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and black pepper to the bowl with the cauliflower. Mix with a rubber spatula until the ingredients are thoroughly combined and hold together when pinched.
Shape the mixture into 24 “tots,” using about a tablespoon of the mixture for each tot, and arrange them on the prepared sheet pan.
Bake the tots for 15 minutes on the middle rack of the oven.
Turn the tots over and continue baking until golden brown, 8-10 minutes longer.
Check to see that tots are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Serve tots immediately, with ketchup, if desired.

name: Sweet Layers
instructions: Make the puddings according to instructions.
Drizzle serving bowls with liquid caramel, and pour in the pudding mix.
On top of the pudding, put the chocolate wafers dipped quickly in warm milk.
Whip the cream until solid and spread on top.
Garnish to taste.
Refrigerate. Serve cold.

name: Pork with Sugar Snap Peas, Chilli & Mint
instructions: 1. Heat the wok and add some oil (groundnut is best)
2. Add the pork and stir fry till the outsides are cooked and browned
3. Add the sugar and dissolve in the liquid that's formed, then add the fish sauce
4. Add the chilli, peas and mint, adding a little more water if it needs more liquid
5. Stir fry for a couple of minutes then add some straight-to-wok noodles
6. Stir those in for another minute then serve

name: Grilled Ham with Martini Sauce
instructions: Preheat the oven to 140 Celsius.
Salt the pork and sprinkle with thyme. Set aside.
Mix the vermouth with the allspice and sugar. Heat in a saucepan until reduced to 3/4 of its original volume.
Cut diagonal lines into the pork and place into a baking pan, skin side up. Brush to cover completely with the sauce and pour the remaining sauce into the bottom of the baking pan.
Bake 3 1/2-4 hours, depending on the size, removing every half hour to baste with the sauce.
Bake until at a temperature of 60 Celsius. Remove form oven and set aside for 5 minutes before cutting. Serve drizzled with sauce.

name: Honey Walnut Baked Brie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Place wheel of Brie on baking sheet. Arrange walnuts on top, and drizzle with the honey.
Bake Brie 10-15 minutes on the middle rack of oven, until sides are slightly puffed and walnuts smell toasted.
Check to see that Brie is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Carefully transfer Brie to a plate and drizzle with honey. Serve immediately with crackers or bread.

name: For 4 People
instructions: Preheat the oven to 210 degrees Celsius.
Wash and dry potatoes and artichokes.
Arrange them in a baking dish and sprinkle with coarse salt.
Add the fresh thyme sprigs and drizzle with olive oil
Bake for about 30 minutes until tender.
In another dish place the rack of lamb.
In a bowl mix the grated cheddar cheese, the egg yolk, 1 tablespoon of thyme leaves and a pinch of  freshly ground pepper.
Spread a layer of cheese mixture on the rack of lamb.
Bake for about 20 to 25 minutes.
Cover the dish with an aluminum foil and let stand for about 4/5 minutes before carving.
Dress the arugula with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
To serve, arrange the rack of lamb along with cooked vegetables and arugula salad.

name: Brunch Peanut Butter Muffins

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour

ingredients.prep: OR Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter
ingredients.name: Jif Creamy Peanut Butter
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons Jif Creamy Peanut Butter (OR Jif® Extra Crunchy Peanut Butter)

instructions: HEAT oven to 400ºF. Spray a 12-cup muffin pan with a no-stick cooking spray or line with paper cups.

STIR together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in medium bowl. Combine egg, milk and oil in small bowl. Add liquids to flour mixture, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened. Divide batter evenly among cups.
COMBINE sugar, flour, peanut butter and salt in small bowl, mixing with fork until crumbly. Divide topping over muffins. Lightly stir into muffin with knife.
BAKE 18 to 23 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on rack 5 minutes. Remove from pan to rack to cool completely.

name: Honey Plum Smoothie
instructions: Rinse, halve, and pit the plums.
Place everything in a blender or food processor and blend. Clean the sides of the blender with a spatula, add the yogurts, and finely blend until desired consistency.
Add an ice cube, drizzle in some honey, and serve.

name: Cajun Coffee Chuck Roast
instructions: To a blender or food processor, add all the ingredients from the coffee grounds through the cayenne pepper. Blend well for 30 sec.
In a large skillet over medium heat, add canola oil.
Add 1/2 of seasoning rub to one side of chuck roast, pressing into the meat. Place meat, seasoned side down onto the hot pan.
Sear for 3 min. adding remainder of seasoning to bare side of chuck roast. Flip roast and sear other side another 3 min.

Add roast to a 4-quart or larger crock pot. Add beef broth to crock pot, secure lid and turn to high. Cook for 5 hours, meat should be tender and shred easily with 2 forks. Serve with extra drippings.

name: Whole Wheat Tortillas
instructions: Mix the white flour, whole wheat flour, salt, and baking powder in a large bowl.
Heat the vegetable oil and water until they are warm, using separate containers for each one.
Add the vegetable oil to the flour and knead.
Slowly add the water to the flour and keep kneading until the dough has a smooth texture.
Make 20 dough balls with your hands, and then flatten each ball as much as you can using a rolling pin.
Heat a frying pan/griddle on medium-high flame, and grill the tortillas until they toast on each side.
Let them cool off for 10 minutes and serve. You can also store them in any sealed container or ziplock bag for up to 1 month in the freezer.

name: Honey-Ginger Baked Chicken Wings
instructions: Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels.

Place the honey, brown sugar, soy sauce, and lemon juice in a large mixing bowl. Use the edge of a spoon to scrape the outer skin from the knob of ginger root and discard. Grate the flesh of the ginger into the mixing bowl. Whisk the honey ginger mixture to thoroughly combine.
Place the chicken wings in the mixing bowl. Using a rubber spatula, toss the chicken wings to evenly coat in the honey-garlic glaze.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap, and place in the refrigerator to marinate for 1-12 hours.
Preheat the oven to 425°F. Remove the marinated chicken wings from the refrigerator.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Use a pair of kitchen tongs to lift each chicken wing from the bowl, allowing the excess marinade to drip off, and transfer onto the foil-covered roasting rack. Do not discard the leftover marinade.
Bake the chicken wings for 40-42 minutes, until browned and crispy.
Pour the leftover marinade into a small skillet set over medium heat. Bring the marinade to a boil, whisking constantly.
Boil the marinade for 2-3 minutes, whisking occasionally, until it is reduced to about 1/3 cup. Remove from the heat. The marinade will thicken slightly as it cools.
Check to see that chicken wings are done (the chicken's internal temperature should read 165°F). Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Brush the tops of the chicken wings with the reduced marinade. Transfer the chicken wings to a plate and serve.

name: Sausage and Cheese Quiche

ingredients.name: low moisture mozzarella cheese
ingredients.fullName: 2 ounces low moisture mozzarella cheese (shredded, 2 oz. per 1/2 cup)

ingredients.name: shredded cheddar cheese
ingredients.fullName: 2 ounces shredded cheddar cheese (2 oz. per 1/2 cup)

instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Arrange a rack to the lowest position in the oven.
Poke the bottom of the frozen pie shell with a fork, and place on a baking sheet.
Pro tip: Docking a pie crust by poking holes in it with a fork allows steam to escape, avoiding bubbles in the crust while baking
Bake the pie shell for 12-14 minutes or according to package directions on the bottom rack of oven, until the bottom is slightly puffed. Remove from the oven and set aside.
Reduce the oven to 350°F.
Place two sheets of paper towels on a large dinner plate, and set aside.
Set a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place the sausage in the skillet. Cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes, using a rubber spatula to break up the sausage into small pieces as it cooks.
Transfer the sausage onto the paper-towel lined dinner plate to drain.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, heavy cream, salt, and black pepper, until smooth.
Place the sausage and shredded cheeses into the egg and milk mixture. Fold with a rubber spatula until the sausage and cheeses are evenly distributed.
Pour the egg, sausage, and cheese mixture into the pie shell. Cover the edges of the pie shells with pie guards or strips of aluminum foil to avoid burning or over-browning the crust.
Bake the quiche for 45-55 minutes on the bottom rack of oven, until the top is firm and golden brown.
Check to see that quiche is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow to cool for at least 30 minutes at room temperature before slicing and serving. Leftover quiche may be stored covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

name: SunButter Muffins
instructions: Heat oven to 400°F.
Place paper liners in cups of muffin pan or grease each cup and set aside.
In large bowl sift together flour, sugar, baking power and salt; set aside.

In small bowl combine eggs and milk, stir with fork to blend. Add SunButter and continue blending until smooth, then pour into flour mixture along with melted butter. Stir until flour mixture is moistened. Do not over mix.
Fill prepared muffin pan cups about two-thirds full and bake for 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center of muffin comes out clean.

name: Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage and Cheddar Overnight Bread Pudding

ingredients.name: ound crusty white bread
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound crusty white bread (cut into 3/4-inch cubes)

ingredients.name: Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage
ingredients.fullName: 1 package Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage (bias-sliced 1/2-inch thick)

instructions: In a large skillet, heat butter over medium heat. Add onion, red pepper, and garlic. Cook and stir 6 to 8 minutes or until just browned. In a very large bowl combine onion mixture, bread cubes, sausage, 2 1/2 cups cheese, and parsley. Transfer mixture to a greased 3-quart rectangular baking dish.

In a medium bowl, whisk together the eggs, half-and-half, salt, and black pepper. Pour evenly over the bread mixture. Press lightly with the back of a large spoon to moisten all of the ingredients. Cover with foil. Chill 4 to 24 hours.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Bake, covered, for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake 30 to 35 minutes more.
Remove from oven. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup cheese. Let stand 15 minutes; serve warm. Garnish with chives, if desired.

name: Warm Parmesan Spinach Dip

ingredients.prep: Birds Eye®, cooked, drained, cooled and squeezed dry
ingredients.name: frozen chopped spinach
ingredients.fullName: 10 ounces frozen chopped spinach (Birds Eye®, cooked, drained, cooled and squeezed dry)

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise

instructions: Preheat oven to 350ºF. Combine spinach, mayonnaise, sour cream, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese and garlic in large bowl. Season, if desired, with freshly ground black pepper. Turn into 2-quart baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
Bake 20 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese, then continue baking until cheese is melted, about 2 minutes.
Sprinkle with tomato and green onion. Serve, if desired, with cubed French or Italian bread.

name: Chicken Vesuvio
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Arrange potatoes in single layer in shallow baking pan. Layer chicken on top of potatoes.
Combine oil and lemon juice; brush chicken and potatoes with oil mixture. Sprinkle chicken and potatoes with garlic, Italian seasoning and salt and pepper.
Bake 50 to 55 minutes or until chicken is done (internal temp 180°F).

name: Holiday Spiced Chocolate Layer Cake

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and lightly flour two 8-inch square cake pans; set aside.

In large bowl, with electric mixer on low speed, beat cake mix, Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise, water, eggs, orange liqueur and cinnamon 30 seconds. Beat on medium speed, scraping sides occasionally, 2 minutes.
Pour batter into prepared pans.3. Bake 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean. On wire rack, cool 10 minutes; remove from pans and cool completely.
For Sweetened Whipped Cream, in mixing bowl, with electric mixer, beat all ingredients until cream forms stiff peaks.
Evenly cut each cake into 8 rectangles, then cut each rectangle in half horizontally. Spread orange marmalade onto 8 halves, then top with remaining half. Evenly spread Sweetened Whipped Cream.

name: Roasted Garlic Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry

ingredients.prep: McCormick® Perfect Pinch®, & Bell Pepper Seasoning
ingredients.name: roasted garlic
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon roasted garlic (McCormick® Perfect Pinch®, & Bell Pepper Seasoning)

ingredients.name: boneless beef sirloin steak
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 pounds boneless beef sirloin steak (cut in 1/4-inch strips)

instructions: Mix water, soy sauce, Seasoning, cornstarch and ginger in small bowl until smooth. Set aside.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Add beef in batches; stir fry 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add additional oil if needed. Remove beef from skillet. Add vegetables to skillet; stir fry 3 minutes. Return beef to skillet.
Stir soy sauce mixture. Add to skillet; stirring constantly, bring to boil on medium heat and boil 1 minute. Serve with cooked rice, if desired.

name: Orange Jelly with Chocolate Mascarpone Cream
instructions: Dissolve gelatin powder in a little cold orange juice.
Heat remaining orange juice in a saucepan and bring nearly to boiling, then turn off heat.
Add dissolved gelatin mixture to warm juice and mix well.
Pour into dessert cups and cool until set.
Beat the mascarpone with sugar and chocolate until smooth and creamy.
Place mascarpone mixture in a pastry bag and pipe a decorative swirl to top each orange jelly.
Sprinkle with slivered almonds.

name: Lug Nut Coffeecakes

ingredients.name: Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise (divided)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°. Spray cups and tos of 24-cup mini-muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray; set aside.
Combine 1/2 cup flour, 1/3 cup sugar, 1/4 cup Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise, walnuts and cinnamon in medium bowl with fork. Gently squeeze mixture with fingers to form crumbs; set aside.

Beat remaining 1 cup sugar with eggs in large bowl with wire whisk. Whisk in remaining 1/2 cup Mayonnaise and vanilla. Whisk in remaining 1 cup flour just until combined. Evenly pour into prepared pan, then evenly sprinkle with crumbs.

Bake 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes in pan. Remove coffeecakes to wire rack and cool completely. Sprinkle, if desired, with confectioners sugar before serving.

name: Skinny Carrot Cake with Greek Yogurt Cream Cheese Frosting

ingredients.name: light brown sugar
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup light brown sugar (150g per 3/4 cup, packed)

ingredients.prep: or a blend of cinnamon, ginger powder, nutmeg, allspice and ground cloves
ingredients.name: pumpkin pie spice
ingredients.fullName: 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice (or a blend of cinnamon, ginger powder, nutmeg, allspice and ground cloves)

ingredients.name: reduced fat cream cheese
ingredients.fullName: 12 ounces reduced fat cream cheese (softened at room temperature)

instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Spray two 8-9-inch cake pans liberally with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
Grate the carrots.
Place the canola oil, applesauce, brown sugar, granulated sugar, eggs, crushed pineapple, and 1 tsp. vanilla extract in a large mixing bowl. Whisk vigorously until smooth and combined.
Add the flour, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the bowl. Continue whisking until the mixture is just combined. Do not over-mix.
Pro tip: Don't have pumpkin pie spice? Blend your own with a mixture of 9 parts cinnamon, 2 parts ginger powder, 2 parts nutmeg, 1 part allspice and 1 part ground cloves.
Fold in the grated carrots.
Pour the batter evenly between the two cake pans.
Bake the cakes for 28-33 minutes on the middle rack of oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Check to see that cakes are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the cakes to cool in the pans for 15-20 minutes.

To release the cake, run a butter knife between the edge of the cake and the pan. Turn each cake onto a cooling rack. Allow the cake to cool for 1-2 hours before frosting and serving, and make the frosting in the meantime.

Place the cream cheese in a large mixing bowl. Beat with a mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Add the Greek yogurt, powdered sugar, and 2 tsp. vanilla extract to the bowl. Continue beating on medium speed until the frosting is light and fluffy.
Pro tip: Adjust quantity of powdered sugar as needed to achieve desired consistency and sweetness of the frosting.
Cover the bowl of frosting with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to use.
Frost cakes as desired, and serve. Refrigerate leftovers in a container for up to 1 week.
Pro tip: Place a bit of parchment paper underneath the sides of the cake while frosting, then remove after frosting to keep the cake stand clean.

name: Perfect Crispy Baked Chicken Wings
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F.

Line a large baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a roasting rack on top. Cover the rack with another sheet of aluminum foil and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Use a knife to poke holes all over the foil.
Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels.
Place the olive oil, salt, paprika, garlic powder, and black pepper in a large mixing bowl. Add the chicken wings to the bowl. Using tongs, toss to coat the wings evenly in the seasonings.
Arrange chicken wings on the foil-covered roasting rack.
Bake the chicken wings for 45-50 minutes.
Remove chicken wings from the oven when browned and crispy.
Allow the chicken wings to cool on roasting rack for 3 minutes. Plate and serve immediately.

name: Slowly-braised Chicken In Tomato Sauce

ingredients.name: jar Old World Style® Pasta Sauce (1 lb. 8 oz.)
ingredients.fullName: 1 jar (1 lb. 8 oz.) Ragu® Old World Style® Pasta Sauce (1 lb. 8 oz.)

instructions: Heat olive oil in deep 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken in batches. Remove chicken to paper towel-lined plate. Cook onions in same skillet, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until onions are tender. Stir in Pasta Sauce and vinegar. Return chicken to skillet. Simmer covered over medium-low heat 35 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked.

Remove chicken to serving platter, then cover with aluminum foil. Simmer sauce, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened, about 3 minutes. Season, if desired, with salt, pepper and additional vinegar.

name: Chef JJ Johnson’s Pork Suya with Kimchi
instructions: To make the Pork Suya: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Mix paprika, garlics, onion, garlic powder, chiles, grape seed oil and lime zest in a blender for 3-5 minutes and then rub paste over the loin. Roast at 400 degrees F. for the first 15 minutes, and then reduce oven heat to 350 degrees F., roasting for an additional 1 hour 25 minutes (20 minutes per pound) or until the internal temperature of the pork on a thermometer reads 145 degrees F. (medium rare) to 160 degrees F. (medium), followed by a three minute rest.
To make the House-made Kimchi: In a large bowl, add daikon radish, hearts of palm, black-eyed peas, cilantro, sprouts, currants, plums, ginger, and cabbage together and stir.

To make the Kimchi Marinade: Separately in a small bowl, add salt, sugar, soy sauce, soy chili paste, vinegar, sake, and fish sauce for the marinade, stir until well combined. Pour over the shredded kimchi ingredients and marinade for 30 minutes to an hour.
Place sliced pork on plates. Using a slotted spoon, top each plate of pork with kimchi.

name: Bacalhau by Zé do Pipo from Chef Silva
instructions: Lightly poach cod in the milk.
Remove cod from milk. With tweezers, remove bones without disrupting the fillet.
Grease a baking sheet with mayonnaise and place the slices of cod on baking sheet.
Cook peeled and coarsely chopped potatoes in plenty of boiling, salted water.
Drain potatoes and mash until smooth. Mix mashed potatoes, butter and about ¾ cup warm milk.
Add milk gradually until desired consistency is reached. Season with pepper and freshly grounded nutmeg.
Place potato puree in a pastry bag and with wide beaded tip, pipe a decorative border around the baking sheet.
Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté garlic and onions and cook without browning.
Arrange garlic and onion in pan with cod and potatoes. Whisk together egg yolk.
Brush mayonnaise over the cod. Brush potatoes with egg yolk.
Bake in preheated oven at 160°C (approximately 320°F) for about 15 minutes.

name: Pumpkin Apple Muffins

ingredients.name: Spice Islands Pumpkin Pie Spice
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 teaspoons Spice Islands Pumpkin Pie Spice

ingredients.name: Spice Islands Pure Vanilla Extract
ingredients.fullName: 1 teaspoon Spice Islands Pure Vanilla Extract

ingredients.prep: OR golden raisins OR chopped dried apricots
ingredients.name: dried cranberries
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup dried cranberries (OR golden raisins OR chopped dried apricots)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375ºF.
Combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, sugar, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, salt and baking powder in medium bowl.
Whisk together pumpkin, apple, oil, egg and vanilla in a large bowl.
Add dry ingredients, mixing just until moistened.
Stir in cranberries and flax seed.
Portion into greased muffin cups or use paper liners.
Sprinkle with walnuts.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on wire rack 5 minutes.
Remove from pan to cool completely.

name: Roasted Garlic & Herb Smashed Potatoes

ingredients.name: yukon gold potatoes
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 pounds yukon gold potatoes (small skin-on, about 6-8 each)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Toss potatoes with oil and salt on rimmed baking sheet. Bake 30-40 minutes or until tender.
Heat cream to just below a simmer (or microwave until hot).

Combine cooked potatoes, butter and garlic in Bowl of KitchenAid® Artisan Mini Stand Mixer. Attach Bowl and Flat Paddle to mixer. Turn to Speed 1 and stir 30 seconds. With mixer running on Speed 1, slowly add hot cream and continue mixing up to 1 minute or to desired consistency (less for chunkier potatoes), adding chives during last 15 seconds of mixing.

name: Mediterranean Rice with Smoked Sausage

ingredients.name: uncooked long grain white rice
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 cups uncooked long grain white rice

instructions: Cut smoked sausage into ½” cubes; set aside. Combine rice, broth and water in medium saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover and cook 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes.

Heat a 4 -5 quart pan over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Add sausage and onion; cook, stirring occasionally 3-4 minutes or until onion is tender and sausage is lightly browned. Add mushrooms, garlic and oregano; cook 2 minutes, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium-low; stir in lemon juice.
Gently fold in cooked rice, spinach, feta cheese and pepper. Toss lightly for 1-2 minutes or until spinach is wilted.

name: Edamame Guacamole

ingredients.name: Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise

ingredients.prep: snack-size, each cut into 6 wedges and toasted
ingredients.name: wheat pita bread
ingredients.fullName: 4 whole wheat pita bread (snack-size, each cut into 6 wedges and toasted)

instructions: Process edamame, sour cream, Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise, cilantro, lime juice, hot pepper sauce and garlic in food processor until smooth. Stir in chopped tomato and onion.
Serve with pita wedges, cherry tomatoes and carrot.
Prepare edamame according to package directions, omitting salt. Drain, then chill.

name: Chicken Saute with Triple Berry Glaze

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour

ingredients.name: Smucker's® Orchard's Finest® Northwest Triple Berry Preserves
ingredients.fullName: 12 ounces Smucker's® Orchard's Finest® Northwest Triple Berry Preserves

ingredients.name: Italian parsley
ingredients.fullName: 2 teaspoons Italian parsley (fresh chopped, if desired)

instructions: COMBINE salt, pepper and flour in a shallow bowl. Coat chicken with seasoned flour. Shake off excess flour.

HEAT 2 tablespons oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté chicken in batches, using additional oil as needed, about 4-6 minutes per side or until golden brown and an instant read thermometer reads 170° F. Transfer chicken to platter, loosely covered with foil.

COMBINE preserves and horseradish in skillet, cooking over low heat until sauce begins to bubble. Return chicken to skillet, stirring to coat chicken evenly. Serve over rice pilaf and garnish with parsley, if desired.

name: Oatmeal Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit.

In a bowl, mix the sugar, flour, yeast, oat flakes, and cranberries. Make a well in the center of the mixture and add the egg. Mix the milk and the oil in gradually. Once the mixture is smooth, stop stirring. Pour the batter into a muffin pan or small paper baking cups (reinforced to prevent collapse under the weight of the dough). Bake for about 20 minutes.

name: Spicy Peanut Chicken

ingredients.prep: boneless and skinless, cut into 1” pieces
ingredients.name: ound Foster Farms chicken thighs
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound Foster Farms chicken thighs (boneless and skinless, cut into 1” pieces)

instructions: Spray large skillet with vegetable oil cooking spray and warm over medium-high heat. Brown chicken in skillet until golden brown, about 4 minutes. Add bell pepper, onion and garlic; sauté 1 - 2 minutes. Add mango salsa, peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger and cumin; stir together and cook over medium heat, covered, for about 4 minutes.
Serve over rice.

name: Sauteed Chicken In Vodka Sauce

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (about 1-1/4 lbs.)

ingredients.name: loosely packed fresh basil leaves (cut in strips
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon loosely packed fresh basil leaves (cut in strips (optional))

instructions: Season chicken, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper. Heat Olive Oil in 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken. Remove chicken and set aside.

Cook onion and garlic in same skillet, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes or until onion is tender. Stir in vodka and cook 1 minute. Stir in Sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, then return chicken to skillet. Simmer covered 3 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Remove chicken to serving platter and keep warm. Stir in cream and simmer 1 minute or until heated through. Serve, if desired, with hot cooked pasta and garnish with basil.

name: Pork Tenderloin Sofrito with an Almond-Plantain Barbecue Sauce and Grilled Yuca

ingredients.name: pork tenderloin
ingredients.fullName: 2 ounces pork tenderloin (each 4-oz, 2 1/2 inches in length)

ingredients.name: grape seed oil
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon grape seed oil (OR canola oil)

ingredients.name: red bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup red bell pepper (seeded and finely chopped)

ingredients.name: green bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup green bell pepper (seeded and finely chopped)

ingredients.name: locust bean gum (or agar,
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 teaspoon locust bean gum (or agar, optional)

ingredients.prep: charred over open flame and chopped
ingredients.name: vine ripened tomatoes
ingredients.fullName: 1 vine ripened tomatoes (charred over open flame and chopped)

ingredients.prep: OR other sweet onion, finely chopped
ingredients.name: vidalia onion
ingredients.fullName: 2/3 cup vidalia onion (OR other sweet onion, finely chopped)

ingredients.name: macadamia nut oil
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup macadamia nut oil (OR almond oil)

ingredients.prep: OR cubanelo pepper, seeded and finely chopped
ingredients.name: Anaheim chiles
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon Anaheim chiles (OR cubanelo pepper, seeded and finely chopped)

ingredients.name: green olive
ingredients.fullName: 1 green olive (small, pitted and finely chopped)

ingredients.name: grape seed oil
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup grape seed oil (OR canola oil)

ingredients.name: smoked sea salt
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 teaspoon smoked sea salt (OR plain sea salt)

instructions: Almond-Plantain BBQ Sauce: Heat 1 Tbs grapeseed oil in heavy medium saucepan. Add 1/3 cup yellow onion, 1/4 cup red and 1/4 cup green bell peppers, and 1 clove garlic. Cook over medium-low heat for 5-8 minutes or until very tender, stirring occasionally.

Stir in 1 Tbs almond flour. Cook and stir until mixture is slightly dry and has a nutty aroma. Add remaining ingredients (1 1/2 plantains, 1/2 cup condensed milk, 1/2 tsp hot chili paste, 1/4 tsp cumin, 1/4 tsp coriander, 1/4 tsp cayenne, 1/4 tsp chipotle chili powder, 1/4 tsp chili powder) and, if desired, 1/4 tsp locust bean gum. Bring mixture to boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, over medium-low heat about 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Cool slightly.

Transfer mixture to a food processor bowl. Cover and process until pureed. Strain mixture through a fine wire mesh sieve. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Before using, place sauce in small saucepan and warm over low heat.

To make Pork Marinade:
Char the skin of a tomato over an open flame or on the grill. Chop tomato and transfer to medium bowl. Stir in remaining ingredients (1/2 cup cilantro, 1/2 cup pork stock, 2/3 cup Vidalia onion, 1/4 cup macadamia oil, 1 Tbs Anaheim chile, 1 green olive, 1 clove garlic, 1/4 tsp sea salt, 1/8 tsp pepper).
Place pork pieces in resealable plastic bag. Pour vegetable marinade mixture over pork in bag; close bag. Turn bag to evenly coat pork with marinade mixture. Marinate in refrigerator for 20 minutes.

Preheat one burner of gas grill to medium-high; one-burner to medium-low. Remove pork from marinade. Discard marinade mixture in bag. Let pork stand at room temperature for 5 minutes. Place tenderloin pieces directly over the lit medium-high burner. Brush with prepared Almond-Plantain Barbecue Sauce.

Grill tenderloin pieces, uncovered, for 8-10 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 145 degrees F., turning tenderloin pieces over and brushing with additional sauce halfway during grilling. Transfer tenderloin pieces to a cutting board.
Loosely cover with foil; let rest for 5 minutes. Brush pork tenderloin pieces with additional sauce before serving and serve with grilled yuca (instructions follow).

Grilled Yuca:
While pork is marinating, prepare the yuca. Cut yuca and/or carrot(s) into 3-inch-long pieces. Then cut pieces into 1/4-inch-thick x 1/4-inch-wide sticks.

Combine 1 ci[ grape seed oil, 8 cloves garlic, 2 Tbs cilantro, 2 Tbs mint, 1/4 tsp smoked salt and, if desired, 1/8 tsp pepper in medium bowl. Add yuca and/or carrot(s). Toss until evenly coated. Marinate at room temperature for 3-5 minutes.

Remove yuca and/or carrot(s) from marinade; discard marinade in bowl. Place yuca and/or carrot(s) on grill screen directly over the lit medium-low burner on gas grill. Grill uncovered, for 4-6 minutes or until tender, turning often. Serve with grilled pork.

name: Caramelized Quince Cake with Vanilla Frosting and Caramel
instructions: Peel the quinces and cut them into wedges, put them in a saucepan with the sugar and water, let them simmer for 20 minutes to a half an hour, they must be soft, but whole. Remove the quinces, set the caramel aside, and in the same saucepan add the liquid cream and butter. Let it boil and set aside.

Preheat the oven to 240 degrees. Beat the eggs well and add the yogurt. Then add the oil, flour, sugar and yeast. Mix well so that everything is well integrated. Add the pieces of quince and mix carefully. Pour the batter into the cake mold. Bake for 20-30 minutes. Let cool on a wire rack.

To make the frosting, beat the butter to pieces with the powdered sugar. The butter should be cold, if it is at room temperature it will not form the frosting. When it is well mixed add the cream cheese, also cold and the essence of vanilla. Mix until incorporated.
At the time of serving, cover the cake with the frosting and cover with the caramel (which has to be at room temperature).

name: Chocolate and Orange brioche crown
instructions: Place the flour, salt, cocoa, sugar and orange zest in a bowl. Open a hole in the center and put the warm milk (which dissolves the yeast), the egg and beaten egg yolks, the softened butter pieces, and rum. Start involving all the ingredients with a wooden spoon, or put the kneading hook in the mixer and knead for about 10 minutes. If knead by hand, do it for a little longer. You may need to add a little more flour.
Place the dough in a warm place and let rise for 2 hours or until doubled in volume.
Remove the dough from the bowl, put on a floured surface and knead again to release the air.
You may need to add a little more flour at this stage, to help extend.

Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, with the help of a rolling pin, until 0.5 cm. Barring the surface with nutella in a thin layer. Roll the dough into a roll, and cut into 10 equal pieces. Turn the pieces with the cut surface up and place them in an annulus form in a tray with non-stick baking paper.
Put it in a preheated oven at 350F until cooked and golden brown.

name: Beer Can Chicken

ingredients.prep: kosher or free range is best
ingredients.name: chicken
ingredients.fullName: 4 pounds chicken (kosher or free range is best)

instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees
REMOVE any insides from the chicken
RINSE the chicken with cold water pat dry.
RUB the chicken, inside and out with spices.
Open the beer and drink half of it the punch extra holes on the can.
Add 2 tbsp of spices inside the beer can.

PLACE beer can on oven proof pan or dish this allows the chicken to cook indirectly and cathes the juices if you want to make a gravy. ARRANGE chicken on beer can, allow the two legs to form two sides of tripod so the chicken is stable.
REDUCE oven to 350 degrees after first 30 mins. Best when chicken cooks for about 11/2 - 2 hours
When chicken is ready carefully remove to a separate platter. Allow to stand for 10  mins.

name: Happy Housewife’s Pea Soup

ingredients.name: edium potatoes
ingredients.fullName: 2 medium potatoes (peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes)

instructions: Sort and thoroughly rinse split peas in colander under cold running water. Place peas in stock pot or 4-or 6-quart Dutch oven. Add ham bone and 6 cups of water. Bring to boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Sauté celery, onions, garlic. Cook over medium heat for 5-8 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Add celery mixture to pea mixture in soup pot. Stir in 3 cups chicken broth, carrots, potatoes, salt and bay leaf. Bring to boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until peas are very soft and break apart when mixture is briskly stirred. Stir in ham the last 5 minutes of cooking.

Remove ham bone from soup and remove any meat from bone and return the meat to the soup mixture. Discard bone. Remove and discard bay leaf. Briskly stir soup mixture with wooden spoon to break up peas. If necessary, stir in enough of the remaining 1 cup chicken broth to make soup of desired consistency. Season to taste with pepper.
To serve, ladle soup into bowls. Top each with a few croutons and sprinkle with parsley.
For thinner soup an additional 1 cup of chicken broth 10 minutes before serving.

name: Irresistible Mini Moelleux with Nutella and Hazelnuts
instructions: Preheat oven to 210 degrees Celsius.
Melt the butter and chocolate together in a water bath, then add the Nutella, and mix.
In a bowl, whisk the eggs with the yolks, add the flour, and whisk the mixture. Add the sugar, and mix.
Pour in the chocolate mixture, and stir until homogeneous.
Fill the molds, and put a hazelnut on top of each one.
Bake for about 7 minutes until moelleux are very soft.
Let cool slightly before serving.

name: Mini Chocolate Custard with Cocoa Bean Crumble
instructions: Place the heavy cream and the milk in a medium saucepan, heat to a boil, add the chopped chocolate, remove the saucepan from the heat and stir.

Allow the cream to cool and distribute it in the individual serving bowls and refrigerate the cream to thicken it. At this point, you may serve the custard on its own, sprinkled with some bittersweet cocoa.
Preheat the oven to 160C.
Butter 6—1/2 cup molds and coat with some powdered sugar.
Beat the eggs with the remaining powdered sugar for 5 minutes until foamy, slowly incorporate this mixture to the chocolate and stir.
Place the cream into the molds and bake in a double boiler for 45 minutes.
Remove the molds from the double boiler and allow the custard to cool.
In the meantime, crush the cocoa beans with a meat pounder.
Use the tips of your fingers to combine the flour with the brown sugar and the butter into an oatmeal consistency.
Add a pinch of fleur de sel and the crushed cocoa beans.
Sprinkle the crumble onto a wax paper-lined baking sheet.
Bake the crumble at 180 C for 15 minutes and let it cool.

Turn the custard out onto a serving dish and top with the crumble. You can also put the crumble directly onto the custard in the serving bowl, use a dessert torch to create a crust effect, and serve it with a sprinkling of cocoa.

name: Stuffed Tomatoes

ingredients.prep: ground, plus another handful for garnish
ingredients.name: handful walnuts
ingredients.fullName: 1 handful walnuts (ground, plus another handful for garnish)

instructions: Mix the mascarpone cheese, onion, lemon juice, lemon zest, and ground walnuts in a small bowl.
Cut a thin slice off the bottom of each tomato, and a slice from the top.
Remove the filling of each tomato using a spoon.
Stuff the tomatoes with the mascarpone cheese mixture, garnish with a walnut, put the top back in place, and serve.

name: Leftover Turkey Chowder

ingredients.prep: medium, cut in 1/2-inch cubes, about 2 cups
ingredients.name: red potatoes
ingredients.fullName: 4 red potatoes (medium, cut in 1/2-inch cubes, about 2 cups)

instructions: Cook bacon in large saucepan on medium heat until crisp. Add onion; cook and stir 3 minutes. Add water and potatoes. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Stir Gravy Mix and flour in medium bowl. Stir in half-and-half with wire whisk until smooth. Stir mixture into saucepan. Add turkey, corn and sage. Bring to boil on medium heat. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

name: Tostones

ingredients.name: salt (OR powdered Adobo seasoning,
ingredients.fullName: 2 teaspoons salt (OR powdered Adobo seasoning, optional)

ingredients.name: stick canola
ingredients.fullName: 1 stick canola (or Butter Flavored Cooking Spray)

instructions: Peel plantains and cut crosswise into 3/4-inch slices.  Place in bowl of salted water.  Heat oil in a large deep-sided skillet or frying pan to 325°F.  Drain plantain slices and pat dry.  Fry the slices for about 2 minutes per side or until golden.

Remove from oil and drain on paper towels until cool enough to handle.  Flatten each piece between sheets of waxed paper or foil using a tostonera press or the back of a spatula to about 1/4-inch thickness.  (First spray waxed paper or foil with cooking spray to prevent sticking.)

Refry the flattened Tostones for about 4 minutes per side or until browned and crispy.  Remove from oil and drain on paper towels.  Sprinkle with salt or Adobo seasoning, if desired.  Serve immediately.

name: Mini Calamari Turnovers a la Setoise
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F.
Roll out the puff pastry. Cut out medium circles.
Place one calamari from the can on the dough citcle.
Fold the turnover. Press the edges of the dough tightly so they are well sealed and there are no leaks.
Place the turnovers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 15 minutes until golden.

name: Warm Tomato and Beet Salad with Burrata

ingredients.name: burrata cheese
ingredients.fullName: 8 ounces burrata cheese (room temperature and sliced)

instructions: Pour vinegar and oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat and bring to a simmer. Add tomatoes, beets, salt and pepper to taste; cook until just heated through, about 1-2 minutes. Arrange and stack tomatoes, beets, burrata, and microgreens vertically on a plate. Finish with an olive oil drizzle and pomegranate arils. Serve on a bed of watercress and halved mini tomatoes.

name: Cocktail Sandwiches
instructions: Spread mustard on one side of half the bread. Spread horseradish on one side of the remaining slices. Cut ham into 8 pieces and each slice of cheese into fourths. Place one slice Swiss cheese on 8 slices of bread with mustard. Top with bread spread with horseradish, then ham slice. Top with bread spread with mustard, then American cheese. Place remaining bread atop cheese.
Divide olives and tomatoes among cocktail picks and skewer sandwiches.

name: Thai Peanut Chicken & Noodles

ingredients.name: boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast halves

ingredients.name: skippy super chunk peanut butter
ingredients.fullName: 1/3 cup skippy super chunk peanut butter

instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken, stirring occasionally, until chicken is thoroughly cooked, about 7 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil over medium-high heat and cook garlic and green pepper, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes. Stir in broth, Skippy® Super Chunk® Peanut Butter, soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, vinegar, ginger and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring frequently, until sauce is thickened and smooth, about 2 minutes. Return chicken to skillet. Stir in green onion and simmer until heated through, about 3 minutes. Serve over hot noodles. Garnish, if desired, with chopped peanuts and chopped fresh cilantro.

name: Baked Scallops
instructions: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
In a tray put the sliced tomatoes drizzled with a little olive oil, salt and oregano.
Bake for 10 minutes, then place the bacon in it and let it bake for more 5 to 8 minutes or until the bacon is crispy.

In a chopper, place the bread, I used a multi-grain one, that I baked a few days before, but it was great and didn't look like it, also put the parsley and 1 garlic clove, chop it all finely and in a skillet, sauté to taste, I love it well toasted and with a little olive oil on top, but it goes on your taste.
Meanwhile, season the defrosted and dried out scallops with a pinch of salt, pepper and grill them if you notice they are too dry and sticky, brush them with a bit of butter.
Serve with puree as a base then put the roasted tomatoes, scallops, sprinkle with bread and bacon in coarse pieces.

name: Mayonnaise Biscuits
instructions: Cut the cold butter into small pieces, and beat it with the sugar for 5 minutes, until obtaining a soft and light cream.
Add the mayonnaise, and stir with a spatula until obtaining a homogeneous mixture.
Gradually, add the flour until the dough is malleable and consistent (you may use more or less flour).
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius.
Resume kneading with your hands, and shape small balls or circles.
Coat the balls with the granulated sugar, and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until golden.

name: Teriyaki Chicken

ingredients.name: grams chicken breast
ingredients.fullName: 500 grams chicken breast (cut into bite size pieces)

instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in sake about 30 minutes.
2. Mix teriyaki sauce.
3. Use bamboo skewers to thread alternately chicken and vegetables.
4. Heat oil, fry skewers about 3 minutes then turn, fry 3 minutes on the other side.
5. Add teriyaki sauce and fry couple of minutes more to reduce the sauce and cover thoroughly chicken and vegetables.
6. Serve with rice and vegetable side dish.

name: Kale Walnut Pesto

ingredients.prep: packed, about 1 small bunch, ribs discarded, chopped
ingredients.name: kale leaves
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups kale leaves (packed, about 1 small bunch, ribs discarded, chopped)

instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in small skillet over medium-low heat. Add garlic and sweat until tender, about 1 minute. Set aside to cool slightly.
To toast walnuts, spread in single layer in heavy skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until lightly toasted, 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.

Combine garlic, toasted walnuts, kale, Parmesan, lemon peel and lemon juice in the blender jar. Secure lid and pulse 2-3 times on high, using the tamper to push down ingredients as needed, until mixture is finely chopped. Add remaining 1⁄2 cup oil, increase speed to medium (Speed 5 or 6) and blend until oil is incorporated, about 30 seconds. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Use immediately, or store in airtight container in refrigerator for up to 2 days or in freezer for up to 3 months (the pesto will darken over time).
TIP: Toss it with your favorite hot pasta, and use a little of the pasta cooking water to thin the sauce to the ideal consistency, or toss it with zucchini “pasta” strands.

name: Risotto with Baby Shrimp
instructions: Bring the broth to a boil.
In another pan, saute the onion and garlic in the olive oil for 3-5 minutes.
When the onion is translucent, add the rice and stir slowly with a wooden spoon.
As soon as the rice begins to turn translucent, add the wine and keep stirring.
Once the wine has been completely absorbed by the rice, add the first ladle of hot broth and season with salt and pepper.
Keep heat to a simmer so the rice does not cook too quickly.
Continue adding ladles of broth, waiting for each ladle to be absorbed before adding the next.
Before the rice is completely cooked, add the green beans. Add the shrimp a couple minutes later. Cook for a few minutes.
Remove from the pan and add the butter and mix gently.
Cover the pan and let rest for 2-3 minutes.
Stir in the basil, mint leaves and lemon juice.

name: Orange Meringue Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Grind the biscuits to crumbs in the blender.
Add the oats and butter in small cubes.
Mix with fingertips until obtaining a thick sandy dough.
Place the dough in a spring-form cake pan.
Spread and press down in order to get a consistent basis, but thin, and covering the entire base and a bit of the sides.
Then, beat the egg yolks with the condensed milk, and add the orange juice and zest.
Pour this mixture into the base of the pie and bake about 15 minutes.
When the time is almost over, whisk the egg whites until firm, sprinkling with a little fine salt.
When they begin to get foamy, start adding the sugar, little by little until they get very white and very firm.
Remove the pie from the oven (keep it on, but lower the temperature a bit) and cover the filling with the egg whites in spoonfuls.
Put back in the oven, and bake until the egg whites are golden, about 10 minutes.
When golden, remove from oven, and wait for it to cool a bit.
Unmold.

name: Stewed Ricotta Cheese Dumplings

ingredients.prep: this depends on the consistency of the ricotta cheese
ingredients.name: grams breadcrumbs
ingredients.fullName: 150 grams breadcrumbs (this depends on the consistency of the ricotta cheese)

instructions: Combine the ricotta cheese with the breadcrumbs and the egg, add the parmesan cheese, a pinch of salt, the nutmeg, and a generous amount of chopped basil.
Combine until the mixture is creamy but thick.
Saute the chopped onion, celery and carrot in a large pan.
Add the tomato puree.
With wet hands, shape the ricotta mixture into balls approximately 3 centimeters in diameter and place them into the pan where the sauce is cooking.
Cover with a lid and cook on medium low heat for 30 to 35 minutes, gently shake the pan occasionally and, if necessary, add a little water to the sauce.

name: Barbecue Beef and Cheese Casserole
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Grease baking dish.
Melt butter in saute pan. Add onions and cook 2-3 minutes, then add garlic and ground beef and cook until browned, breaking up with wooden spoon, 5-6 minutes.
Remove beef from heat and add barbecue sauce and cheese. Stir to combine.
Line bottom of prepared baking dish with biscuits and top with beef mixture and remaining cheese
Transfer pan to middle rack of oven and bake until beef reaches temperature of 160°F, biscuits are cooked and cheese is bubbling, 15-20 minutes.
Check to see that casserole is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Serve casserole immediately.

name: Balsamic Grilled Fig & Goat Cheese Salad

ingredients.prep: sliced, frisee and/or mixed greens, about 2-1/2 cups
ingredients.name: radicchio
ingredients.fullName: 2 ounces radicchio (sliced, frisee and/or mixed greens, about 2-1/2 cups)

instructions: Toss figs with 1 tablespoon Wish-Bone® Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing in medium bowl; set aside. Brush onion with 2 tablespoons Dressing. Grill or broil figs and onion on grill rack, turning once, until figs are caramelized and onion is tender, about 4 minutes; keep warm.
Brush 1 side of bread slices with 1 tablespoon Dressing. Grill or broil, turning once, until toasted 4 minutes.

Arrange spinach and radicchio on serving platter. Top with onion, figs, goat cheese, pecans and prosciutto. Just before serving, drizzle with remaining 1/4 cup Dressing. Arrange toasted bread slices around platter.

ingredients.name: freshly ground black pepper
ingredients.fullName: freshly ground black pepper (for seasoning throughout recipe)

ingredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
ingredients.fullName: extra virgin olive oil (if needed for marinade)

ingredients.name: blanched fresh corn
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups blanched fresh corn (removed from about 4 ears)

ingredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil (for vinaigrette)

ingredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil (for beans)

ingredients.prep: or 1/2 of a large onion, yellow or white, for beans
ingredients.name: small onion
ingredients.fullName: 1 small onion (or 1/2 of a large onion, yellow or white, for beans)

ingredients.prep: drained and rinsed, 28 oz. per can
ingredients.name: black beans
ingredients.fullName: 1 can black beans (drained and rinsed, 28 oz. per can)

name: Mustard-Grilled Pork Chops with Two-Tomato Salsa

ingredients.name: New York pork chops
ingredients.fullName: 4 New York pork chops (, top loin, 3/4-inch thick)

ingredients.prep: halves packed in oil, drained and chopped
ingredients.name: sun-dried tomatoes
ingredients.fullName: 8 sun-dried tomatoes (halves packed in oil, drained and chopped)

instructions: In a medium bowl stir together plum tomatoes, sun-dried tomatoes, chopped basil and cayenne; set aside salsa. In a small bowl combine mustard, honey and garlic. Rub mustard mixture over all surfaces of chops. Place chops on a kettle-style grill over medium-hot fire and grill for 4 minutes. Turn chops and grill for 4 minutes more or until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees Fahrenheit, followed by a 3-minute rest time. Serve with tomato salsa.
If desired, garnish with basil sprigs.

name: Cake Pops
instructions: Preheat the oven to 190 degrees Celsius.
Mix the egg yolks, sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Add the white flour, yeast, and egg whites, and beat until everything is completely mixed.
Pour the dough into a cake mold and bake for 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove the cake from the oven, let it cool off, unmold, and crumble it completely.
Mix the cake crumbles with the Philadelphia cheese in a large bowl.
Form balls using your hands and place them on a tray. Let them sit in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Remove them from the freezer, stick a wooden popsicle stick in each ball, and let them sit in the freezer for 10 minutes.
Remove them from the freezer, dip them in melted chocolate, add chocolate sprinkles, and serve.

name: One-Bowl Banana Pudding with Coconut Whipped Cream

ingredients.prep: or other small, crisp vanilla cookies, for filling; 7 oz. is 50 cookies
ingredients.name: Nilla Vanilla Wafers
ingredients.fullName: 7 ounces Nilla Vanilla Wafers (or other small, crisp vanilla cookies, for filling; 7 oz. is 50 cookies)

ingredients.prep: or other small, crisp vanilla cookies, for topping
ingredients.name: Nilla Vanilla Wafers
ingredients.fullName: 4 Nilla Vanilla Wafers (or other small, crisp vanilla cookies, for topping)

instructions: Whisk together granulated sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium saucepan. Add milk and cream, then egg and egg yolk, and whisk again until eggs are well blended. Set pan over medium-high heat, whisking constantly. (Pro Tip: For a somewhat less indulgent dessert, you can substitute whole milk for the heavy cream.)
Once bubbles begin popping on surface and pudding thickens slightly, about 7 minutes, decrease heat to medium and whisk continuously for 45 seconds for cornstarch to fully cook. Remove pan from heat.
Add vanilla and butter and whisk until butter melts.
Chop 2 of the bananas into small cubes and the remaining bananas into 1/2-inch coins.
Fold cubed bananas into pudding.

Transfer half of the pudding to an 8-inch square pan, spreading evenly. Top with a layer of cookies, breaking them to fill any gaps. Top cookies with half of the banana coins, distributing them evenly. Repeat with remaining pudding, cookies, and banana coins. (Pro Tip: Be sure to scrape the saucepan well (and wipe it with a paper towel if necessary), as you'll be using it as a vessel for whipping your cream.)
Set dish on 2 hot pads in the refrigerator and chill until somewhat cool, 15-30 minutes.

Put cream, confectioners sugar, and coconut extract in cooled medium saucepan. Whip with a mixer on medium-high speed until medium peaks form when beaters are lifted. Fold in shredded coconut, if using. Spread whipped cream evenly over pudding.

Crush cookies with your hands and sprinkle decoratively around the edge of the pudding. Slice banana into coins, if using. Scoop generous portions of pudding onto serving plates and add a few banana coins. Pudding is best eaten within a day of being made, but will keep 2 days in refrigerator tightly wrapped in plastic wrap.

name: Rigatoni à la You!

ingredients.prep: Johnsonville® Italian Mild, grilled and coin-sliced
ingredients.name: sausage links
ingredients.fullName: 19 ounces sausage links (Johnsonville® Italian Mild, grilled and coin-sliced)

instructions: Cook sausage according to package directions, keep warm.
Cook the rigatoni according to directions, keep warm.
In a large pan, place olive oil and garlic, sauté lightly for 30 seconds.
Add peppers and cook until crisp tender.
Combine cooked sausage and pasta sauce with peppers and heat until warm.
At this point you may mix with the pasta or serve separately. Top with fresh parsley. Serve warm.

name: Spicy-Sweet Pork Stir Fry

ingredients.name: ounds boneless pork sirloin roast
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 pounds boneless pork sirloin roast (cut into 1/2-inch cubes)

ingredients.name: bacon drippings
ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons bacon drippings (or vegetable oil, divided)

ingredients.name: garlic
ingredients.fullName: 1 teaspoon garlic (minced, about 1 small garlic clove)

ingredients.prep: fresh, or kale, rinsed and drained, cut into 1/2-inch strips
ingredients.name: ups turnip greens
ingredients.fullName: 2 1/2 cups turnip greens (fresh, or kale, rinsed and drained, cut into 1/2-inch strips)

ingredients.prep: medium, cut into wedges, about 1 cup sliced wedges
ingredients.name: red onion
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 red onion (medium, cut into wedges, about 1 cup sliced wedges)

instructions: In large bowl, sprinkle pork sirloin cubes with salt, pepper; mix lightly.

Heat 1 tablespoon of drippings or oil in 10 to 12-inch skillet, until hot. Add corn and garlic; cook over medium-high heat stirring occasionally, 5 to 7 minutes or until kernels begin to brown. Remove corn from skillet and set aside.Reduce heat.

Add remaining tablespoon of drippings or oil to skillet. Add pork cubes, cook and stir over medium-high heat, 3 to 5 minutes until cubes are lightly browned.Add prepared corn, carrots, greens and onions to skillet, cook and stir 5 to 7 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Reduce heat to low.Stir in combined sweet chili sauce and vinegar, heat 2 to 3 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
Serve with brown rice or white rice.

name: Whole Wheat Crostini with Whipped Gorgonzola

ingredients.name: wheat baguette
ingredients.fullName: 1 whole wheat baguette (cut diagonally in ½” slices)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Arrange baguette slices on large baking sheet. Lightly brush both sides with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Toast in oven for 6-­‐7 minutes, turn toasts over and bake for another 6-­‐7 minutes or until lightly browned.  Remove from oven and allow to cool. Can be made a day ahead and stored in airtight container.

Turn oven up to 400 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment or spray with non-­‐stick cooking spray. Trim ends off beets and carrots. Use medium spiralizing blade and peeling blade to make peeled beet spirals and use the medium spiralizing blade to make carrot spirals. Place the carrots in a medium bowl and toss them with half the olive oil, salt, pepper and rosemary. Arrange the carrots on one side of the prepared baking sheet. Place the beets in the bowl and repeat the process of dressing them and arranging on the other side of the baking sheet. (The carrots and beets are kept separate so the beets don’t bleed on the carrots.) Roast for 12-­‐15 minutes or until tender and beginning to brown. Can be made a day ahead, then cooled and refrigerated.

While the vegetables are roasting, make the whipped Gorgonzola. Combine all the ingredients in stand mixer bowl and use flat beater to mix on low until combined and then high for a minute to whip. Can be made a day ahead and stored in refrigerator.
Assemble crostini by spreading toasts with 2 teaspoons whipped Gorgonzola, top with roasted beets and carrots. Then sprinkle with walnuts, chives and a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Cheddar Jalapeno Sausage from Scratch

ingredients.prep: reduce this to 1 1/2 tsp if using salt pork
ingredients.name: kosher salt
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon kosher salt (reduce this to 1 1/2 tsp if using salt pork)

ingredients.name: red pepper flakes
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes (optional, for additional heat)

instructions: Cube the pork and pork fat into 1 inch cubes and spread out on a parchment-lined baking sheet.  Freeze 1 hour.
Fill a large bowl with 2 quarts cold tap water and add white vinegar.  Add casings and let soak at least 30 minutes.

Grind meat and fat together through the coarse disk of your KitchenAid® food grinder attachment.  In a large bowl, combine meat, cheese, jalapenos, garlic, salt, pepper and red pepper flakes.  Mix well.
Attach KitchenAid® sausage stuffer to food grinder, load with pre-soaked casings and stuff sausages.  Twist sausages into links of desired length.
Refrigerate links for a few hours to allow flavors to meld.  Freeze any sausages that you don’t plan to cook within 2 days.
To cook, add a little oil to a large skillet over medium heat.  Cook until browned all over and internal temperature  reaches 160F.

name: Barbecue Pulled Pork Slides

ingredients.name: kosher salt
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon kosher salt (plus more as needed)

instructions: Pickled red onions are a staple at meals throughout the Yucatan peninsula and are one of my all-time favorite condiments. They make a colorful and flavorful topping for these sliders. They’re also pretty easy to make. Put the onions in a glass bowl and pour enough boiling water to cover the onions, wait one minute, and then pour the onions into a strainer. Return the drained onions to the bowl, add the lime and orange juice, and stir in the salt. Cover and set aside until serving time. If you’re not ready to serve the onions right away, they’ll last for a week in the refrigerator.

Now onto the pork. The sweet and smoky barbecue pork combined with the tangy, crunchy, and piquant flavor of the pickled red onions in a crusty, chewy, ciabatta roll is an explosion of flavors in every bite.
Start by placing the onions and garlic in an even layer in the slow cooker, then pour in the chicken broth.
Combine the sugar, chili powder, salt, cumin, and cinnamon in a small bowl.

Pat the pork dry with paper towels and then rub yellow mustard and the spice mixture all over the pork. Once it’s coated, place the pork on top of the onions and garlic in the KitchenAid® Slow Cooker. Cover and cook until the pork is fork tender, about 6 to 8 hours on medium-high.
Turn off the slow cooker and transfer the pork to a cutting board. Strain the remaining mixture into a heatproof bowl. Set the strained liquid aside and return the solids to the slow cooker.
Take the pork, and using two forks, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces, discarding any large pieces of fat. Return the shredded meat to the slow cooker, add the barbecue sauce and mix to combine.
Place the pulled pork on the bottom halves of the ciabatta rolls and top the pork with pickled red onions. Cover with the top halves of the rolls and serve.

Scoop the onions into a glass bowl. Pour enough boiling water to cover the onions, wait one minute, and then pour the onions into a strainer. Return the drained onions to the bowl, add the lime and orange juice, and stir in the salt. Cover and set aside until serving time.
The onions will last for a week or more in the refrigerator.
For pulled pork sliders
Place the onions and garlic in an even layer in a KitchenAid® 6-Quart Slow Cooker and pour in the chicken broth.
Combine the sugar, chili powder, salt, cumin, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Pat the pork dry with paper towels.
Rub the yellow mustard and spice mixture all over the pork and place the meat on top of the onions and garlic. Cover and cook until the pork is fork tender, about 6 to 8 hours on medium-high.
Turn off the slow cooker and transfer the pork to a cutting board.
Set a fine-mesh strainer over a medium heatproof bowl. Pour the onion mixture from the slow cooker through the strainer and return the solids to the slow cooker. Set the strained liquid aside.

Remove and discard the bones. Using 2 forks, shred the meat into bite-sized pieces, discarding any large pieces of fat. Return the shredded meat to the slow cooker, add the barbecue sauce and mix to combine.
Taste and season with salt if needed.
Place pulled pork on bottom halves of ciabatta rolls. Top the pork with pickled red onions. Cover with the top halves of the rolls and serve.

name: Lamb Trotters with Tomato and Thyme
instructions: Wash the lamb trotters under running water.

Place the trotters in plenty of water along with 2 unpeeled cloves of garlic, chive, 1 onion (sliced in half), bay leaves, carrots, peppercorns and wine. Cook in the pressure cooker for 25 minutes. The trotters should be tender, with the meat separating easily from the bone. Remove the trotters and set aside.
Dice the remaining onion and garlic and add to a skillet with a tablespoon of oil. Saute for 5 minutes. Add the peppers and stir well.
Add the tomato puree and bring to a simmer. Add a pinch of salt and sugar and stir.
Add the sauce to a blender and puree until smooth. Add some of the broth from the pressure cooker if the sauce is too thick.
In a saucepan, mix the trotters and tomato sauce with a sprig of thyme. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve.

name: Pasta with Ground Beef
instructions: Place a large skillet on the stove on medium-low heat. Add the oil and then add the onion, carrot, and bell pepper. Cook everything while continuously stirring for 5 minutes.
Add the pasta to salted boiling water and cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain the pasta, reserving a 1/2 cup of cooking liquid.
Add the ground beef to the skillet and saute until the ground beef browns, about 8 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce. If the sauce appears to be too thick, add the pasta water.
Cover the pot with a lid and let it cook for 15 minutes.
Uncover the pot and add the pasta. Mix everything well and cook for 2 minutes.
Serve on a plate with shredded cheese on top.

name: Pumpkin Bread Pudding

ingredients.name: loaf day-old challah
ingredients.fullName: 1 loaf day-old challah (or Italian bread, 16-18 oz.)

instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Spray casserole dish liberally with nonstick cooking spray.
Cut bread into 1-inch cubes and set aside.

Whisk together eggs, half-and-half, pumpkin, brown sugar, granulated sugar, butter, vanilla extract, pumpkin pie spice, and salt until combined. Place bread cubes and raisins (if using) into bowl. Fold with a rubber spatula until all bread is thoroughly coated in milk mixture.
Transfer soaked bread cubes to prepared casserole dish. Cover dish with aluminum foil.
Bake bread pudding, covered, on middle rack of oven for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and continue baking, until golden brown on top and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 15-20 minutes.
Check to see that bread pudding is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.

If serving warm, allow bread pudding to cool for at least 15 minutes before plating. To serve cold, chill  bread pudding in refrigerator for at least two hours. Dust with powdered sugar immediately before serving, if desired.

name: Berlin Cakes in the Oven

ingredients.prep: or Bage Cremin, for the filling
ingredients.name: pastry cream
ingredients.fullName: pastry cream (or Bage Cremin, for the filling)

instructions: Preheat oven to 190 degrees Celsius.
Dissolve the yeast in 2 deciliters of warm milk, and add 100 grams of flour.
Knead well, and add them to the egg and egg yolks, mixing well.
Let rise in a warm place for 30 minutes or until bubbles form on the surface.
Mix the remaining heated milk with the butter.
Add the powdered sugar, the remaining heated milk with the butter, lemon zest, vanilla extract, and remaining flour.
Knead well, and let rise (covered) until it doubles in volume.
Take small portions of dough, and make small balls.
Put them on a baking tray to rise a little bit more, covered with a cloth.
Bake them in preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until golden.
Remove from the oven, and once cool, cut them open, and fill with the cream.
Sprinkle with powdered sugar to taste.

name: Coconut Crumble Mousse
instructions: Grind the coconut cookies in a food processor or blender, and set them aside.
In a saucepan, heat 300 ml. of milk for approximately 3 minutes over medium heat.
Melt the cheese curds and the remaining 100 ml. of milk in a separate saucepan, stirring frequently with a whisk. Set it aside.
Add crushed cookies to the 300 ml. of milk and whisk well over medium heat.
Add the milk with the melted cheese curd and the condensed milk, and cook for just under 10 minutes over low to medium heat, stirring constantly with a whisk.
Place the mousse in separate bowls, and let cool in the refrigerator until serving time, garnished with the shredded coconut.

name: Cashew Granola
instructions: HEAT oven to 300ºF. Coat 15 x 10-inch baking pan with no-stick cooking spray.
MICROWAVE cashew butter, honey and cinnamon in large microwave-safe bowl on HIGH for 30 seconds. Stir in vanilla. Add oats, raisins and cashews. Stir to coat. Spread on prepared baking pan.
BAKE 35 to 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. TURN OFF OVEN. Let dry 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove from oven to cool completely. Store in airtight container for up to 1 week.

name: Spicy Beef & Chorizo Grilled Pizza

ingredients.name: Mexican-style pork chorizo
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 pound Mexican-style pork chorizo (removed from casing)

ingredients.prep: ® Homestyle Thick & Hearty Roasted Red Peppers & Garlic Sauce
ingredients.name: ragu
ingredients.fullName: 23 ounces ragu (® Homestyle Thick & Hearty Roasted Red Peppers & Garlic Sauce)

ingredients.name: chipotle peppers in adobo
ingredients.fullName: 1 teaspoon chipotle peppers in adobo (finely chopped)

ingredients.name: thin pizza crusts
ingredients.fullName: 4 thin pizza crusts (small pre-baked, 7 ounces each)

instructions: unchecked 1. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
unchecked 2. Cook chorizo in medium non-stick skillet on medium-high heat 5-7 min. or until crisp, breaking up any large pieces; drain. Stir in sauce and chipotle peppers.
unchecked 3. Combine oil and garlic in small bowl; brush onto both sides of pizza crusts. Working with 2 crusts at a time, grill top-side down, 1-2 min. or until lightly browned.

unchecked 4. Reduce heat to medium; carefully flip crusts over with tongs. Top each with ¼ of the sauce mixture and Chihuahua cheese. Grill 2-3 min. or just until cheese is melted. Carefully slide finished pizzas onto large cutting board or platter. Repeat with remaining crusts and toppings.
unchecked 5. To serve, top evenly with queso fresco, avocados, cilantro and crema.

name: Healthy Carob and Zucchini Brownies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350ºF. Grease a small baking pannand line with parchment paper.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with sugar. Add the apple sauce and melted chocolate and stir well.
Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon and mix to combine.
Finally, stir in the grated zucchini.
Pour batter into the pan and bake until cooked, but still moist.

name: Crab Pate
instructions: If using live crab, boil it, let it cool, and remove the meat. If it is female, it will have dark and white meat. If it is male, it will only have dark meat.
In a mortar and pestle, crush the cayenne pepper then mix in the softened butter, lemon juice, and dark crab meat. Continue stirring and mashing until a paste has formed.
Stir in the nutmeg and white crab meat. Mix well and salt to taste. It should have a strong taste because once preserved, the flavors will diminish some.
Transfer the pate into a container and cover with the melted butter and dill.
Refrigerate overnight and serve on toast.

name: Tamarind Ancho Pork Stew

ingredients.name: pork shoulder
ingredients.fullName: 3 pounds pork shoulder (cut into stew cubes)

instructions: Pour boiling water over ancho chili pepper; let stand covered 10 minutes. Process pepper with water in blender or mini food processor; set aside.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in deep 12-inch skillet and cook 1/2 of the pork over medium high heat, stirring occasionally, until browned about 4 minutes. Remove pork from skillet and repeat with remaining oil and pork; set aside.

Stir onion into same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in cumin and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, 1 minute.
