ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread

instructions: Season chicken, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper. Evenly top each chicken breast half with prosciutto, provolone, sage and garlic powder; roll up and secure with wooden toothpicks. Melt Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken. Stir in Sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered 12 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Remove toothpicks. Serve, if desired, with hot cooked pasta.

name: Mushrooms Stuffed with Corn Bread and Coriander
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a baking sheet with a little olive oil.
Rinse mushrooms and pat dry. Remove stems and finely chop. Place caps on prepared sheet.
Place the olive oil and chopped garlic in a pan and saute until aromatic.
Add the chopped stems to the pan and saute for 2 minutes. Add the corn bread and mix together.
Remove from heat. Add the coriander and a little grated Parmesan. Mix well.
Heap the filling into the mushroom caps and sprinkle with grated Parmesan to taste.
Bake until caps are cooked and the filling is golden brown.

name: Phyllo Dough Stars with Egg Cream
instructions: For the syrup, heat sugar and water and simmer until thickened for 15 minutes.
Let syrup cool.
Whisk egg yolks with a fork and add syrup.
Stir well and cook over low heat for 5 minutes.
Chop almonds in a food processor and add to the mixture.
Roll out dough on the counter and cut rectangles with a pastry cutter.
Fill each rectangle with a tablespoon of egg mixture.
Fold dough edges over pastry and roll into a packet. Brush with butter to help brown a little when baking.
Place on a baking tray lined with parchment paper and bake for 7-10 minutes at 200°C (approximately 400°F).
Sprinkle pastries with powdered sugar.

name: Paleo Soft Molasses Spice Cookies

ingredients.prep: buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores
ingredients.name: arrowroot flour
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup arrowroot flour (buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores)

ingredients.prep: buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores
ingredients.name: coconut flour
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup coconut flour (buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores)

ingredients.name: unsalted butter
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup unsalted butter (softened; or use coconut oil)

ingredients.prep: for dough; buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores
ingredients.name: coconut sugar
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup coconut sugar (for dough; buy at natural foods stores and some grocery stores)

ingredients.prep: for coating; buy at natural food stores and some grocery stores
ingredients.name: coconut sugar
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons coconut sugar (for coating; buy at natural food stores and some grocery stores)

instructions: Whisk together almond flour, arrowroot flour, coconut flour, baking soda, ginger, cinnamon, salt, and cayenne in a medium bowl. Set aside.

Put butter, coconut sugar, and molasses in a medium bowl. Beat with a mixer on low speed to blend; then increase speed to medium-high and beat until light and fluffy, scraping down sides of bowl occasionally. Beat in egg until blended.

Stir dry ingredients into molasses mixture until well blended. Scrape dough onto a sheet of plastic wrap or parchment paper and pat into a disk. Wrap dough and freeze until firm and very cold, about 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F with racks in upper and lower third of oven.

Line 2 sheet pans with parchment paper. Put coconut sugar for coating in a small bowl. Using a 1-ounce cookie scoop (or measuring out about 2 Tbsp.), create a ball of dough. Drop dough into bowl of sugar and toss lightly with fingertips to coat. Set on a parchment-lined sheet pan. Repeat to shape remaining cookies, arranging them about 2 inches apart (9 per sheet). Sprinkle any remaining sugar over cookies.

Bake cookies on racks in upper and lower third of preheated oven for 6 minutes. Switch pan positions and continue to bake until cookies are dry when lightly touched and a bit darker at edges, 6-7 minutes more.
Cool cookies on sheet pans 5 minutes. Using a wide spatula, transfer cookies from pans to a cooling rack and let cool completely, about 15 minutes.
Serve cookies, or store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 3 days.

name: Date, Coconut, and Spices Truffles
instructions: Melt the coconut oil and cacao butter in a double boiler.
Place in a food processor and add the dates and chop.
Add the cocoa powder, cinnamon, vanilla seeds, and ras el hanout and puree until smooth.
Spread the paste on a plate and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Once chilled, divide into spoonful-sized portions. Shape into balls using your hands.
Cover with cocoa powder.
Store in the refrigerator, but leave at room temperature when about to serve.

name: Spicy Christmas Biscuits
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Grease 3 large baking sheets and line with parchment paper.
For the cookies: In a saucepan, heat the butter, brown sugar and honey until the butter melts. Set aside.
In a bowl, mix the flours, baking powder, ginger, cinnamon and cocoa powder. Mix in the egg and combine with butter mixture. Beat until smooth.
Form a dough ball and roll out.
Cut out the cookies with cookie cutters and place on the baking sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
For the frosting: In a bowl, beat the egg, egg white, powdered sugar and lemon juice with an electric mixer for 10 minutes until firm, thick and white.
If the frosting is too thin, add more powdered sugar. If too thick, add more egg white and beat the mixture well.
After the cookies are cool, place the frosting in a piping bag and decorate to taste.

name: Chai Spiced Carrot Cake
instructions: Place cream cheese, butter and half and half in blender. Add confectioners sugar 1 cup at a time on speed 4 (puree) scraping down sides, if needed. Add crystallized ginger and pulse on speed 2 (chop) 6-7 times. Refrigerate 2 hours.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 9 x 13 pan with cooking spray.
Mix carrots, sugars, eggs and oil in bowl of KA Stand Mixer. Blend on setting 3 for 1 minute.

Combine dry ingredients in medium bowl. whisk to combine. Add to carrot mixture and mix on setting 3 for 2 minutes. Pour into prepared pan and bake 40-45 minutes until tester comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool before icing.
Ice cake and serve immediately. Can be made ahead and stored in refrigerator 6 hours.

name: Braised Lamb Shanks

ingredients.name: jar bertolli vineyard premium collections fire roasted tomato with cabernet sauvignon sauce
ingredients.fullName: 1 jar bertolli vineyard premium collections fire roasted tomato with cabernet sauvignon sauce

ingredients.name: ounds sweet potatoes
ingredients.fullName: 2 pounds sweet potatoes (peeled and cut into 2-inch-thick slices)

instructions: Heat Olive Oil in deep 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat and brown lamb, turning once, about 30 minutes. Remove lamb from skillet and set aside.

Add onions to same skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes or until lighty golden. Stir in ginger, garlic, paprika, red pepper flakes and Sauce. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients except potatoes and lamb. Return to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low, then return lamb to skillet. Simmer covered 1 hour.
Season lamb, if desired, with salt and pepper.
Stir in potatoes and simmer covered an additional 1 hour or until potatoes and lamb are tender.

ingredients.name: unsalted butter
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 cups unsalted butter (cut into small pieces, chilled)

ingredients.prep: for crust, use more if needed
ingredients.name: ice water
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup ice water (for crust, use more if needed)

ingredients.prep: such as Haralson, Braeburn, Cortland, McIntosh, Gala, and/or Granny Smith; including different apple varieties will create a more textured pie
ingredients.name: apples
ingredients.fullName: 4 pounds apples (such as Haralson, Braeburn, Cortland, McIntosh, Gala, and/or Granny Smith; including different apple varieties will create a more textured pie)

ingredients.name: brown sugar
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup brown sugar (packed, for pie filling)

ingredients.prep: for sprinkling over top of pie
ingredients.name: granulated sugar
ingredients.fullName: granulated sugar (for sprinkling over top of pie)

name: Beef and Veggie Bibimbap

ingredients.prep: very thinly sliced, boneless short ribs, ribeye, sirloin, or flank steak
ingredients.name: beef
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound beef (very thinly sliced, boneless short ribs, ribeye, sirloin, or flank steak)

ingredients.name: light brown sugar
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons light brown sugar (packed; or use honey)

instructions: Mince garlic. In a large bowl, combine garlic, applesauce, sesame oil, soy sauce, and sugar. Add beef and use your hands to massage marinade into beef. Let marinate 30-60 minutes at room temperature, or up to 24 hours in the refrigerator. (Pro Tip: Shop at an Asian market or grocery store with a service butcher counter for very thinly sliced beef about 1/10-inch thick. It may be labeled as sukiyaki or beef for hotpot. Applesauce helps tenderize the meat. )

Make bibimbap sauce: Mince the garlic. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the garlic, gochujang, brown sugar, sesame oil, water, and rice vinegar. Cover and set aside in refrigerator. (Pro Tip: Gochujang is a Korean hot pepper paste; you can buy it at well-stocked grocery stores, Asian markets, and online.)
Cook rice with water according to package instructions. Set aside and keep warm.
Peel carrots and cut crosswise into 3-inch pieces. Cut pieces lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Stack a few slices at a time and cut into long 1/4-inch-wide matchsticks.

Heat a large cast-iron skillet or other heavy frying pan over medium-high heat. Add half of oil and swirl to coat pan. Add carrots with half of mirin, salt, and soy sauce. Cook, stirring often, until carrots are tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl and cover with foil to keep warm. Repeat cooking with spinach, using remaining oil, mirin, salt, and soy sauce; adding one-third of spinach at a time (pan will be very full); and turning with tongs until spinach wilts, 5-10 minutes total. Transfer spinach to a bowl and cover. Set vegetables aside.

Drain any liquid from cast-iron skillet. Add oil to pan over medium-high heat. Swirl to coat pan, then reduce heat to medium. Quickly fluff cooked rice with a fork, then add to pan, pressing it in for maximum contact over the bottom and 1 inch up the side. Let rice cook undisturbed until it starts to crisp up and turns golden underneath (lift to check), 8-10 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Crack eggs into pan, spacing them a little apart. Cook until whites are set and yolks are done the way you like, 4-5 minutes for softly set; as eggs cook, tilt pan once or twice and spoon oil over yolks. Remove from heat.
Divide rice among serving bowls. Drape with foil and set aside.

Scrape out any bits of rice from cast-iron skillet. Heat pan over medium-high heat. Add half of oil and swirl to coat pan. Add half of marinated meat, lifting it with tongs to drain off some marinade. Cook meat in a single layer, turning once or twice, until lightly browned and just cooked through, 1-3 minutes. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining oil and beef. (Pro Tip: To brown meat, not steam it, make sure the pan is quite hot before adding beef, and cook the meat in batches so the pan isn't overcrowded. You don't need much oil in the pan since the marinade includes oil.)
Arrange beef, carrots, and spinach separately on top of rice. Put a fried egg in the center of each bowl and drizzle with a little reserved bibimbap sauce. Serve more sauce on the side.

name: Savory Blueberry Loaf
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
In a bowl, add the flours with the baking powder and cheese and mix well.
Beat the egg with the milk, oil and salt.
Add the bacon and shallots and mix well. Combine all the ingredients together into a smooth batter.
Line a loaf pan with parchment paper and add the batter.
Bake for 30 minutes.

name: Mexican Tortilla Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat.

Reserve 2 tablespoons onion. Add garlic and remaining onion to pan. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until soft. Add mince. Cook, breaking up mince with a wooden spoon, for 8 minutes or until browned.

Add capsicum, corn and chilli powder. Cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until capsicum is just tender. Stir in diced tomatoes. Reduce heat to medium. Simmer, stirring, for 5 minutes or until mixture is thick. Add half the coriander. Season with salt. Stir to combine. Set aside for 10 minutes to cool.

Place a 6cm-deep, 20cm round springform pan on a baking tray. Place 1 tortilla in base of pan. Spread one-third of the mince mixture over tortilla. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup of cheese. Repeat layers twice with remaining tortillas, mince mixture and cheese, finishing with 1 tortilla. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 15 minutes or until cheese is golden. Set aside for 5 minutes before removing from pan.
Meanwhile, combine chopped tomato, reserved onion and coriander in a bowl. Serve pie with tomato mixture.

name: Four Cheese Roasted Broccolini and Tomato Gluten-Free Pizza

ingredients.name: DiGiorno Ultra-Thin Four Cheese Gluten-Free Pizza
ingredients.fullName: DiGiorno Ultra-Thin Four Cheese Gluten-Free Pizza

instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F and prep the vegetables
Place the pizza in the oven and set the timer for 10 minutes

While the pizza cooks, heat a saucepan over medium-high heat and add the olive oil. Sauté the onions for about 2 minutes, then add the garlic, broccolini and rosemary. Cover and cook for another 8 minutes, or until the broccolini begins to soften
Remove the pizza from the oven and layer on the sliced tomatoes, the broccolini mixture, and the optional garnish of Parmesan
Place the pizza back in the oven and finish baking for 3-5 minutes. Remove the pizza and enjoy!

name: Tagliatelle a la Mariniere
instructions: Add the oil to a skillet on medium heat. Saute the onion, leek, and garlic for 5 minutes.
Add the tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the clams and the peeled shrimp and simmer for a few minutes. Discard any clams that do not open.
Cook the pasta separately in a pot of stock or salted boiling water for about 8 to 10 minutes.
Mix the pasta with the sauce and serve.

name: Bacon-Wrapped Figs With Maple Snakebite Glaze and Goat Cheese and Thyme Dip
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place 4 layers of paper towels on microwave-safe plate. Top with bacon slices. Cover with two more layers of paper towels. Microwave on high 1 to 2 minutes to render fat from bacon but not crisp. While bacon cools, slice each fig twice, starting at stem end, and cutting three-quarters of way to bottom. Stuff each fig with a pecan piece. Wrap a half strip of bacon around each fig and secure with toothpick. Place on foil-lined baking sheet. Bake 10 minutes. Turn. Return to oven for 5 minutes or until bacon is sizzling and begins to crisp. In small bowl, combine syrup and cayenne pepper. Brush mixture over appetizers.
For dip, combine all dip ingredients in small bowl. Cover and chill until serving time.Makes: about 1/2 cup Serve appetizers warm with dip.

name: Southwest Pasta Salad

ingredients.name: Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 2/3 cup Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise

ingredients.name: jalapeno chilies (seeded and finely chopped,
ingredients.fullName: 1 jalapeno chilies (seeded and finely chopped, optional)

ingredients.name: grape tomatoes
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups grape tomatoes (halved or cherry tomatoes, quartered)

ingredients.prep: or 1 cup thawed frozen whole kernel corn
ingredients.name: mexicorn
ingredients.fullName: 11 ounces mexicorn (or 1 cup thawed frozen whole kernel corn)

instructions: Cook bow ties according to package directions; drain and rinse with cold water until completely cool.

In large bowl, combine Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise, sour cream, cilantro, lime juice, jalapeno pepper and salt. Add remaining ingredients; toss well. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Ham, Cheese, and Mushroom Pocket Bread

ingredients.prep: you can substitute vegetable shortening, room temperature
ingredients.name: grams pork lard
ingredients.fullName: 75 grams pork lard (you can substitute vegetable shortening, room temperature)

instructions: In a bowl, add the flour and make a well in the middle. In the middle, pour the salt, baking soda, milk (or water), and lard. Knead 10 minutes until smooth and firm (no longer sticky). Let rest 30 minutes.
Pinch off sections of the dough, roll them out, and fry them for 1 minute on each side in a nonstick skillet.
Open the breads and fill the inside with ham and gorgonzola or lightly sauteed mushrooms and Brie.
Put the pocket bread back into the skillet and heat through until toasted and the cheese has melted.
Serve with onion and diced tomatoes.

name: 5-Ingredient Garlic-Roasted Asparagus
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Crush and finely mince the garlic.
Trim the rough ends from the asparagus and arrange the spears on the baking sheet.
Drizzle the asparagus with olive oil, and sprinkle with salt, black pepper and minced garlic.
Roast the asparagus for 10-12 minutes on middle rack of oven.
Remove the asparagus from the oven when tender.
Serve immediately.

name: Bean & Chorizo Tamales
instructions: Soak corn husks in warm water until soft, about 1 hour. Drain and throughly dry corn husks.

Heat oil in 10-inch skillet and cook onion and chorizo stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent, about 8 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds. Stir in refried beans, adding 1 to 2 tablespoons of water if needed, and cook until heated through; set aside.

For masa dough, dissolve Knorr® Chicken flavor Bouillon in boiling water. Pour water into mixing bowl, then stir in masa harina and baking powder. Beat on medium speed using paddle attachment, until combined. Remove from bowl and set aside. Beat lard on high speed in same bowl until very fluffy. Reduce speed to medium, then add masa mixture, a handful at a time, until mixture is smooth and well combined. Increase speed to high and beat until masa is a soft, thick paste, about about 4 minutes. Cover and set aside.

Spread 1/2 cup masa dough onto each husk. Place 2 tablespoons bean filling on the middle of the masa dough. Fold sides of corn husk to center, wrapping the filling. Fold one end of corn husk up against the seam to seal.

Arrange tamales vertically in steamer basket over a pot over boiling water, top with extra husks. Cover with lid and steam until husks pull away from filling, about 45 minutes. Check water level often and add additional water as necessary to avoid burning tamales. Cool tamales 3 minutes before serving.

name: Pork Country-Style Ribs With Asian Plum Sauce
instructions: Grill ribs over indirect* medium (about 350 degrees F.) heat for 1 hour. Combine sauce ingredients in mini-chopper or food processor. Process until nearly smooth; reserve half of sauce to serve with finished ribs. Brush remaining sauce on ribs; grill for an additional 30 minutes, until ribs are tender and meat pulls from the bone. Heat reserved sauce and serve with ribs.
Serves 6 to 8.

*To grill with indirect heat, bank hot coals on one side or in a ring around the perimeter of the fire grate. For gas grills, pre-heat and then turn off any burners directly below where the food will go. Place ribs on the grill so they are not directly over any coals or gas burners and close grill hood.

name: Marinated Salmon with Spices and Vodka
instructions: Dry salmon with a paper towel, remove fish bones, if any with tweezers.
In a mortar bowl, crush the peppercorns, cumin and coriander seeds.
Combine with sugar, salt and vodka.
Place the salmon in a plate; cover completely with the spices/vodka mixture .
Wrap the plate with plastic and marinate in the fridge for about 24 to 48 hours.
Dry the salmon with a paper towel to remove any remaining seeds.
Place it on a plate and slice it finely.
Mix the sour cream with fresh dill and serve with the salmon.

name: Sausage Sliders with Cran-Apple Slaw

ingredients.name: Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Hot Sausage
ingredients.fullName: 1 package Jimmy Dean® Premium Pork Hot Sausage

ingredients.name: slices sharp cheddar cheese
ingredients.fullName: 4 slices sharp cheddar cheese (cut in half)

ingredients.name: dinner rolls
ingredients.fullName: 8 dinner rolls (large, split, or slider buns)

instructions: Cran Apple Slaw:
Combine ingredients.
Sliders:
Cut sausage roll into 8 slices; shape each slice into small ½-inch-thick patty.
Cook in large skillet over MEDIUM heat 12-14 minutes or until done (160°F), topping with cheese for the last 2 minutes.
Spread cut sides of rolls with mustard, if desired. Fill with sausage patties and slaw.

name: Spicy Pork Chop Sandwiches
instructions: Stir together chili powder, salt, oregano, thyme and pepper. Rub herb mixture onto both sides of chops. Place pork on broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from the heat for 4 minutes. Turn meat; broil 3 minutes more until internal temperature on a thermometer reads 145 degrees F. Place tomato slices on pork; sprinkle with cheese. Broil 1 minute more or until cheese melts. Serve on toasted bun with lettuce.

name: Chocolate Fig Cake

ingredients.name: Sugar In The Raw Organic White
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup Sugar In The Raw Organic White

instructions: Heat oven to 350°F. Spray heavy nonstick 12-cup fluted tube pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl, mix figs and coffee; set aside. In large bowl, beat butter and Sugar In The Raw Organic White with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth and creamy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Slowly add buttermilk. Beat in 1 3/4 cups flour, cocoa, baking soda and baking powder on low speed until mixed. Drain figs, reserving coffee. Slowly mix in reserved coffee. Pour batter into pan. Pat figs dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon flour and toss to coat. Sprinkle over batter in pan. Pull table knife through batter to distribute figs. Bake 40 to 50 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan to cooling rack. Cool completely, about 1 hour.

In 2 small microwavable bowls, melt white baking bar and bittersweet baking bar with a few drops of oil. Drizzle white chocolate over cake with fork. Then drizzle dark chocolate over cake. Let stand until set, about 2 hours. Or refrigerate 15 minutes until completely set.

name: Giant Financier with Blueberries and Almonds
instructions: Preheat oven to 170 degrees Celsius (340 degrees Farenheit)
In a small saucepan melt the butter over low heat until it has a slight smell of hazelnuts and takes a little amber color.
Pass through a fine sieve, set it aside.
In a small salad bowl, mix together the flour, sugar and almond powder.
Whisk the egg whites with a fork, and add them to the flour mixture.
Gradually add the melted butter, mix well.
Pour half the mixture into a 20x20 cm square pan greased and lined with parchment paper.
Sprinkle with frozen blueberries, and add the rest of the batter.
Sprinkle with slivered almonds.
Bake for about 30 minutes until lightly browned.
Let it cool before cutting.
Sprinkle with confectioner's sugar.

name: Grilled Salmon with almond sauce
instructions: In a bowl, mix spices and olive oil to obtain a marinade to put on your pieces of salmon.
Mix almonds, garlic and stale bread.
Add salt and lemon juice and keep mixing, pour in the olive oil net .
Add tarragon and mix.
Put in the refrigerator.
Preheat the griddle few minutes and then lightly spray with olive oil.
Place the salmon skin side and cook. The skin should be crispy and brown .
Return the salmon to cook at lower temperature.
Serve on a plate and place the almond sauce on top with tarragon.

name: Strawberry Cheesecake Brownies

ingredients.name: Pillsbury Family Size Chocolate Fudge Brownie Mix
ingredients.fullName: 18.4 ounces Pillsbury Family Size Chocolate Fudge Brownie Mix

ingredients.name: Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
ingredients.fullName: 14 ounces Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk

instructions: PREPARE brownie mix according to package directions using oil, water and eggs. Bake in 13 x 9-inch pan according to package directions for 20 minutes.
BEAT cream cheese until fluffy in large bowl. Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk. Mix in remaining 2 eggs, lemon juice and vanilla until smooth. Pour evenly over warm brownie.

STIR jam until smooth. Drop by teaspoonfuls over surface of filling. With a knife, swirl jam gently through filling to create marble effect. Bake additional 35 to 40 minutes or until top is lightly browned. Cool 1 hour. Loosely cover and chill in refrigerator for 2 hours or more. Cut into bars.

name: Hot Spinach 'n Artichoke Chicken Bake

ingredients.name: hellmann' or best food real mayonnais
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup hellmann' or best food real mayonnais

ingredients.name: frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
ingredients.fullName: 10 packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

ingredients.name: garlic (finely chopped or 1/4 tsp. garlic powder,
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 teaspoon garlic (finely chopped or 1/4 tsp. garlic powder, optional)

instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°.
 
2. In medium bowl, combine all ingredients except chicken.
 
3. In 13 x 9-inch baking dish, arrange chicken. Evenly top with mayonnaise mixture. Bake uncovered 30 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked and topping is golden brown.

name: Wild Rice Stuffing with Cranberries, Bacon and Pecans

ingredients.name: dried cranberries
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup dried cranberries (OR chopped dried apricots)

instructions: Rinse wild rice in cold water. Drain well; set aside. In a large saucepan, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings in saucepan. Drain bacon; set aside.

Add onion to saucepan; cook until tender, stirring occasionally. Add wild rice; cook and stir for 3 minutes. Add chicken broth, water, sherry and thyme. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in fennel and dried cranberries.

Meanwhile, heat oven to 350 degrees F. Transfer rice mixture to a 2-quart casserole. Cover and bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, stirring once. Stir in pecans and bacon.
Serves 8.

name: Little Quinoa Breads
instructions: In the bowl of the electric mixer or food processor, combine the flours, yeast,  water and salt. Knead for 7-8 minutes to get a nice dough ball.
Let the dough rise covered with a damp cloth in a warm place for 40 minutes, until it doubles its volume.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough and divide it into 7-10 loaves of desired size.
Place the balls on a parchment paper and let rise for 40 minutes (covered with a damp cloth). Meanwhile preheat  the oven to 200 degrees Celsius.
Bake the loaves (depending on size) for 17 to 25 minutes.

name: Herbed Citrus Vinaigrette Dressing

ingredients.name: light olive oil
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup light olive oil (or canola oil)

instructions: Using the KitchenAid® 5 Cup Food Chopper, insert the whisk accessory into the work bowl. Adjust lever to puree mode.
Add basil, oregano, salt, orange juice and lime juice to the work bowl.
Secure the lid and pulse 4 times to combine ingredients.
While pressing the start/pulse button, pour the oil through the drizzle basin, allowing it to stream into the bowl of the Food Chopper and emulsify the dressing. About 30 seconds.
Unused dressing can be stored in refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Caribbean Hot Pot Broth with Papaya Pica Sauce

ingredients.name: chicken stock
ingredients.fullName: 32 ounces chicken stock (Kitchen Basics® Original, 4 cups)

ingredients.prep: such as Scotch bonnet or habanero
ingredients.name: chile pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 whole chile pepper (such as Scotch bonnet or habanero)

ingredients.name: mccormick black pepper, coarse ground
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 teaspoon mccormick black pepper, coarse ground

ingredients.name: Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk
ingredients.fullName: 2 cans Thai Kitchen Coconut Milk (13.66 ounces each)

ingredients.prep: chopped seeded, Substitutions available habanero chile pepper
ingredients.name: scotch bonnet
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup scotch bonnet (chopped seeded, Substitutions available habanero chile pepper)

ingredients.prep: uncooked, Substitutions available other small scallops
ingredients.name: bay scallops
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound bay scallops (uncooked, Substitutions available other small scallops)

ingredients.prep: uncooked, 21 to 25 count, peeled and deveined
ingredients.name: und shrimp
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound shrimp (uncooked, 21 to 25 count, peeled and deveined)

ingredients.prep: or mini red, cut into thin rings Substitutions available red or green bell pepper, diced
ingredients.name: green bell peppers
ingredients.fullName: green bell peppers (or mini red, cut into thin rings Substitutions available red or green bell pepper, diced)

instructions: For the Broth, place ham hocks, onions, carrots and celery in 6-quart stockpot. Cook on medium heat 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add water, chicken stock, chile pepper and seasonings. Salt to taste. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 1 hour, skimming fat occasionally.

Remove cover and simmer 30 minutes, skimming fat occasionally. Remove ham hocks and skim fat. Whisk cornstarch and 1/4 cup water in small bowl. Add to pot with coconut milk. Cook on medium-low to medium heat 30 minutes longer. Skim fat. Stir lime juice into broth.

Meanwhile, for the Papaya Pica Sauce, place all ingredients in food processor. Process on high speed until smooth. Transfer to medium saucepan. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer, uncovered, 10 to 15 minutes. Pour into medium bowl.
Place scallops and shrimp on plates. Place garnishes in bowls.

To serve, pour broth into 6-quart electric hot pot or preheated slow cooker. Allow guests to cook shrimp and scallops in broth. (Seafood should be cooked about 5 minutes or until cooked through, stirring occasionally.)
Let each guest customize their own bowl. Place some rice in bowl then ladle broth and seafood over rice. Stir in some Papaya Pica Sauce and top with remaining garnishes as desired.

Multifunction Electric Pressure Cooker Method (Saves 1 hr. cooking time): Mix cornstarch and 1/4 cup water. Set aside. Heat 1 teaspoon oil on medium sauté setting in pot of multi-function electric pressure cooker (instant pot). Add ham hocks, onions, carrots and celery; cook 5-6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in water, stock, chile pepper and seasonings. Salt to taste. Cover and lock lid into place. Set to cook 45 minutes on high pressure (or Soup setting). Vent pot and release pressure before opening and carefully remove lid. (Check manufacturer’s manual for safe operating instructions.) Remove ham hock; skim fat. Stir in cornstarch mixture and coconut milk. Cook 15 minutes, uncovered, on low sauté setting, stirring occasionally. Stir in lime juice. Allow guests to cook shrimp and scallops in broth, about 5 minutes or until cooked through, stirring occasionally. Customize individual bowls and serve as directed.

name: Honey Crisp Apple Chicken Salad

ingredients.name: Tyson® Grilled & Ready® Applewood Smoke Flavored Chicken Breast Strips
ingredients.fullName: 2 cups Tyson® Grilled & Ready® Applewood Smoke Flavored Chicken Breast Strips

instructions: Cut and wash half a head each of romaine and iceberg lettuce
Core apple and cut into matchsticks
Warm a medium skillet and add enough olive oil to lightly cover bottom of pan
Add 2 cups chicken, cover and cook until warm, about 5 to 8 minutes
Toss lettuces in a bowl with 1 tablespoon balsamic vinaigrette
Place salad in bowl and top with warm chicken, apples, feta cheese and sunflower kernels

name: Gluten-Free Baked Chicken Tenders

ingredients.name: gluten free all purpose flour
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup gluten free all purpose flour

ingredients.name: Corn Flakes Cereal
ingredients.fullName: 2 1/2 cups Corn Flakes Cereal (crushed into fine crumbs)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
Season chicken tenderloins with salt and pepper.
Pro tip: Have some extra time? For juicier chicken tenders, brine them in a 1-4 ratio of kosher salt to water for 15-30 minutes, then pat dry and season with the salt and pepper.
Place gluten-free flour in a medium bowl. In a second bowl, whisk egg until smooth. In a third bowl, combine crushed corn flakes and salt.

Coat a chicken tenderloin thoroughly in flour, then dip it in beaten egg. Place tenderloin in bowl of corn flakes, and turn it until evenly coated. Transfer tenderloin to baking sheet. Repeat this process with remaining chicken.
Spray chicken tenders liberally on one side with cooking spray.
Bake chicken tenders for 13-15 minutes on middle rack of oven, until they are beginning to brown.
Flip tenders and spray once more with cooking spray. Continue baking for an additional 12-15 minutes, until crust is golden and crispy and chicken is cooked through.
Check to see that chicken tenders are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow chicken tenders to cool slightly. Transfer to a plate and serve immediately.

name: Baked Cheddar Chicken Breasts
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Combine flour, garlic salt, and white pepper in a shallow bowl.
Whisk together egg, buttermilk, sour cream, and melted butter in a separate shallow bowl until smooth.
Combine cheddar cheese, crushed cornflakes, Parmesan, and parsley in a third shallow bowl.
Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack inside baking sheet.

Pat chicken dry and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Working in an assembly line, coat a chicken breast in flour mixture and shake off excess. Next, dip chicken in egg mixture and let excess drip away. Finally, dredge chicken in cornflake mixture and transfer to prepared baking sheet. Repeat with rest of chicken.
Bake chicken 35-40 minutes, until crust is crisp and golden and chicken is cooked through and has reached an internal temperature of 165°F.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Transfer to a plate and serve immediately.

name: Chocolate Chips
instructions: In a bowl, add the flour and make a well in it. Add the butter, shortening, sugar, milk, honey, salt, and eggs. Mix well until a smooth batter forms.
Cover the dough with flour and sprinkle with baking powder.
Using a spatula, gently fold in the baking powder and flour until completely blended.
Form into a ball and allow to rest in the refrigerator for about 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Take the dough from the refrigerator, flatten onto a surface and divide in 3 portions.
Divide the chocolate in 3 parts.
Roll out the 3 portions of dough.
Spread a portion of the chocolate on the first portion of dough.
Cover with the second portion of dough, then spread this with chocolate.
Cover with the remaining dough and chocolate.
Press down, divide in two, and fold over. Repeat this action until the chocolate is completely blended into the dough.
Knead into balls, cut into pieces about the size of gnocchi and shape into small balls.
Place on a lined baking tray, well spaced out.
Before baking, gently flatten with the palm of your hand, and then bake for 12 to 14 minutes.

name: Roasted Bream with Vegetables
instructions: With a sharp knife, make several shallow cuts in the top of the gilt-head bream.
Season fish with salt and pepper. Insert slices of sausage in the shallow cuts.
In a baking dish, arrange sliced onions, tomatoes and unpeeled, crushed garlic cloves.
Place the bream and cilantro in the middle.
Drizzle with olive oil. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F).
Halfway through cooking, baste fish with a little white wine.
When fish is done, remove from baking dish and cook potatoes and carrots for a few additional minutes, until knife tender.

name: Chocolate Pistachio Cake
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400F
2. Start by preparing the cake. Beat the 4 egg whites until they form stiff peaks. While continuing to beat, add the yolks followed by the flour and sugar.
3. Pour the batter into a jelly roll pan and bake at 400F for about 10 minutes.
4. Cut the cake into two squares and place one in a square cake pan if using a square pan. You can also cut the cake with cookie cutters (round / square / rectangle).
5. Next start the mousse. Melt the dark chocolate with the milk in a double boiler. Soften the gelatin sheets in some water and add them to the chocolate. Let the mixture cool.
6. Whip the cream and then mix it with the chocolate.
7. Spread the chocolate mixture over the first cake layer. Place the second cake layer on the chocolate mousse. Refrigerate for least for 1 hour.
8. The next step will be making the creme anglaise. First, combine the milk and pistachio paste in a saucepan and bring them to boil.

9. Whisk the egg yolks and sugar in a bowl. Pour the boiling milk over the eggs and return the mixture to the saucepan. Cook until it thickens and becomes custard-like. Soften the sheets of gelatin in some water and add them to the creme anglaise. Let it cool.
10. Whip the cream and mix it with the creme anglaise. Pour it over the cake and refrigerate overnight.

11. Prepare the topping after chilling the cake overnight. Heat the chocolate with the cream until melted and smooth. Soften the gelatin sheets in some water and then add them to the chocolate. Mix well, let cool, then pour over the cake. Refrigerate.

name: Baked Buffalo Chicken Tenders

ingredients.prep: or panko breadcrumbs, if you prefer a crunchy coating
ingredients.name: all purpose flour
ingredients.fullName: 2/3 cup all purpose flour (or panko breadcrumbs, if you prefer a crunchy coating)

ingredients.name: oneless skinless chicken breasts
ingredients.fullName: 3 boneless skinless chicken breasts (divided into 10 tenders)

instructions: Line baking dish or cookie sheet with aluminum foil, and spray it lightly with cooking spray. Coat chicken tenders thoroughly in a mixture of the flour (or panko breadcrumbs), cayenne, paprika, garlic powder, and salt. Shake off excess flour or panko breadcrumbs.
Place chicken strips onto the prepared baking sheet. Refrigerate for at least one hour.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
Whisk together the melted butter and hot sauce in a small bowl. Dip the chicken tenders into the butter mixture and place them back on the baking sheet.

Bake chicken tenders until they are no longer pink in the center, and golden brown on the outside. It should take about 45 minutes. Turn the chicken tenders over halfway during cooking so they cook evenly.
Serve immediately.

name: Cheese and Arugula-Filled Umbrian Breads
instructions: Pour out 200 milliliters of the warm water and add the yeast to it.
In a large bowl, pour in the flour and salt. Make a well in the center and pour in the oil and the yeasty water.
Start mixing and kneading the dough together, adding the rest of the water little by little until you get a ball that is no longer sticky and is now firm.
Divide the dough into 8 sections. Roll each section into a ball, cover with a moist cloth, and let rest 30 minutes.
Roll out each section into a 1/2-centimeter circle.
Heat a heavy-bottomed pot on medium heat for 10 minutes until very hot.

Without oiling the pot, add a piece of the dough and let cook a few minutes. Flip and continue cooking. Adjust the heat level, making sure the dough does not burn. You will know they are done when they have puffed a bit and are golden.
Transfer the hot bread to a waiting towel and repeat with the rest of the dough.
When the bread has cooled enough to handle, slice horizontally and fill with cheese, arugula, and black pepper.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius
Bake the breads about 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted.

name: Chicken & Asparagus Salad

ingredients.name: Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise

ingredients.prep: chopped, or 1/2 teaspoon dried basil leaves, crushed
ingredients.name: fresh basil
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon fresh basil (chopped, or 1/2 teaspoon dried basil leaves, crushed)

ingredients.name: unces asparagus
ingredients.fullName: 12 ounces asparagus (trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces)

ingredients.prep: or yellow or red grape tomatoes, halved
ingredients.name: cherry tomatoes
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup cherry tomatoes (or yellow or red grape tomatoes, halved)

instructions: In small bowl, combine Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Light Mayonnaise, sour cream, green onions, basil, lemon juice, salt and lemon peel. Chill until ready to serve.
In 10-inch skillet, bring 1/2 cup water to a boil. Add asparagus; cover and cook 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain and rinse with cold water until completely cool.
In large salad bowl, combine greens, chicken and tomatoes. Arrange salad mixture on plates; top with asparagus. To serve, spoon dressing over each salad.
Also terrific with Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise.

name: Chicken Picadillo Dinner

ingredients.name: knorr reduc sodium chicken flavor bouillon
ingredients.fullName: 2 tablespoons knorr reduc sodium chicken flavor bouillon

instructions:
Heat oil in a large deep nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and brown chicken. Remove and set aside.
 
Add onion and cook over medium heat about 4 minutes or until onion is tender, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook about 30 seconds. Return chicken to skillet and add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally and breaking up tomatoes with a spoon. Reduce heat and simmer covered about 20 minutes until chicken is thoroughly cooked. Skim fat, if desired, before serving.
 
Serve with hot cooked rice and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

name: Granny Smiths’ Pork Skillet

ingredients.prep: OR loin or tenderloin, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
ingredients.name: ound fresh leg pork
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound fresh leg of pork (OR loin or tenderloin, cut into 1/2-inch cubes)

ingredients.prep: cored and sliced into 1/2 inch wedges
ingredients.name: ranny Smith apples
ingredients.fullName: 4 Granny Smith apples (cored and sliced into 1/2 inch wedges)

ingredients.name: dry white wine
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup dry white wine (OR chicken broth)

instructions: Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork and brown on all sides. Add apple slices, cook and stir for 3 minutes, until apples soften. Add 1/2 cup wine, reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add brown sugar, vinegar, cornstarch mixture, Worcestershire, salt and pepper with remaining wine to skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until sauce thickens.

name: Garlic and Herb Lemon Chicken

ingredients.prep: McCormick® Perfect Pinch® Salt Free, & Herb Seasoning
ingredients.name: garlic
ingredients.fullName: 1 tablespoon garlic (McCormick® Perfect Pinch® Salt Free, & Herb Seasoning)

ingredients.name: boneless skinless chicken breast halves
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast halves (thinly sliced)

instructions: Mix flour and Seasoning in shallow dish. Reserve 1 tablespoon. Moisten chicken lightly with water. Coat evenly with remaining flour mixture.

Heat oil in large nonstick skillet on medium heat. Cook 1/2 of the chicken pieces 3 to 4 minutes per side or until golden brown. Repeat with remaining chicken, adding additional oil if necessary. Remove chicken from skillet.

Mix broth, lemon juice and reserved flour mixture in medium bowl until well blended. Add to skillet. Bring to boil, stirring to release browned bits in bottom of skillet. Stirring frequently, cook 5 to 7 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened. Return chicken to skillet; cook until heated through. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve with cooked pasta or rice, if desired.

name: Fig and Brie Turkey Sandwich with Hillshire Farm Naturals® Turkey

ingredients.name: slices Hillshire Farm Naturals® Slow Roasted Turkey Breast
ingredients.fullName: 12 slices Hillshire Farm Naturals® Slow Roasted Turkey Breast

ingredients.name: brie cheese
ingredients.fullName: 8 ounces brie cheese (rind removed and sliced)

instructions: Heat a sandwich press or a grill pan to medium hot. Fold the turkey on the bottom halves of bread. Evenly divide and spread the fig preserves on the top halves of bread with brie slices, onion and spinach.
Place each sandwich between the sandwich press or grill pan and cook until golden brown and the cheese is melted (approx. 3-5 minutes), repeat with remaining sandwiches.

name: Upside-down Shallot and Mushroom Tartlets
instructions: In a heavy-bottomed pan, add the sugar. On low heat, stir constantly until melted then add the butter, continually stirring.
Add the shallots, vinegar, and a few thyme leaves. Simmer on very low heat until the shallots are softened and completely covered in the caramel. Let cool.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Divide the shallot mixture into 4 individual tart pans.
Cut circles of puff pastry a little larger than the tart pans. Top each tart with puff pastry and tuck the edges into the tart pan.
Bake 15 minutes until the pastry is golden and puffed.
Separately, in another skillet, heat a drizzle of olive oil and add the mushrooms, garlic, and a little thyme until softened. Salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Let the tartlets sit for 5 minutes, then unmold them. Flip over so the puff pastry is on the bottom. Top with some of the mushroom mixture and serve.

name: Teriyaki Steak Salad
instructions: Grill the pork chops in a skillet on medium-high for 2 minutes.
Add the 1/4 cup teriyaki sauce and let the pork chops cook for 4 minutes on each side.
Turn off the stove and cut the pork chops into small pieces while disposing of the fat.
Spread  the lettuce, cabbage, and carrot evenly on 2 plates.
Mix the 3 tablespoons teriyaki sauce, lemon juice, olive oil, and pepper in a small bowl to make the dressing.
Add the pork chops to the plates, pour the dressing on top, add the peanuts, and serve.

name: Four Layer Oatmeal Bars

ingredients.prep: OR 1/2 stick Crisco® Baking Sticks Butter Flavor All-Vegetable Shortening
ingredients.name: Crisco Butter Flavor All-Vegetable Shortening
ingredients.fullName: 1/2 cup Crisco Butter Flavor All-Vegetable Shortening (OR 1/2 stick Crisco® Baking Sticks Butter Flavor All-Vegetable Shortening)

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour

ingredients.prep: sliced, peeled fresh, slices cut in half crosswise
ingredients.name: peaches
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 cups peaches (sliced, peeled fresh, slices cut in half crosswise)

ingredients.prep: sliced, peeled, slices cut in half crosswise
ingredients.name: Granny Smith apples
ingredients.fullName: 3/4 cup Granny Smith apples (sliced, peeled, slices cut in half crosswise)

instructions: HEAT oven to 350ºF. Spray a 13 x 9-inch baking pan with no-stick cooking spray.

COMBINE shortening and egg in large bowl; stir with fork until blended. Add oats, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt. Stir until well blended crumbs form. Press 1 3/4 cups of crumb mixture lightly into bottom of prepared dish; reserve remaining crumbs.
BAKE 10 minutes. Cool completely.
COMBINE peaches, pineapple with juice, apple, nuts, sugar, cornstarch and nutmeg in medium saucepan; cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. Cool completely.
INCREASE oven temperature to 375ºF.

COMBINE cream cheese, egg, sugar, lemon juice and vanilla in bowl of electric mixer; beat at medium speed until well blended. Spread over cooled oat layer. Spoon cooled fruit mixture over cheese layer. Spread gently to cover cream cheese. Sprinkle reserved crumbs over fruit.
BAKE 30 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Refrigerate until firm, about 1 hour. Cut into 2 x 1 3/4-inch bars.

name: Carrot Pudding
instructions: In a pot of water, boil and cook the carrots with the cinnamon.
When cooked, drain and mash the carrots.
Mix the cornstarch and sugar.
Mix with the mashed carrots.
Add the lightly beaten eggs, cool melted margarine, and ground cinnamon.
Stir well, and pour in bundt pan coated with caramel.
Boil in the pressure cooker half full of water for approximately for 30 to 35 minutes.
Allow to cool completely in the pan.
Serve cold.

name: The Best Cheesy Hash Brown Casserole from Scratch
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350° F.
Spray a 9 x 13” glass casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Finely mince the onion.
Set a sauce pan over medium heat and add the butter. Once melted, add the minced onion. Cook, stirring frequently with a rubber spatula, for 5-6 minutes, until the onions are soft and translucent.
Sprinkle the flour over the onions and stir to coat. Cook for about a minute, until the flour begins to turn golden and smell toasty.

Slowly stream the chicken broth into the pan while continuing to whisk. Cook the mixture, whisking steadily for 4-5 minutes, until it begins to thicken and bubble. Once bubbling, add the sour cream, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until the sauce is smooth and combined.
Remove the pan from the heat.

Place the hash brown potatoes and half of the shredded cheese in a large mixing bowl. Pour the sauce over the potatoes. Fold the mixture with a rubber spatula, until all the potatoes are thoroughly coated in the sauce. Transfer the mixture to the prepared casserole dish.
Sprinkle the dish evenly with the remaining shredded cheese.
Transfer the casserole dish to the middle rack of the preheated oven.
Bake the potato casserole for 35-40 minutes, until golden brown and bubbling at the edges.
Remove the casserole dish from the oven.
Allow the hash brown casserole to rest for 10 minutes before serving.

name: Egg Circles with Crispy Bacon Salad
instructions: Beat eggs with water.
Add chile pepper and chopped chives and season with salt and pepper.
Drizzle a little oil in a large non-stick frying pan and spread evenly over pan surface with a paper towel.
Heat oil in pan and add small portions of egg mixture, spread into circle shape and fry as if pancakes.
Tip: If using large eggs, recipe will make 4 egg circles. Set aside cooked egg circles.
In the hot pan, fry bacon until crunchy and drain on paper towel.
To serve, arrange eggs and bacon on plates with lettuce.
Season with olive oil vinaigrette and balsamic vinegar.

name: Chocolate and Lavender Rice Pudding
instructions: Put the lavender in a tea ball and let it infuse in the milk and cream over low heat for 20 minutes.
Remove the tea ball. Add the rice, sugar, and chocolate to the milk mixture. Simmer for about 45 minutes and stir regularly with a wooden spoon.
Allow the rice pudding to cool. It will continue absorbing the milk as it sits off the heat.

name: Thai-mex Snapper

ingredients.name: hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup hellmann's or best foods real mayonnaise

instructions: Remove stem and seeds of pasilla chile and toast in dry skillet over medium heat, pressing with spatula and turning until soft and pliable, about 1 minute. Pour 1/2 cup boiling water over chili, cover and soak 10 minutes. Process pasilla chile with soaking liquid in mini food processor or blender; set aside.

Sprinkle snapper with Knorr® Chicken flavor Bouillon. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in deep 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat and cook snapper, flesh-side-down, until golden, about 3 minutes. Remove snapper from skillet and keep warm.

Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in same skillet and cook onion, red pepper and mushrooms, stirring frequently, until golden, about 5 minutes. Stir in ginger, garlic and chile de arbol and cook 30 seconds. Stir in pasilla chili puree and cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 2 minutes. Stir in water and coconut milk. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and add snapper. Simmer covered simmer until snapper flakes with a fork, about 5 minutes . Gently whisk in Hellmann's® or Best Foods® Real Mayonnaise.
Serve, if desired, with chopped fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

name: Dog Cockles With Passion Fruit Vinaigrette
instructions: Wash and brush almonds.
Mix the passion fruit, vinegar, garlic and shallot .
Replace the double blade by emulsifying and initiate .
Pour olive oil.
Add salt and put some pepper.
Refrigerate.
Heat the griddle then remove the dog cockle .
Pour the white wine and add the parsley and pepper.
Dog cockles are cooked when they are open.
Put dog cockles on each plate and add the vinaigrette on top.

name: Happy-Go-Lucky Granola

ingredients.name: sweet almond oil
ingredients.fullName: 1/3 cup sweet almond oil (or any vegetable oil)

instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F and lightly oil a sheet pan
2. In a mixing bowl, combine all the dry ingredients together except for the cinnamon, nutmeg, salt and dried fruits
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the wet ingredients along with the cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
4. Combine the two mixtures and pour onto the sheet pan
5. Bake for 30 minutes stirring every 15 minutes or so to toast evenly
6. If adding dried fruits, add them now
7. Allow to cool and store in an airtight container

name: 3-cheese Stromboli

ingredients.name: jar ragu pasta sauce
ingredients.fullName: 1 jar ragu pasta sauce (1 lb. 8 oz, Old World Style®)

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°. Roll pizza dough into 15 x 11-inch rectangle. Layer provolone cheese over dough, leaving 1-inch border around edges. Evenly spread 1 cup Pasta Sauce over cheese, then evenly sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses.
Roll, starting at longest end, jelly-roll style. Fold in ends and pinch to seal. Arrange stromboli seam-side down on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake 20 minutes or until bread is golden. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing. Serve with remaining Pasta Sauce, heated.

name: Carrot Cake with Currants
instructions: 1. Preheat your oven.
2. Beat the eggs with the sugar. Add the vegetable oil, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Mix. Stir in the flour and baking powder until well combined. Fold in the grated carrots and raisins.
3. Pour the batter into a silicone cake pan and bake for about 45 minutes.
4. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Unmold the cake and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

name: Pork and Pepper Fajitas

ingredients.name: boneless pork loin roast
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless pork loin roast (cut into thin strips)

ingredients.name: green bell pepper
ingredients.fullName: 1 green bell pepper (cut into thin strips)

instructions: Coat large nonstick skillet with nonstick cooking spray; heat skillet over medium-high heat. Stir-fry pork and green pepper in hot skillet for 3 to 4 minutes or until pork is lightly browned. Stir in salsa; heat through.

Wrap tortillas in paper towels. Microwave on HIGH power about 30 seconds or until warm. Spoon pork mixture onto tortillas; sprinkle with cheese. If desired, top wth cilantro or parsley. Fold in ends; roll up tortillas. Serve with additional salsa.

name: Brown Butter Vanilla Bean Mini Doughnuts
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F. Spray the cavities of your Doughnut Pans from the KitchenAid® Professional-Grade Nonstick 6-Cavity Mini Doughnut Pan with a nonstick spray.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter. Continue to cook and stir constantly just until butter begins to turn golden brown and smell nutty. Remove from heat. Transfer to a large bowl and cool slightly before whisking in buttermilk and egg.

In a separate medium bowl, whisk flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and vanilla bean seeds. Whisk flour mixture into the butter mixture until just combined. Spoon about 2 tablespoons batter into each prepared cavity of the Doughnut Pans. You could also use a pastry bag to pipe in the batter if you’d prefer.
Bake doughnuts for 10 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 1 minute in the Doughnut Pans, then transfer to cooling rack to cool completely.
In a small bowl, whisk powdered sugar and heavy cream until a thick glaze forms. Dip one side of each fully cooled doughnut in glaze to coat. Top with sprinkles, if desired.

name: Rice With Bacon And Cabbage

ingredients.prep: Grain, depending on number of people
ingredients.name: rice
ingredients.fullName: rice (Grain, depending on number of people)

instructions: In a pan, place the olive oil, garlic and bacon.
Cook until golden brown. Add the cabbage and stir.
When the cabbage is tender, add the rice and water (2 parts water to 1 part rice).
Bring water to a boil and add the rice. Season with salt. Cook for 13-15 minutes.
Serve with grilled chops.

name: Asian Pork Lettuce Wraps

ingredients.prep: or boneless skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced
ingredients.name: pork tenderloin
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound pork tenderloin (or boneless skinless chicken breasts, thinly sliced)

ingredients.name: I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread
ingredients.fullName: 3 tablespoons I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread

ingredients.prep: sliced, drained and cut into strips
ingredients.name: water chestnuts
ingredients.fullName: 8 ounces water chestnuts (sliced, drained and cut into strips)

instructions: Combine honey, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger and hot pepper sauce in glass bowl; add pork and toss to coat. Cover and marinate 30 minutes in refrigerator.

Remove pork from marinade, reserving marinade. Working in batches, melt 1 tablespoon I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook 1/2 of the pork, stirring occasionally, 4 minutes or until pork is done. Remove pork from skillet and keep warm; repeat.

Meanwhile, combine cornstarch with 1 tablespoon cold water. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons Spread in same skillet and stir in reserved marinade and cornstarch mixture. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring frequently, 1 minute. Stir in carrots, stirring occasionally, 2 minutes or until crisp-tender. Stir in garlic, scallions and water chestnuts and cook, stirring frequently, 1 minute. Return pork to skillet and heat through.
Evenly spoon mixture into lettuce cups.

name: Pork Cacciatore

ingredients.prep: OR tenderloin OR pork leg, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
ingredients.name: ound boneless pork loin
ingredients.fullName: 1 pound boneless pork loin (OR tenderloin OR pork leg, cut into 3/4-inch cubes)

ingredients.name: dry red wine
ingredients.fullName: 1/3 cup dry red wine (OR beef broth)

instructions: Sprinkle pork cubes with salt and pepper. In large nonstick skillet, heat olive oil over medium high heat; add pork and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside. Add onion, garlic, celery and carrot to skillet; cook, stirring, until onions are soft, about 5 minutes. Return pork to skillet with mushrooms, tomatoes, wine and herbs, stir well. Cover and simmer 10 minutes.
Serves 4.

name: Air Fryer Pork Belly Tacos
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 325°F according to manufacturer’s directions.
Meanwhile, cut pork belly into ½-inch-thick slices. Then cut slices crosswise into ¾-inch pieces; transfer to a medium bowl. Lightly spray pork pieces with cooking spray; toss.
In a small bowl combine chile powder, sugar and cumin. Sprinkle over pork pieces; toss until evenly coated.

Lightly spray the air-fryer basket with cooking spray. Place pork pieces in the basket. Cook for 16 to 18 minutes or just until pork pieces begin to crisp, shaking pork pieces in basket or tossing with tongs after every 6 minutes.
To assemble tacos, spoon pork pieces on warm tortillas. Top with desired toppers. Serve with lime wedges.

name: Almond Pastries
instructions: Use a food processor to grind the two types of almonds with the sugar into a fine consistency.
Place this mixture in a bowl and add the egg white gradually. The consistency of the dough should be quite firm.

Add the orange flower water and place the dough into a pastry bag, previously wet and wrung, and pipe out the cookies directly onto a baking sheet lined with wax paper. You may decorate the cookies with candied fruits, coffee grains, almonds, or as you wish.
Let the cookies dry for several hours or overnight.
Bake the cookies at 200C for approximately 10 minutes, until golden, yet still soft.

name: Shrimp Skewers with Lime and Garlic
instructions: Put all ingredients except the Fleur de sel in a salad bowl and mix. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Put 4 shrimp on each skewer and grill them quickly on a barbecue. As soon as the shrimp are pink, they are cooked and you can turn them over.
Sprinkle with fleur de sel and serve with basmati rice.

name: Chocolate Chip and Pomegranate Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Mix and sift flours, salt, and baking soda in a bowl, set aside.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs. Add the brown sugar and stir until obtaining a homogeneous mixture.
Pour in the vanilla extract, then add the Greek yogurt and the oil.
Mash the bananas, and mix with lemon juice and zest.
Mix the flour mixture with the mashed bananas and milk. Stir well until getting a creamy mixture.
Gently stir in the chocolate chips and pomegranate berries.
Pour spoonfuls of batter into cupcake pans without filling completely.
Bake for 15 to 18 minutes.
Let cool before unmolding.

name: Red Fruit Ice Cream Cake

ingredients.prep: or similar red fruit for garnish
ingredients.name: handful cherries
ingredients.fullName: 1 handful cherries (or similar red fruit for garnish)

instructions: Defrost the raspberries.
Line the base of a springform cake tin (21 centimeters) with parchment paper.
Crush the biscuits and place in a bowl with the coconut, cinnamon, and melted butter.
Mix all the ingredients together and spread onto the cake tin base, pressing down with the back of a spoon. Set aside in the refrigerator.
Place the egg whites, raspberries, sugar, vanilla, and lemon drops into a bowl or food mixer. Whisk until smooth and firm.
Place the raspberry mousse over the biscuit base and level the surface.
Place in the freezer for at least 4 hours.
Leave in the freezer until ready to serve. Decorate with cherries or other red fruits.
Store in the freezer and treat as an ice cream.

name: Apple Maple Raisin Pie

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 2 2/3 cups Pillsbury BEST All Purpose Flour

ingredients.prep: OR 1 stick Crisco® Baking Sticks All-Vegetable Shortening
ingredients.name: Crisco All-Vegetable Shortening
ingredients.fullName: 1 cup Crisco All-Vegetable Shortening (OR 1 stick Crisco® Baking Sticks All-Vegetable Shortening)

ingredients.name: apples
ingredients.fullName: 9 cups apples (peeled, cored, quartered, about 2 1/2 pounds)

ingredients.name: Pillsbury BEST Unbleached All Purpose Flour
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup Pillsbury BEST Unbleached All Purpose Flour

instructions: HEAT oven to 375ºF.

CRUST - 
COMBINE flour and salt in medium bowl. Cut in shortening using pastry blender or two knives just until mixture forms pea-sized chunks. Sprinkle with water, one tablespoon at a time. Toss lightly with fork until dough forms a ball. Divide dough into two equal parts. Press between hands to form two 5 to 6-inch "pancakes."

FLOUR "pancakes" lightly on both sides. Roll one "pancake" between sheets of waxed paper (or plastic wrap) on dampened countertop for bottom crust. Peel off top sheet of waxed paper. Trim 1" larger than upside-down 10 inch pie plate. Flip into pie plate. Remove other sheet. Trim edge even with pie plate. Moisten edge of pastry with water.

FILLING  - 
TOSS apples and raisins in large bowl with syrup, flour, salt, cream, cinnamon and cardamom. Mound filling in pie shell.

ROLL top crust same as bottom using second "pancake" to 1/8-inch thick. Peel off top sheet of waxed paper. Flip onto filled pie. Remove other sheet of waxed paper. Trim 1/2 inch beyond edge of pie plate. Fold top edge under bottom crust. Flute. Brush crust with milk. Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape.

BAKE 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling. DO NOT OVERBAKE. Cover pie loosely with foil to prevent over-browning, if necessary. Cool at least 1 hour before serving.

name: Green Tea Macarons
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F(or 375°F for convection oven).Combine powdered sugar, almond flour and 2 teaspoons green tea powder in medium bowl; set aside.

Add egg whites and granulated sugar to bowl of KitchenAid®Artisan Mini Stand Mixer. Attach bowl and Wire Whip to mixer. Gradually turn to Speed 10and whip until egg whites form stiff peaks. Remove Wire Whip and replace with Flat Beater.  Add almond mixture. Turn to Speed 1 and mix until combined.

Transfer mixture to piping bag fitted with medium round tip. Line baking sheets with parchment paper or silicone mats. Pipe batter onto sheets in ½-inch-diameter circles, 1-inch apart. Batter should yield about 60 cookies. Let stand 10 minutes before baking.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until crisp and lightly browned. Cool completely on wire rack.
Add icing and 1 teaspoon green tea powder to mixer bowl. Attach bowl and Flat Beater to mixer. Turn to Speed 2 and mix 2 minutes or until well blended.
Assemble macaroons using about 1 teaspoon filling for each cookie sandwich. Press together gently.

name: Zucchini, Almond, and Coconut Bread
instructions: Preheat the oven to 360°F.
Grease a bundt cake pan and dust with flour. Set aside.
In a bowl, beat the eggs with the sugars, lemon zest and olive oil with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
Add the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, baking soda and spices) and mix until well incorporated.
Add the almond, coconut, and zucchini, stirring well.
Pour the batter into the cake pan and bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Let cool for 10 minutes and remove from the pan.

name: Chocolate Chip Cookies

ingredients.prep: mascabado, may substitute dark brown sugar
ingredients.name: grams sugar
ingredients.fullName: 85 grams sugar (mascabado, may substitute dark brown sugar)

instructions: Preheat oven to 190 Celsius.
Cream the butter together with the brown and white sugars. Add the egg and vanilla and mix well to combine.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to the wet ingredients and mix slightly to incorporate.
Form into balls and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes, until lightly golden around the edges.

name: Pork Chops with Barley-Orange Stuffing
instructions: In a small saucepan combine barley, onion, water, bouillon granules, garlic and pepper. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Remove from heat; let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Stir in green pepper, orange juice concentrate, and orange peel. Mix well. Stir in bread crumbs.

Make a horizontal slit in each chop, forming a pocket. Do not cut all the way through. Stuff chops with barley mixture; press to close pocket. Brown stuffed chops in large heavy skillet over medium-high heat, about 5 minutes on each side. Add 1/2 cup water to skillet, lower heat to a simmer, cover and let chops simmer for 10 minutes until internal temperature on a thermometer reads  145 degrees Fahrenheit, followed by a 3-minute rest time. Serve immediately.

name: Pasta With Spinach And Goat Cheese
instructions: Cook the pasta in water until it is al dente.
Once the pasta is ready, place it in cold water, strain and set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet on medium heat. Sprinkle salt and black pepper on the chicken breast and cook until it has a light golden color on each side.
Add the pasta, chicken, goat cheese, and parsley to a large salad bowl.
Add the pesto sauce and toss well. Add the spinach and serve.

name: Frozen Fruit Swirled Cheesecake Pops

ingredients.name: Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
ingredients.fullName: 1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk

ingredients.name: Smucker’s Natural Strawberry Fruit Spread
ingredients.fullName: 1/4 cup Smucker’s Natural Strawberry Fruit Spread

instructions: BEAT cream cheese, sweetened condensed milk and yogurt in large bowl on medium speed with electric mixer until smooth.

DIVIDE mixture evenly into cups. Swirl 1 teaspoon fruit spread into each cup. Combine graham cracker crumbs and butter in small bowl. Divide evenly into each cup, pressing gently into cheesecake mixture. Insert wooden sticks into center of each.
FREEZE 4 hours or until firm. Remove from molds or plastic cups before serving.

name: Mushroom Risotto
instructions: Blanch the mushrooms in 1/2 liter of salted water for 5 minutes. Drain them and keep their blanching liquid.
In a large saucepan, sauté onion, garlic and finely chopped parsley in 2 tablespoons of fresh cream.
Add the rice, mushrooms, the rest of the cream, mascarpone and broth. Add the mushroom blanching liquid, ladle by ladle, letting it absorb between each addition and stirring constantly.
Season. Cover on medium heat until rice is cooked and the sauce is creamy (at least 45 minutes).
Add the grated parmesan cheese. Stir well.
Serve warm.

name: Sea Salt Chocolate Chunk Cookies
instructions: Add butter and sugars to Bowl of KitchenAid® Artisan Stand Mixer. Attach Bowl and Flat Beater to Mixer.  Turn to Speed 2 and mix 2 minutes or until smooth. Continuing on Speed 2, add egg and vanilla; mix until well blended. Stop and scrape bowl.

Combine flour, baking soda and salt in separate bowl. Turn Mixer to Stir and add flour mixture; mix 1 minute or until just combined. Stop Mixer and add chocolate. Stir 20 seconds or until just combined. Refrigerate dough at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Use 2-ounce (56 ml) scoop (or a ¼ cup measure) to portion cookie dough onto parchment paper-lined baking sheet.  Bake 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

name: Grilled Salmon With Citrus-tomato Salsa

ingredients.name: jalapeno pepper (finely chopped, seeded,
ingredients.fullName: 2 teaspoons jalapeno pepper (finely chopped, seeded, optional)

ingredients.name: i can't believe it's not butter! all purpose sticks
ingredients.fullName: 4 tablespoons i can't believe it's not butter! all purpose sticks

instructions: Combine tomatoes, oranges, green onions, 4 tablespoons cilantro and jalapeno pepper in large bowl. Season, if desired, with salt and ground black pepper; set aside.

Blend I Can't Believe It's Not Butter!® Spread, remaining 2 tablespoons cilantro and, if desired, salt and pepper to taste in small bowl. Grill or broil salmon, brushing with cilantro spread, until salmon is opaque, turning once. Serve salsa with salmon.

name: Roast Turkey Breast with Italian Herbs

ingredients.name: Shady Brook Farms® Fresh Bone-In Turkey Breast
ingredients.fullName: 1 Shady Brook Farms® Fresh Bone-In Turkey Breast (about 7 pounds)

instructions: Heat oven to 325°F.
Remove turkey from bag; remove gravy packet.
Rinse turkey and pat dry.
Place breast-side up on rack in shallow roasting pan.
Brush with oil and season with Italian seasoning, salt and pepper.
Roast, following timing chart on package.
When turkey is golden brown, cover loosely with aluminum foil to prevent over-browning.
When thermometer inserted into thickest part of turkey breast (without touching bone) reads 170°F, remove turkey from oven.
Pour pan drippings into measuring cup and skim off fat. Let turkey rest 10 minutes before carving.
While turkey is resting, pour contents of gravy packet into a small saucepan and heat over medium high heat, whisking constantly until gravy boils.
Whisk in 1/4 cup pan drippings, adding more if you prefer thinner gravy.
Carve turkey and serve with gravy.

name: Sourdough Blinis

ingredients.prep: or 60 gr. if sugar was used
ingredients.name: grams buckwheat flour
ingredients.fullName: 70 grams buckwheat flour (or 60 gr. if sugar was used)

instructions: Heat the milk and add the yeast, stirring until it dissolves completely. Add the sourdough starter and mix well. Add the flour and buckwheat flour along with the agave.
Cover the batter and allow to rise until doubled in volume and bubbly, approximately 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
Separate the eggs and add the yolks to the batter. Set aside for 1 hour.
Beat the egg whites to form stiff peaks and fold into the batter.

Heat a flat skillet and melt 1/2 tablespoon of butter. Ladle the batter onto the skillet, creating small rounds. Let cook for a few seconds on one side before flipping, then wait a few seconds more and removing from the pan.
Keep warm until serving.

name: Taro Croquette
instructions: 1. peel off the skin of the taro root and slice it in thin pieces, about 1/4 inch thick and steam it until a chopstick goes through smoothly.
2. soak the chicken in soy sauce and mirin mixture for 5 minutes.
3. in a food processor, ground the chicken, green onion, and garlic. season with a little salt and pepper.
4. mash the taro root with a potato masher or with a fork until it looks like mash potatoes
5. add the chicken and mix it into the taro well.
6. finally, shape it into a croquette and do a dusting with panko. the stuff is sticky so keep a bowl of water near and moisten your hands with each shaping.
7. fry with oil until it turns golden brown.

name: Christophe Felder's Chocolate Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 410F.
Finely chop the chocolate and melt it in a double boiler with the butter.
Mix until smooth.
Crack the eggs into a bowl, add the sugar and whisk everything until pale and fluffy.
Add the chocolate and butter mixture, continue whisking.
Sift the flour and the cocoa powder over this mixture.
Mix until smooth.
Fill the muffin tins with the batter.
Bake for 12 minutes.

When the muffins are done, let them cool for a few minutes before removing from the tin. To finish, simply melt the remaining chocolate in a double boiler and then either dip the top of the muffin in it or drizzle over the top.

name: Mussels with Ham, Peppers and White Wine
instructions: In a saucepan, heat olive oil and add chopped onion, peppers and ham.
Cook for a few minutes until vegetables are slightly tender.
Add white wine and simmer until the wine evaporates.
In a separate saucepan, add scrubbed mussels and a pinch of salt and cook over low heat.
As soon as the mussels open, remove from heat.
Place mussels in serving dish.
Pour sauce over mussels and serve immediately.

name: BBQ Pork Shoulder Steamed Bun

ingredients.name: pork shoulder
ingredients.fullName: 4 pounds pork shoulder (sliced thinly, and marinated overnight)

ingredients.name: bunches cilantro stems
ingredients.fullName: 1 1/2 bunches cilantro stems (and leaves, roughly chopped)

instructions: 1. For the Hoisin Mayonnaise: In a small bowl, combine the hoisin and mayonnaise; mix until well combined and set aside.

2. For the BBQ Pork Marinade: Place the garlic, ginger, and lemongrass in the bottom of the Vitamix container, add cilantro and sugar in alternating layers. Add the sesame oil, mirin and soy sauce to the top of the cilantro-sugar blend. Turn on the Vitamix and using the plunger, agitate the mix so that it begins to incorporate and blend well. When you have the consistency of a rough pesto, add in the fish sauce, honey, and black pepper. Buzz again to fully incorporate.

3. Cut the pork shoulder into 2-by 4-by 6-inch blocks. Slice the pork against the grain into 1/8” slices Alternatively, you can freeze the blocks of pork until solid and slice to 1/8” thickness on a deli slicer to achieve uniform cuts.
4. Marinate the sliced pork in just enough BBQ Pork Marinade to lightly and evenly coat the slices overnight.

5. Start a charcoal grill. As the grill is coming to temperature, remove the pork slices from any excess marinade and accumulated juices. Cook on a hot grill turning once to finish, so that both sides have a slight char and are cooked to medium or medium rare.
6. Remove the slices from the grill and hold warm. Just before service, julienne the pork slices, and continue to hold warm.

7. For Pickling Liquid: Bring all ingredients to a simmer and whisk to combine. Pour the warm pickling liquid over cut vegetables and cool fully before serving. Note: If using soft vegetables, such as thinly sliced cucumber, salt the slices and place into cooled pickling liquid for four or five minutes.
8. For Pickled Cucumber: Add cucumbers to a non-reactive container. Pour over enough Pickling Liquid to cover. Seal containers and reserve until needed.
9. Mix equal portions of the micro mint, Thai basil, and cilantro in a bowl and cover with a damp towel until ready to use.

name: Coffee and Mayo Shortbread

ingredients.prep: dissolved in a small cup of milk
ingredients.name: instant coffee
ingredients.fullName: 2 teaspoons instant coffee (dissolved in a small cup of milk)

instructions: In a bowl, beat the butter with the sugar until light and fluffy.
Add the mayonnaise and mix well.
Add the flour alternating with the coffee milk.
Work the ingredients into a dough with the appearance of shortcrust pastry.
Add the chocolate chips and mix well.
Cover the bowl with plastic film and allow to rest in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
Roll out the dough on a floured surface, and cut out the desired shapes.
Place on a parchment paper-lined baking pan and sprinkle with powdered sugar.
Bake for 13 minutes.
Leave to cool completely before removing from the pan and store in a metal container.

name: Chicken and Broccoli Tagliatelle
instructions: Cut the chicken breasts into thick strips and season them with lemon juice and salt. Let them marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Boil water and a pinch of salt in a saucepan. Once the water begins to boil, add the tagliatelle.
Cook the tagliatelle for 5 minutes, then add the broccoli.
Once the pasta is cooked, the broccoli will also be finished.
While the pasta is cooking, heat 5 or 6 tablespoons of olive oil in a frying pan.
Put a saucepan with water and salt to boil. When it starts boiling, add the tagliatelle. After 5 minutes, add the broccoli. When the pasta is cooked, the broccoli will be too.
While the pasta is cooking, heat 5 or 6 tablespoons of olive oil in a frying pan. Once hot, add the chicken breasts and stir in the garlic with a wooden spoon.
Let the chicken brown well on one side and then turn it to brown again.
Drain the pasta and the broccoli very well. Place it in a large bowl and add the cooked chicken, removing the garlic.
Add the olives and stir gently.

name: Apple Brie Crostini
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly brush each baguette round with extra virgin olive oil and bake for 8-10 minutes or until just beginning to brown.

Position the slicing disc in the work bowl of a KitchenAid® Pro Line® 16 cup Food Processor with the slice setting set all the way to the right for thick slices. Place the apple pieces vertically into the feed tube.
Spread 1 tsp Brie on each crostini, top with one apple slice, and drizzle 1/4 teaspoon of honey over top. Sprinkle with walnuts evenly then garnish with the chives.
